Reviews.Title: “Long weekend break at the Bellevue Hotel Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: JanTFishguard
Reviews.Content: 4 of us stayed at the hotel in December for a 60th birthday, after reading the reviews on different sites (After we had booked) we were a little worried with stories of mice, cramped rooms and unfriendly staff. Well the rooms were not large, but everything you would need, bar a kettle, which is unusual these days, but we got on fine, staff marvellous really help full and not a mouse to be seen. All you could eat breakfasts "brill" set us up for the day. Train station just across the road easy journey to and from the airport. Next door a lovely little bar, with a very friendly barman. Tram stop out side hotel, restaurants all around and everything you would need within walking distance. If I were to return to Amsterdam, I would stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Just got back”
Reviews.Author: Saudi2Africa
Reviews.Content: Since i was booking last minute and arriving during tulip season last week, my options were fewer. Most of the available hotels were either dorm style or quite pricey. Fortunately, I located this hotel on TA. Amongst all the rave reviews, I always make a point to read what the unhappy customers complaints were. I arrived at 3:30 a.m on the train due to flight delays. I walked about three minutes to the hotels CONVENIENT location where the friendly and efficient night auditor handed me a room key and my wifi password. In no time I was fast asleep in a spotlessly clean and comfortable room at a fair price. Exactly what I was looking for. You can't go wrong here.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel, top location, great base for visiting amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: kyla85
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the bellevue 2 weeks ago with my husband on a 2 night break. I had originally booked here because of the positive reviews I had read, and I am pleased to say they were right. The hotel location is fantastic, within very reasonable walking distance of everything, and my hubby and I walked everywhere! The train station is across the street, and could be seen from our room but we were not disturbed by it, and the trams ran right outside the hotel, and again created no disruption. the rooms are a bit small, yes, however they possess everything necessary , and to be honest we spent very little time actually in our room. there is a double bed (ours was 2 singles pushed together, but no problem again) a small wardrobe, a dressing table area, a free safe, and a flat screen tv in case you fancy it! the ensuite was tiny, yet managed to fit everything full size in without it seeming cramped which was mad, and the shower over the bath was amazing! the interaction we had with the staff was minimal, just check in and out, but they were perfectly polite to us. we did not use the small cafe area on the ground floor for breakfast, instead venturing out to 1 of the thousands of food places within minutes walk of the bellevue, but it always smelt nice when we passed, and was pretty much always busy. if i ever returned to amsterdam I would stay here again, and I fully recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “weekend break”
Reviews.Author: Megan M Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: stay were not the friendliest but didn't let that ruin my weekend - will stay here again. good location

Reviews.Title: “Bellevue Hotel, Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Ladythegn
Reviews.Content: The Bellevue is a clean, comfortable and cosy hotel. The en-suite room we had was small but perfectly formed and very quiet and secure. The staff at reception were friendly and knowledgeable. The small restaurant/cafe where we ate breakfast was absolutely delightful, again with cheerful and helpful staff. The menu was perfectly okay - freshly squeezed orange juice with a good selection of food on offer. The hotel's location is perfect for the station, and all public/tourist transport - travelling by train from the airport to Centraal Station and then a short walk to the hotel - bliss! For several days in which to explore the city and soak up the Dutch atmosphere this hotel serves as a wonderful base.

Reviews.Title: “Location is excellent”
Reviews.Author: BelfastTet
Reviews.Content: We stayed here fro 2 nights at the end of february. The hotel location could not be more central. The rooms are small but comfortable and clean. I would definetly stay here again. Lovely hotel.

Reviews.Title: “good sleeping..”
Reviews.Author: Sissisette Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I stay only one night in the Bellevue Hotel and when I arrived I notice that the tram noise was very annoying, but.... I have sleeping 8 hours very well... The coffe service in the evening doesn't exist, but the room was confortable and clean. the location is strategig, and the staff very kindly.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location!”
Reviews.Author: Barmaid79
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last weekend for 3 nights. We had all booked single rooms and got upgraded upon arrival! The Hotel has a luggage room for early arrivals. The staff are very friendly and helpful, booked plenty of tours for us. The main advantage of this hotel is it's location. You come out of Centraal Station and walk right over the bridge to the Hotel. Everything is within walking distance. We didn't have breakfast there so can't comment on it. The rooms are small and basic, but clean, all we wanted was a bed and shower. Pubs on either side of the hotel, aswell as an Argentinian & Italian restaurant across the road (ate in the Argentinian Steak House, wouldn't really recommend it, pricey, everything is extra to the actual steak!!!).The only fault about my room is that it was at the front, with a side entrace door to a smoking area, which was very noisey. But I will definitely stay here again on my next trip to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Small but stylish hotel right in front of central station”
Reviews.Author: Amsterdam_Chris123
Reviews.Content: This hotel is conveniently located right in front of central station and offers a good service for moderate prices. I stayed in this hotel for the second time and found is as enjoyable as the first time. The rooms are somehow small (like it is the case in all old Amsterdam houses) but are nicely furnished which compensates this again. The rooms are quite new and stylishly decorated. The service staff is friendly and the rooms and the rest of the hotel make a fresh and clean impression. Good value for your money here!

Reviews.Title: “Good position near Centraal Station”
Reviews.Author: Fussy215
Reviews.Content: Contemporary decorated hotel. Clean but very small rooms. Helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “clean and comfy”
Reviews.Author: jmcginnes
Reviews.Content: we stayed at bellevue for 2 nights in Jan 2012..Excellent location with two proper pubs two doors down and two doors up. Was a bit concerned about previous mention of mice but we experienced none. Room was cold so take your jamas. First morning we just made breakfast which was also cold but next day we went down earlier and it was fine. Room was very small but spotlessly clean and the bed was very comfy. Ideal for a couple but you would have to be very good friends in a twin due to size of rooms. Hotel was very quiet, no noise from other rooms. Staff very friendly and helpful. would stay here again and recommend for price and location.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: B-Mane
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Bellevue in December 2011. Pretty good value for money, great location. P.s we didn't have any rats when we stayed there.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: Kelly E
Reviews.Content: We arrived very early but they still let us check in. Everyone was polite and helpful.They gave us a map of Amsterdam and showed us the best places to see. The room was small, but clean and comfy. The shower was great! Carla's Diner downstairs had a good breakfast with very friendly servers.

Reviews.Title: “Small Rooms which are Functional”
Reviews.Author: manishjnewdelhi
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located 400 mtr from the Amsterdam (main) rail station. As you comeout of the Station take a right turn and cross the bridge over the cannel and cross the Zebra marking on road. The center street is Marlelaarsgracht street. The hotel is third from the left hand side. The room is very very small. If you have cross to go on other side of the double accupancy room, it will be deficult. The toilet is also very small, specially the bath tub and the wall along it. It is difficult to stand and take shower. The only advantage is the location of the Hotel and the Closesness from Rail head and the areas of larger interests in Amsterdam. No coffee, tea is available in the room. The toileries are also very average. The rental are without breakfast and are quite exorbitant. The room has a small 19 " lcd TV which was found very average.

Reviews.Title: “Tman”
Reviews.Author: trevor e
Reviews.Content: Having read some reviews I was wary of this hotel but my fears were unfounded. Great location near central station, reception staff were friendly.Room was small as others have said but with an on suite bathroom it was fine ( the shower was 1 of the best we've had anywhere powerful and instant hot water. People have complained that the nets were see through true but behind is a blackout roller blind. We asked for extra pillows and this was dealt with immediately,fault on tv remote and they offered us another room.Breakfast was included in our package and we found the food good and as it is a buffet as much as you want. Overall we found this hotel suited our needs and we shall use it again. On the downside could do with the paint being touched up where luggage etc has scraped the walls.

Reviews.Title: “ok for the money”
Reviews.Author: MARK R
Reviews.Content: Arrived pretty apprehensively after some dodgy reviews on this site,location couldn't have been better, staff could have been friendlier but no big deal,single room was small but overall for 50 pounds a night pretty much what you would expect.Read lots of reviews about problems with mice so requested a room on the top floor(logic being furthest from the restaurant,may have made no difference whatsoever)didn't see any or any sign of them at all nor did friends staying on the first floor.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for what we wanted”
Reviews.Author: LivingInLC
Reviews.Content: This hotel is across from Central Station. After a flight that landed 6 hours late and a short train ride to downtown Amsterdam, the short walk to the hotel at 9:30 pm was most welcome. The staff was personable and welcoming. The room was satisfactory. Nothing fancy, understand. The style was simple modern, a little dated, reminding me of the style of some "loft" hotels. But it was clean, quiet, the bed was satisfactory, the breakfast buffet was fine. Although the room had a window, it was a window onto an open shaft, so there was no view. but we wanted to be in the middle of Amsterdam for two days before a barge trip, and this was perfectly satisfactory. Our goals were to sleep there, eat a filling breakfast, and have easy access to walking in Amsterdam. We accomplished all three.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: cheleann
Reviews.Content: Was in Amsterdam for a few days prior to travelling to Germany via the EuroRail. The rooms at the Bellevue are definitely tiny but we hardly spent any time in the room. The room was definitely sufficient. If you're looking for luxurious, this isn't the place, although the rooms did have a trendy theme. The great thing about this hotel is location. While not a central location in the city of Amsterdam, it's just a few minutes walk from the rail and a lot of other sites. For the money, the room was good.

Reviews.Title: “Very good, but with some deficiencies”
Reviews.Author: Joseph_080
Reviews.Content: It is a very good hotel. Its location is very central, very near to Central Station and the Amsterdam centre. Its staff is good, not very friendnly, but very correct. Its rooms are very small, but its distribution is very good, so it is not necessary a bigger room. Its breakfast is deficient. It is open buffet, but its variety is very short. Its price is a little high for its services, but you know that it is Amsterdam. It is a very good hotel, but high prices, small rooms, and (mainly) poor breakfast

Reviews.Title: “Little Critter's”
Reviews.Author: paula4168
Reviews.Content: Location was great but the hotel had mice. As soon as I turned out my lights I could here something around my bag. I turned on the lights to see a mouse running into a hole. The next night the whole floor was woken by a young child screaming due to a mouse in the room. The bed was very tiny.

Reviews.Title: “Small and noisy”
Reviews.Author: traveladvisorNanaimo
Reviews.Content: The Bellevue Hotel is in a good location, a short walk from the train station, but be prepared for lots of noise from traffic. We did not encounter the mouse problem that other reviewers warn about, but we were not impressed with this hotel. We were fortunate to have read other reviews, so asked for a room facing the street on the fourth floor and did not have to face a brick wall. We paid for an upgrade and got a slightly larger room, but it was still awfully small. We did not have the problem with water from the shower that other reviewers have mentioned. The beds (two twins pushed together) are small and uncomfortable. The room is very small and amenities were few (paper thin towels, a hair dryer without any force). The room was very unwelcoming, white walls and plastic chairs such as you would find in a waiting room, but was well lit with some shelf space for clothes. The continental breakfast included eggs and cereal and front-desk staff were friendly and helful.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, great breakfasts”
Reviews.Author: vanlipp
Reviews.Content: Situated close to the central station, it's very convenient to access central shopping area, cafe/bars aplenty, canal boats and city tour 'hop on hop off' buses and magnificent architecture, just by walking around. Rooms and bathroom are small but adequate. If you don't enjoy the sounds of the city, the trams' noises may get to you. The staff were all friendly and helpful. The breakfast room is small and warm and the selection of breakfast treats is astoundingly delicious (makes up for nightly noise pollution) and they bake their own breads, so beware of the waist-line. The hotel also has it's own excellent restaurant/bar. A good place to stay for 'night owls' but perhaps not for those seeking a quite nights' rest.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel would recommend”
Reviews.Author: hibee87
Reviews.Content: First of all having stayed in the bellevue on 2 occasions, soon to be 3 I can honestly say its one of the best hotels for value in the centre of the city. PLEASE DONT LET NEGATIVE REVIEWS PUT YOU OFF THIS IS A LITTLE GEM OF A HOTEL!! THERE WAS NO MICE WHATSOVER when I went last time was july/august 2011. Me and my partner had food in our room everynight be it crisps, chocolate, quassonts (sp?) etc and never once see any sign of mice. There was a large gap at the bottom of the door but nothing a towel laid accross cant solve. we were on the first floor and to be fair our window looked onto more windows but what do you expect in a city build upwards on narrow streets? The rooms were adequete size for me and my partner very clean and tidy on arrival. The reception staff are friendly and helpful. The breakfast was nice for what you got but do admit at 12.50euro is a bit expensive, but it doesnt take much to search for a website to book the hotel in which breakfast is included in the price, infact I booked from hotels4u.com and found the room was cheaper than any other website and also included breakfast. I have read a few reviews stating they would not return to Amsterdam, and one lady who felt unsafe on her own through narrow streets.... all i would say is do your reasearch of the city before going and lets be honest is any major city in the world safe walking down narrow streets on your? Amsterdam is a brilliant city which offers many things to do for all interests. Yes some may find the RLD seedy but do your homework and dont go to that side if your not interesed. I will be booking this hotel without doubt for my next trip in a few months The hotel is located a 2 min walk form central staion, when you get of the train from schipol go down the stairs/escalator and turn right walk out the station. follow the road to the right out of centraal station and its the street directly infront of you. cant miss it really. Anyone travelling to the dam for the first time dont be conned in getting a taxi the train is evey 10 minutes and costs circa 2.80euro for a single the bus/taxis cost 30 euro+. You cant get lost platform 2 i think it is when you buy your ticket the will point you where to go. The surronding area of the hotel is perfect, all main streets are in a 5-10 min walking distance in all directions. The Singel RLD is about a 2 min walk to the right when you come out the hotel the main one is a 10 min walk at the otherside of the damrak, look for the grasshopper just off the damrak and follow on down there. Anne franks house is about a0.7 mile walk takes about 10-15 min walk. The van gough and rijks museam are a bit further away but you can get a tram from just down the road form the hotel or even walk if its a nice day (should only take about 30-45 min walk) The hotel is also on the edge of the picturesqu Jordaan area.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location”
Reviews.Author: ElenaKiev1
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is good. Rooms are clean but really small. I had a double room but was happy that I was staying alone there. It would really be tight for 2. Breakfast is not included in the price. My room was at the top florr - wi-fi did not work properly and was not fixed withing the week I was there. So the hotel is good if you are in Amsterdam for business. If you are for pleasure I would say the room is too small to relax at the end of the day.

Reviews.Title: “Mice infestation”
Reviews.Author: Labird057
Reviews.Content: Great location in the old city. Rooms are dirty. My first room had mice. So they moved me to a new room that had mice as well. When I called the front desk to let them know. the man said this is an old building we have mice. I guess they don't know what an exterminator is. Aviod this place, it is very dirty.

Reviews.Title: “Come here if you like mice!”
Reviews.Author: vicki_1988
Reviews.Content: Recently came back from Amsterdam, stayed in the Bellevue hotel...room was ok, requested a double room but just had two single beds pushed together, however thought we could put up with that...view from bedroom was the opposite wall of hotel, so no view at all, just scaffolding so had to keep blinds shut at all times. The bed wasn't at all comfy, and the pillows were hard too, had a sore neck at end of trip. On the second night my partner was awoken to the sound of rustling, he thought it was the air con blowing on a bag on the floor...but it turned out to be a mouse!!! The mouse was scurrying around the floor all over our stuff and eventually squeezed under the door down the hallway!! Obviously we couldn't sleep after that and it ruined the rest of our time there. Definately not what you would expect from a 3 star hotel! So just be careful, obviously mice aren't the cleanest of animals, as they urinate everywhere and cause disease and you don't want them all over your stuff!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location...not crazy about the city itself though!”
Reviews.Author: Calabrisella5
Reviews.Content: Transportation is extremely easy in Amsterdam. The hotel was a 10 min walk to the Centraal train station which connects to the Schipol airport(20 min ride). I recommend storing luggage in an airport locker for short stays. The hotel was within walking distance to most sites, though I had to constantly look at a map since all the narrow streets were a bit confusing. The room was comfortable and modern. However, the the bathroom floor could have used a good scrubbing of bleach. Breakfast was not included but could be purchased for 12 Euros. Staff was a bit helpful. As a women traveling alone, I didn't feel extremely safe walking around especially down narrow walkways.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely appalling - the worst hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: Queenbees67
Reviews.Content: Don't go here, it's appalling. The room on the ground floor looked out onto three brick walls of a 'light well', which was full of scaffolding and wooden planks, and was so dark and depressing. No daylight at all. Mustard carpet was badly stained, walls dirty, bathroom walls mouldy with peeling paint. Breakfasts very poor choice and quality. Bedside light did not work, safe was broken. When we put our bags in their secure storage area, we were given the key and left alone with other people' possessions in there, so not secure at all.

Reviews.Title: “would not go back to amsterdam!!!!”
Reviews.Author: brumbabes
Reviews.Content: stayed for 2 nights and had the package with the meal included, what a total rip off!!!! got to the restraunt and asked for the menu.............no we don't have a menu for this deal!!! you can have steak only......................oh well the steak was the best i've ever eaten, but would have liked a choice.......................the hotel!!! no kettle in room, had a bottle of water on arrival but then had to buy it for 260 euro!!! room on the small side, but nice decoration........the beds hard!!! not a good night's sleep!!! breakfast in the little cafe underneath the hotel was lovely..............................the museli is lush!!!! over all would not return to amsterdam.......!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in the centre - but beware of the mice!”
Reviews.Author: karinnan78
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend stayed here for three nights in July 2011. The hotel is has a great location by the train station. We came around noon, and we got our room right away. We also got a map of Amsterdam and they pointed out sights for us. Really good staff! The hotel is nice. The breakfast was ok - if we compare it with hotels in Sweden it was poor. They had scrambeld eggs, bacon, three kinds of bread, cheese, glass of yougurt, coffee and jucie. If it's not included in your booking, it cots â‚¬12,50. Not worht paying that for the breakfast. The room was very small - but okej for sleeping. The room was clean. The aircondition was very loud - and you need to have that going so you won't get rid of air. You have a saftybox, tv, no fridge. It gets very wet in the bathroom when you shower so you need a lot of towels. But a final warning. There are mice in the hotel walls. We had bought some snacks, and but them in our suitcases the night before we were leaving. And when we were packing the last thingsin the morning, the packages had holes in them (http://twitpic.com/5zb08h) Like a mice hade gnawed on it. Wasn't nice at all to see that. We told them at the reception desk and they confirmed that they had mice in the walls "but we cannnot get rid of them". We didn't get any compensation.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful little jewel”
Reviews.Author: rwadge
Reviews.Content: Friendly,helpful staff. Near to train station which is where you arrive from the airport. Soundproff--we slept 9pm to 11 am after arriving and walking and eating the first day!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in a nice location”
Reviews.Author: rastx1
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful hotel close to Centraal Station. You are pretty much close to most of the tourist areas. The trains and trams are a 3 minute walk and an easy access to get around Amsterdam. The hotel staff are wonderful. The lady at the front desk even allowed me to check in early as I had a really bad jet lag from a trans atlantic flight. The rooms are rather small (which is pretty much what you would see in the major European cities) but very beautiful and modern. I'll definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: GrumpyBlackCat
Reviews.Content: I read a few reviews of the hotel before I booked and I must say that I really enjoyed my stay. The staff on the front desk were friendly and helpful. I had a single room and yes, it was on the small side, but clean and I was using it to sleep in, not live in. Facilities in the room: Bed (One pillow and thin duvet) - comfortable, chair, small table, phone, flat Screen TV on wall opposite bed head (Only got about 4 channels, but two were BBC 1 & 2, so I could catch up with news back home) Wifi - could only get it with laptop on desk. Didn't realise until near end of trip so kept popping down to reception. 2 x hooks for coats Air conditioning with adjustable temperature. Small wardrobe with a couple of hangers and shelves Safe large enough for a laptop Bathroom - toilet, sink, shower, small shelf with 2 cups, hairdryer - with shaver point incorporated, hairwash/shower gel dispenser (took my own so didn't use, plus not too keen on all in one soaps) Bath mat, large towel, small towel. View from window - across to the wall of the opposite bit of the building, but if I sat on the bottom corner of the bed, I could look through the walkway to the harbour. Small gripes: There does seem to be a problem with the shower as others have said. The water took forever to go down and on the second morning was almost to the door. I went down to reception to tell them of the problem and they promised to have a look. Next morning it was only marginally better. The shower itself is quite good though. Light switches at the head of the bed. I kept switching them on/off when sitting up in bed. The extractor in the bathroom is constant, so you have to make sure the bathroom door is closed when you go to bed. No drinks available after cafe closes at 4.00p.m. Would have liked a drinks machine in the foyer (or a kettle in the room) Other The lift is room card operated, which makes it feel safer. In the room, you need a card for the slot to make the lights work. Any card will do - it doesn't have to be your room card. Breakfast - not included in my deal, but a couple of mornings I went down for coffee and toast. Nice coffee, lots of toast and jam. Girls in the cafe very polite and friendly. Luggage room in foyer. If you arrive too early, or want to leave later than checkout, there is a luggage room. Key card from reception, but anyone can get it. I used my laptop lock to secure my luggage to one of the posts. The hotel is just across the road from the Centraal Station and close to shops. Most things are within walking distance. Cafe/bar next door, small supermarket open until 10.p.m. around the corner which sells sandwiches, snacks, drinks, cigarettes and other groceries (turn right out of hotel and take first right - Albert Hejn) All in all, I had a nice stay and would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “good location, ok hotel”
Reviews.Author: luna_s02
Reviews.Content: i stayed for 4 nights. it was a single room, very small. very few tv channels. it was a no frills kind of place. was not thrilled with their cleaning of the room. bed was saggy. it is very close to centraal station which is a big plus. easy to get to everything. it was quiet at night, no rowdy travelers. the bathroom did not have any separation from the shower and the rest of the bathroom so the whole room got wet when i showered, very annoying. also they offer a shuttle to the airport but it costs 15 euro and takes almost an hr., better off riding the train which is what i did.

Reviews.Title: “Close to everything. Loved it.”
Reviews.Author: JackieMack
Reviews.Content: Location of this Hotel is fantastic. Walking distance to everything. Only about 200 meters from the train station so as a new tourist to this town, it meant lugging suitcases very easy. Its also just on the edge of everything without being slap bang in the middle of it all. But then everything is really close in Amsterdam. The room itself was brand new. Not overly roomy but room enough for what we needed. Super clean. Everything is white and shiny. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Room Ever !”
Reviews.Author: Durhamguy
Reviews.Content: Had a 5 night stay at The Bellevue and it wasn't a good experience at all. Arrived late and allocated 2 single rooms on the 5th Floor, my room 505 was the most vile and depressing room I have ever had the misfortune to spend a night in. I did change rooms the next day the first time I have ever done so when travelling, to room 511 which was a better room though not great. The rooms are small and spartan and badly decorated having stayed at many 3 star hotels in Europe this hotel should really be a 2 star in comparison. Noise is a problem especially on the 5th floor with people slamming the doors going out to the smoking area. Room 505 has no privacy with people in the smoking area or waiting to take the lift being able to look straight into the room so you would need to keep the blind down at all times. The huge gap under the door also makes it difficult to sleep in with the corridor light glaring through. I really did not feel safe in the room and when leaving to go out for dinner I put all of my belongings into a locked case. Cleaning staff were nice in leaving stained towels to use and one day I had left one of the flimsy plastic cups on the wash basin, on returning to my room later the cup must have been knocked and was cracked but had been left to use again rather than replaced with a new one. Great location, great city but not a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “nice tourist hotel, not a very good business hotel”
Reviews.Author: jsysmans
Reviews.Content: The locations is great, less than 5 minutes from the Amsterdam Central Station. The hotel itself is very clean and provides a safe environment. Breakfast is good. The room I had was facing the courtyard which make it quite (plus for Amsterdam). The beds was small but comfortable. Great hotel if you're visiting Amsterdam as a tourist But as a business hotel, no desk in the room to work on and the Internet access (free wifi) was spotty at best.

Reviews.Title: “The best value for your money”
Reviews.Author: MCSII_Trav-e-ler
Reviews.Content: first of all, location. can't get any better. only a short two minute walk from central station. very clean and modern rooms. using the stairs is a bit of a maze. but overall the hotel is great. felt very safe. very good breakfast. loved it. would recomened this hotel to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Bellevue hotel is a very good base to explore Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: abke550
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights in Bellevue hotel (Amsterdam) during June 2011. The hotel is a very good base to explore Amsterdam. The old historical part of Amsterdam is small (a diameter of about 2.5 Km) and therefore almost any hotel in the Centrum is considered to have a good location. Bellevue hotel also has an excellent location, almost everything in Amsterdam is within walking distance, and its unique location (only 100m to the central train station) enables to use the train to/from the airport instead of taking a taxi (about 4 Euro for person by train instead of about 40 Euro by taxi). The train can be used to tour other interesting towns near Amsterdam as Delft and Harlem. Bellevue is a small hotel with small rooms, but clean, modern and nicely decorated. We got an internal quite room where the only view from our window was the windows of other rooms of this hotel. The breakfast is continental but fine. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The room price is relatively high taking into account that Bellevue hotel is only 3 stars hotel (and not 5). For the end, the bottom line is positive.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location. Terrible lack of Business Ethics”
Reviews.Author: WashedWall
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my family from May 30th till June 2nd, 2011 (3 nights). I had earlier read a few reviews about some issues with the hotel during check-in. I had warned my travel agent accordingly, but she said that such issues only arise out of online bookings made on the internet. When I received the booking voucher, I found that it mentioned only 2 Adults, and we were traveling with our 4 year old daughter. When I pointed that out, my Agent assured me that it wasn't a big deal as the Child would be sharing the bed anyway. And that's exactly where everything went wrong. The moment we arrived at the hotel, the lady at the reception pointed out that no where was it mentioned that we were traveling with a Child. My mistake, I admitted, and asked her what was required to include the Child into the booking. She wasn't very clear on this. I prepared myself to be asked for a payment for the child's breakfast. But what I heard instead was SHOCKING -- They do not allow 2 Adults plus 1 Child in their Double Rooms. Has anyone here ever heard that anywhere ???? I don't think so ! So what happened next was ridiculous.. we were checked into a "Quad Room" meant for 4 adults. I called my agent and refused to pay anything extra. My agent was nice enough to admit her mistake and told me that she would take care of the monetary terms from her end and I wouldn't need to pay anything extra. The Room was a huge one with 4 beds and it was in the Basement. No windows, and it was terribly damp. The Wifi also did not work down below. Staying in that room was like staying in a Prison cell with only walls to look at. The Location was great, I must admit. Its just across the road from the Central station (Amsterdam Centraal). We had booked 2 sightseeing tours and there was a pickup point right in front of the Hotel. Very convenient indeed. Dam Square is a mere 10 minutes' walk from the Hotel. Breakfast was quite okay, and the staff were very nice, helpful and smiling. There is this guy from the Carribean (sorry I forgot his name).. he is a super-wonderful person and speaks to his customers with a sunny smile all the time. Appreciated. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone. Find some other place at this location, even if you have to pay a bit extra. These people lack ethics, and that's not acceptable.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and adequate”
Reviews.Author: Butch06
Reviews.Content: Rooms were small, somewhat Spartan, clean and adequate unless you intend to spend a lot of time staying in your room, but then why would you. Staff was very helpful and courteous. Location is very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: Spider209
Reviews.Content: When we arrived our reservation for 2 rooms didn't exist despite having proof from online reervation service plus proof of payment.. Rude receptionist told us the hotel was full, but then suddenly she found two rooms available - but at a hgher rate of course. Not willing to honour the rate we had already paid, my husband was obliged to pay again and we hd to claim back the original booking which took time and effort. Reception staff were anot at all helpful.

Reviews.Title: “it worths the price”
Reviews.Author: iarnox
Reviews.Content: holel is cheap if u consider the location and the hotel it is clean, people are nice. rooms are not very large but price/value ratio is ok

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jubbin55
Reviews.Content: To get there; The hotel is bang opposite the Centraal station, but Amsterdam Centraal is a huge station and there are at least three bridges and three roads that run opposite the station. Take the last bridge of the three ( the one closest to the huge cycle park area) Then take the road that is leading from the Bridge. The Bellevue hotel is the third on the left on that street. Good 1. Friendly quick check in. If you are early there is a place to store your luggage safely. But I would recommend keeping your stuff locked as lots of guests use that room. They do not seem to want to see any ID proof when you check in. 2. Smart clean all white room a bit small though. But right sized for a single traveller or a couple in love. 3. Free internet but the network is unsecured. 4. Located right in the centre of Amsterdam tourist district with the Dam and the canal tours all close by. 5. Has an in room safe. Bad. 1. Rooms are very close by. So please draw the blind when you are changing, 2. There is a small Plasma TV fixed onto the wall at an angle that makes it difficult to view either from on the bed or on the chair. 3. Modern looking chairs are very good to look at but uncomfortable to sit on for too long. There is a funny notch at the back which looks good but is bad for your back. 4. Bathroom has no place to keep your toilet stuff.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, awesome location!”
Reviews.Author: Sweet_temptation
Reviews.Content: The hotel is right by the train station which is perfect, we walked everywhere and didn't have to get on a tram once. The hotel was really nice inside and the rooms were big enough for what you want while your there, with satellite tv too. Beds were nice and comfy also :-) the hotel staff were friendly and got us into our too rooms before the check in time, which we appreciated alot. Breakfast included was definately worth gettin up for, lovely fresh juice and eggs and local breads and meat! This was our 2nd time to Amsterdam but 1st time in this hotel, we would definatley stay here if we went again.

Reviews.Title: “good time,nice room”
Reviews.Author: hubbali666
Reviews.Content: from 14-18 apr, room 307,room was small but good,staff very nice,5 min walk from across Centraal Station,ate at the Toro Dorado good food.

Reviews.Title: “best location in town”
Reviews.Author: namizon
Reviews.Content: best location in town. i stayed 2 nights and didnt buy a tram ticket. i just walked around town and did i mention the hotel is right next to the centraal station? that should explain everything else. it's right next to centraal station, just across the bridge. it's also a stone throw from dam square and all the tourist attraction. the room is small but reasonable with the price. i'm an asian girl traveling alone, so the room size didnt bother me. the room is clean and nicely organized.

Reviews.Title: “Easy access to a clean hotel.”
Reviews.Author: bluebonzoid
Reviews.Content: We were just passing through town and needed a place to stay that was near the train station. This place fit the bill perfectly. Very short walk from Amsterdam Centraal, and we were able to wonder around the neighborhood and see a little of the city as well. The person at the front desk eagerly answered our question about a good place to eat nearby, giving us lots of choices depending on the type of food we wanted! The room was clean, comfortable, and modern looking. Nothing too fancy, but exactly what we needed. If you don't need to go to far into the city, or need easy access to the trains, this is the place to stay. The only problem I experienced was the WiFi didn't reach my room, so I couldn't connect my iPhone easily.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: DiOh
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location, just across the road from Centraal Station which makes travelling from/to Schipol airport very easy. The hotel itself is good. Staff at reception are friendly. Single room was small, but totally adequate for one person and you wouldn't spend much time in it anyway. The room was clean and the bed was comfortable. The walls are very thin and you can hear your neighbours talk, etc. It didn't bother me too much, but it might bother some people. The hotel is close to shops, restaurants, coffee shops and you could walk to all the main sights from there. Sightseeing buses and boats leave from just across the road. All in all I had a good experience and I would stay there again and would recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: texas_poptart
Reviews.Content: This hotel is literally a hop, skip and a jump from Amsterdam Centraal. It was nice to hop off the train and walk 5 minutes to our hotel. The staff was nice and the room was cute, but tiny...but who cares when you're in Amsterdam? It's not like you're spending all of your time in your room anyway. You can walk everywhere from this hotel. There are loads of restaurants, bars, coffeeshops and souvenir shops all around this hotel. It's a great location and cute too. The room was very modern. The comforter DID have a gross brown stain on it when we first got there which was pretty nasty but they brought us a clean one as soon as we called and told them. There was a great little cafe in the hotel downstairs which was nice. We were in Amsterdam for less than 24 hours but all in all I enjoyed my stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Bellevue short stay”
Reviews.Author: mapkblue1
Reviews.Content: No frills hotel, well situated for tourist attractions. In the centre of Amsterdam opposite the main railway station, and canal boat moorings. Close to shops, restaurants, bars etc. Room was small and basic, but clean and comfortable. Staff were friendly and helpfull.

Reviews.Title: “What you want and expect....”
Reviews.Author: Seraphial
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in quite a number of hotels over the years for business and pleasure, the latter ranging from complete holes to 5 star service. The price of the hotel wasn't cheap, but in comparison to others in Amsterdam the price was fair. It's very easy to find - just a hop over from the central station. As mentioned the check-in was a tiny bit abrupt, but was swift and I got to my room quickly. The pleasant surprise was the state of the room - clean, modern and bright. The view wasn't fantastic (back of the building) but not really something I look for. The usual suspects were there - large TV, wardrobe, laundry service, wifi, toiletries, and the bathroom featured a shower and toilet. I'm not exactly picky when it comes to these things but overall it was a very nice experience. There's possibly a couple of areas to consider if you're staying here - the walls are slightly paper thin so you can hear quite a lot that's going on next door or in the hallway. It's possibly the younger crowd as well. Also, you shower directly onto the bathroom floor so the foot towel is a bit useless. On the upside (and more importantly IMO) the hotel is right next to Central Station, so if you're on a sightseeing holiday then the location is ideal, as all trams and most buses go directly there. Fantastic if you've done a whole day walking and just want to get home. From my experince, I'd thoroughly recommend the Bellevue.

Reviews.Title: “Single Travellers Beware”
Reviews.Author: Shinken69
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Bellevue on numerous occasions and always had a pleasant experience. However, this has now changed as the pulled switch on me last time. I booked a single room on to adjacent weekends, either side of another european trip. No problems on the 1st weekend. However, when I returned on the following Friday evening they told me there had been and admin problem and they didn't have a room for me. They claimed to have tried to contact me by email and phone. Rubbish, I have constant access to both email and phone while traveling. I had already paid for the room and all that was on offer was a room at the Memphis hotel to the south of the city by the Concertgebouw, which is about a 1 hour walk from Dam square. I had no choice as it was now late on Friday night and they already had my money. I also noticed that as they debated with the taxi driver as to who should pay, they continued to check in other guests arriving after me. The Memphis is a fine hotel, infact better than the Bellevue. However, the reason I choose the Bellevue is the location. I want to be in the city centre and not an hour away.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, average service”
Reviews.Author: alexnik
Reviews.Content: This is a good choice to spend a night or two when passing through Amsterdam but probably not good if you want to explore the Amsterdam itself. Smallish, but clean rooms with modern design. On the downside - poor sound isolation and it could get really cold at night (the windows are hardly insulated). The breakfast is ok, the staff could be more friendly

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice people”
Reviews.Author: pedrogigi
Reviews.Content: The hotel's position is great, near the main train station and the city centre. It is new and clean. Staff was very helpful and courteous, room was pretty clean and mine (a double) was quite big, albeit basic. Free wifi, good breakfast, safe: access is restricted to keycard holders. A few "problems": - the soap dispenser leaking - light coming from under the door (put a towel there and you're done) - single rooms are really single rooms (i.e. no waste of space) - I haven't been there, but the rooms next to the staircases are likely to be noisy. - the bed of a colleague wasn't made every day. - no view - but I was offered a room with panorama. - not rally inexpensive. All in all I felt fine.

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable”
Reviews.Author: Ldupreez
Reviews.Content: You pay for what you get. Not all staff was friendly and helpful ,but overall very central and the breakfast was good.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT LOCATION AND BRILLIANT BREAKFAST”
Reviews.Author: VERONA013
Reviews.Content: Ideal location just across the road from central station. Small rooms but has everything you need. Dont waste holiday time in bedroom. Fantastic breakfast - all you can eat buffet with very tasty freshly baked bread. Excellent value when booked with room. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was clean but very basic.”
Reviews.Author: kydd978 Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was clean but extremly basic. It is not a three star. The room was quite cold and there was no soap in the container provided in the shower. The breakfast was not up to much. This is more of a no frills hotel. Its fine if you are only looking for a place to get your head down but not much else.

Reviews.Title: “Bare bones, cheap, convenient.”
Reviews.Author: trixiethomson
Reviews.Content: If you're only in town for a night or two, the Bellevue is hard to beat in terms of convenience. You're just across the street from the central train station, so you can get off the train, drop off your bags, and be in central Amsterdam within 15 minutes. The staff if friendly enough (though little things, like making someone call back later to talk to someone on the next shift about a wake up call, are sometimes a bit unprofessional), and the rooms seem secure, as you need a key card to use the elevator to the rooms. The rooms themselves are minimal -- and showing a bit of wear (I had stained carpet, and a kind of dingy-smelling bathroom), but there are clean linens and comfortable bed. There is also an internet connection in the room. My room got quite bright in the morning, though, as there are just thin curtains. Overall a cheap, friendly, convenient option. Not a fancy hotel, but a nice budget choice. I'd recommend it if you want to spend less than $100/night, but still be in a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and cheerful hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: EllyWishaw Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location for all transportation links. Rooms really quiet considering the location. The cafe attached to the hotel was superb and the staff very helpful and pleasant. I would advise taking the package that includes breakfast as it was very good value. The rooms were basic but were very clean and bright.

Reviews.Title: “Average Facilities, Great Location, A Bit Over-Priced”
Reviews.Author: HappyAussieCamper
Reviews.Content: The best thing about the Bellevue Hotel is that it is in a superb location. It is very easy to get to from the airport. If you're travelling from Schippol Airport, you need only jump on the train to Centraal Station. Once you arrive at Centraal Station, you just basically cross the street and you are at the Bellevue Hotel. This hotel is right in the middle of Amsterdam. The red light district is a two minute walk across the canal, and the main shopping plaza, or 'Dam', is an easy 5 minute stroll. In addition, the hotel is quiet and in reasonable condition. The double room that I was in was quite spacious, and serviced everyday. Within 50metres of the hotel you will find a vast array of eating spots, internet cafes (internet city, which is around the corner, was very handy and you can print). There is also a supermarket nearby if you are on a budget. The hotel was also very helpful in organising tours, and because you are basically in the middle of town, the departure sport for day, bus and canal trips is only a short walk away. We stayed during an extremely cold snap (-4 during the day) and were still able to walk to where we wanted because the location is so central to everything. Unfortunately, there is no internet, but there are plenty of wifi spots and internet cafes within 50 metres. I will have to say this, however. We pay 189 euro for two nights (without breakfast) and I think, for what we got, that was a bit much. If you have a few more pennies to spare, the Crowne Plaza is 20 metres away and though it is only a bit more expensive, the standard of rooms appears to be much higher.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: Serenatee
Reviews.Content: I thought the Bellevue Hotel was fantastic and I liked the staff, as well. The room was small, but efficient and clean. You can't get a better location for the money - across from central station. The staff was very helpful. I would just suggest to make sure if you have breakfast in your deal, as mine didn't. I would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, superb location!”
Reviews.Author: ambob
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a hotel within a central location, with clean rooms and great service at reasonable prices.. then look no further than the Bellevue! 10/10

Reviews.Title: “Great location,poor quality”
Reviews.Author: Natife
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Bellevue hotel for two nights. I chose the double twin room and they gave us one at the 1st floor. The room was small but comfortable. Although it was too close to the traffic, the room was surprisingly quiet! I also payed extra for the breakfast menu which was simple but tasty! As for the negative side,in my opinion the staff wasn't very helpful nor polite...also they didn't clean our room (we stayed there for almost 3 days)!!!Apart from that the room wasn't so clean when I checked in...dirty curtains+towel!Last but not least, this was definitely the coldest room I've ever stayed in. The heating system didn't seem to work properly! I'm not going back there!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: nicklesjean
Reviews.Content: The decor was really cool and the staff was very nice and helpful. The location is close to everything. Central Station is literally across the street. There are lots of great resturants very close by and all the main sites and attractions are within walking distance. We really enjoyed that if we ever felt 'lost' all we had to do was find directions to Central Station and we were home.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Daisy0312
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Bellevue for three nights and it was perfect for a short stay. The hotel is very central and located close to the Central Station. The staff were friendly and helpful. The breakfast area was quite small but the food was lovely and there was a nice atmosphere. I loved the modern decor in the room. It was a tiny room but overall it was very good value for money

Reviews.Title: “excellent location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: handsoloLiverpool
Reviews.Content: we found the bellevue to be a very welcoming hotel, also the staff are friendly and accomodating. the location is excellent and within 10 mins of most of the main sights. the breakfast was enjoyable. the room was spacious and overlooked the main street. the noise was never an issue and the beds were comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Could not fault it”
Reviews.Author: daveamstredam
Reviews.Content: Cant understand some the negative views because we found the hotel to be superb value for the money. The room was nice, clean and compact with no hidden cameras or connecting doors and were well sound proofed. The staff were very helpful and polite and security in the hotel was good. Situated in heart of the centre easy walking distance to all the sights that Amsterdam has to offer. Convenient for all transports links and only a minute away from central station. Already recommended the hotel to family and friends and we will be going back in the future.

Reviews.Title: “In front of the Central Station, where there are many bus and tramway lines.”
Reviews.Author: Viatger64
Reviews.Content: Critica nÃºmero NÂº id. 83709824 In front of the Central Station, where there are many bus and tramway lines. Good shower, breakfast buffet, a free bottle of water the first day, TV and free wifi. Just one problem: the bed too soft.

Reviews.Title: “Fine Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ArchAngel521
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Bellevue Hotel four nights in mid October (2010). I was quite satisfied. I made reservation via the hotel's own website, and got as good of a price as I was able to see on any of the other hotel booking sites. They reconfirmed with me by e-mail two days before arrival without me having to contact them, and upon arrival the reservation was flawless. I selected this hotel based upon location (great), price (acceptable, and well within competitive range for 3-star hotels in the area), lift (necessary to be 3-star, and necessary for my knees!), and available internet connection (preferably free, which Bellevue had). Check-in was easy and quick. Yes, the room was small (by US standards), and by looking at the floorplan, most of the rooms are about the same size. Mine was (I measured) 9 x 12 feet plus the bath. It was small by US standards, but not by Amsterdam standards, and not smaller than similar hotels in similar price ranges in this area of town. The bath was actually fairly large compared to the room itself. Room was clean, though there were stains on the carpet. Mostly white carpet and walls gave to a smooth design, but showed dirt. The bath was clean, and daily maid services were good, even though the hotel was fully sold out. Others have commented on the shower and toilet areas not being separated by any barrier, so that when the shower ran the entire floor of the bath could get wet. It really was not a problem. The floor gently sloped toward the drain, and if you pulled the shower curtain, the water stayed where it should. It made for an interesting design, quite smoothe and attractive, and not a problem at all. I had absolutely no problem connecting to, nor staying connected to, the free Wireless service in my room. I took a "Small Double." The description showed the bed as "Queen," but it was not. It was what in US would be called a "double." If a "twin" bed is too small, this is the size for ONE person, and would have been entirely too small for my spouse and me. However, it was PERFECT for me by myself. The next size up would also be called a "double," but the sleeping arrangement would be two twins pushed together. They would be separately sheeted, which might not be optimal for some, but two twins are larger than this bed was. There was a lift off of the main lobby, but it required you to use your key card to call it. As a result, no on wandered in off the street and it was quite private. Your key card was also required to be put into a slot in the room before any of the electric lights or outlets worked, and they all went out when you removed the card and left the room. The only exceptions to this were the TV and air conditioner/heater unit. The hotel is not fancy, and is not a 4 or 5 star location. But then, neither is it priced nor advertised as one. I got exactly what I expected, a good value, and a nice place to stay. The location of the hotel is on a busy street (Marlelaarsgracht) with auto, bike and tram traffic, at the corner of an even busier street (Prins Hendrikkade), but I never heard a sound from traffic. No more than 100 meters from Centraal Station, with bus and tram connections in between, the location was PERFECT for getting around anywhere in town using public transportation. And, coming from Schipol, a quick train ride did not require any additional public transportation nor taxi. There is a small restaurant that serves breakfast and lunch (until 14:30). Breakfast was a buffet, for â‚¬12.50 they had scrambled or hard-boiled eggs, bacon, breads, yogurt, ham, turkey, cheese, coffee, tea, juice, cereal, and I am sure more. You could charge the bill to your room or pay cash. Lunch, available until 14:30, consisted of standard fare: Sandwiches or Dutch pancakes. Perhaps more important, the service was VERY good and personable, and they remembered you and your preferences from day to day, even though the hotel was completely full of guests. I felt like we were old friends. The location is excellent. Walkable distance to RLD, but located so that you could avoid it if that was not your cup of tea. Not on the Damrak with its commercialism and noise, but only a long block away should you want to be in the activity. Trams stopped right in front of the hotel on their return. Shopping and many small restaurants nearby, as well as bars. But a quick tram ride away or longer walk and you would get to Dam Square, or to Leidsplien, where the choice were limitless. I would choose again, and after seeing the location and insides of several competing 3-star hotels in the area (that I almost chose instead) I can say that I would choose Bellevue again if I was to stay in this area and price range.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - couldn't fault it.”
Reviews.Author: Nic40_10
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in May. The hotel was spotless, although the rooms were small they had everything we needed for a short stay: clean and comfy bed, hot shower, wardrobes and shelf space and a TV. Don't know if WIFI was available as we didn't need it. Breafast was hot and plentiful - eat as much as like, in relaxed surroundings. Satff were English speaking and helpful. This hotel was excelent position - right opposite Central station, within 5 mins walk of everything you need, coffee shops, red light district - and not too far from cultural sites also. We bought a two day tram pass, which saved the legs a bit and we saw loads more than we would have just walking around. One bit advice ladies, take comfy shoes or trainers, not only will it be easier to get about (everywhere is cobbles) but I wore 5 inch pink heels one day and everyone (I mean everyone) seemed to look at me as if I was stupid ! Which on hindsight it wasn't the most sensible choice of footwear. Take loads of money - it is sooo expensive to buy anything - except the skunk - my advice is smoke but don't eat or drink!!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific location, very smart design”
Reviews.Author: Waterfall84
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 3 nights in winter '09. Location is TERRIFIC, steps away from the Central Station and at the same time very close to the old town. Very hand if you plan to visit other cities in NL (Rotterdam, Utretch, etc.) or going to Schiphol airport. Seems like it has restored not long ago. My (single) room was small but cozy with a very nice and smart design. Everything seemed new and clean. Loved the design of the bathroom and bedroom. Even if it was horrible winter day (and freezing to death), it felt warm inside. Really recommended if you are looking for a good price and clean & nice place to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a pleasant stay and everything as...”
Reviews.Author: monk59
Reviews.Content: Overall a pleasant stay and everything as expected of a modest sized city centre hotel. Clean room with a decent bathroom. Enjoyed excellent quality if slightly unusual style breakfast . You can find cheaper but if you like to be in the centre of things you won't find anything more convenient. Happily go back again .

Reviews.Title: “Conveniently located decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: WKM1914
Reviews.Content: This hotel is conveniently located right across the street from the Centraal train station. The staff members are very friendly and the hotel appears to be in good condition. It is located right outside of one of the redlight districts and there are several things to do nearby. I'd definitely recommend the hotel if you're in Amsterdam for a couple of nights and need a convenient place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “It was a nice hotel until I got stuff stolen”
Reviews.Author: swimgirl320
Reviews.Content: When we arrived, the hotel seemed nice; however, when we got to our room, in our bathroom we noticed hair and dirt all over the floor (shower is a part of the bathroom). The pillows also had some sort of stains on them, but besides that, the room was nice. The air conditioning was working fine the first 2 nights, but would not work the last and they staff could not help. Overall, the staff was nice and helpful; although, the last night before our departure, we discovered my iPod was missing. We turned everything upside down, but no luck. I then informed the staff, and they seemed to be taking the matter seriously and took down all my information. Unfortunately, I still have not heard anything from them (good or bad) and nothing even after I sent them an email. Good things: Has a restaurant connected to it. In the middle on the city - 4 min walk to Central Station Staff is knowledgeable Not so good: DON'T LEAVE VALUABLES IN ROOM-they will be stolen Air conditioning is a bit inconsistent The room was not clean upon arrival Overall, I would not recommend this hotel, but provided the valuables are not left in the room, I would not discourage anyone from staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Well priced, well located and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: J_82Birmingham
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased with this hotel after being somewhat concerned by a couple of reviews i had read on here. The hotel is situated literally a couple of minutes walk from Centraal Station and within a ten minute walk of attractions including Dam Square and the Royal Palace, The House of Anne Frank and the Red light District. Noting that we were in an area close to nightlife we requested a quiet room and were immediately e-mailed back to confirm this, upon arrival it was again confirmed that we had a quiet room on the 5th floor facing away from the street. This room was silent which was great for my partner who is a very light sleeper. The location was perfect and Damrak, a main hub of transport was one minutes walk, allowing for regular trams to teh Leidseplein and Museumplein if requied. These were however under 30 minutes walk. The hotel itself was nicer than i had expected. The rooms were crisp and clean with nice decor and the staff very friendly indeed, i was surprised to note someone had a negative experience as i found them extremely courteuos and helpful. When we had the usual 2 towells in our bedroom a quick mention of this saw 5 towells arrive in a matter of minutes, and queries on attractions were met with maps and valued tips. The only negatives i could find would be the bathroom did not had adequate storage space for accessories, with a tiny ledge, and was generally very small. Also the breakfast was somewhat limited, albeit exactly what i would expect of a three star hotel. It did offer scrambled and boiled eggs, a couple slices of cold meat and cheese, some cooked bacon, cereal and croissants. None of this however was particularly appealing. Overall i was very happy. I felt that in an expensive city such as Amsterdam it was good value for money and i would stay here again. It wasn't a hotel i would stay in for a memorable stay, but was convenient, well priced, relatovely comfortbale and quiet, and brilliantly located.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for a 3 star but staff need training!!”
Reviews.Author: funnyboy
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights here for Queen's Day at the end of April and chose the hotel because of the location and the fact that there was no public transport on the 30th of April. As regular visitors to the city,both on business and for leisure purposes we have stayed in many different hotels in the city ranging from 1 star to 5 stars.On this occasion our booking was not directly with the hotel but we requested a quiet room which we obtained, this was on the 5th floor and the hotel had only one lift which was out of order for over a day.We saw various people stuggling with their luggage and they had no help. Fortunately we were not arriving or departing whilst the lift was out of sevice. We booked room only but chose to have breakfast on one day.The service was very disorganised and the staff didnt know which people were in the hotel and had paid or not paid for the organic experience. The food was nice quality and the price you would expect from a hotel in this location however it was the worst coffee I have ever tasted, more like turkish coffee than Dutch. The reception staff,apart from one were miserable and unhelpful. We had a maintenance problem and were unable to open our bathroom door. After phoning down we were told to come down ourselves and get a screwdriver and make sure that it was returned! The rooms are very small and the bathroom we had was a wetroom which was literally that. Once the shower was on everything got wet. Also there was very little storage space or shelves either in the bathroom or bedroom. It reminded us of a small cabin on a cruise ship and not a room where you would want to spend much time. The friendliest people staff wise in the hotel were the cleaning staff who tried their best with vey little time to do their jobs.On the whole the cleanliness was of a fair standard. In conclusion for the price paid I think there are better hotels but the location was ideal for our purpose.We would rather stay in a hotel a bit furher from the centre and pay less for better service.

Reviews.Title: “My wife and I found this hotel to be a...”
Reviews.Author: AHarwell80
Reviews.Content: My wife and I found this hotel to be a great spot for our first trip to Amsterdam. The location was perfect (right next to the train station and near the lovely Jordaan district). Our room was great. It was small, but we weren't expecting much. We didn't hear a sound from the street (5th floor). The room was clean and breakfast was good. Overall, we would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty bathrooms - black toilet”
Reviews.Author: rebeljenn
Reviews.Content: This hotel is worn and has seen better days. Outside the lift on the wall is a history of the hotel, and it looks like it was last refurnished 5-6 years ago. The bathroom walls and floor are painted - no tiles - and worn paint and furnishings. The walls need some paint. It was annoying not having a table beside the beds. The worst thing was the toilet. It was black. Why oh why did the cleaners not use bleach to make the toilet white again???? Gross! Other people mentioned noise and rude staff. The staff were friendly to me, and the room I had was 1st floor facing the front (street and trams). I guess I am used to some noise - none of this bothered me. Trams and noise doesn't go on too late/early anyway, and this did not bother me at all. The only issue was the black toilet and just the lack of refurnsihing. It's a 'tired' hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, poor hotel!”
Reviews.Author: TheChadi
Reviews.Content: The hotel is just a few steps away from Amsterdam-Centraal Station making it a perfect place for transiting in the city. A lot of restaurants, bars and coffeeshops around. The Red Light District and Dam Square are within a very short walking distance. The hotel staff are comprised of two different types; one type is very good and helpful, the other type isn't so pleasant. But at any given moment you can still get a smile out of them and get your concern across. The rooms are so tiny that you can barely open your suitcase on the floor. The toilet is tiny too. The rooms aren't as clean as you would expect them to and the noise level can get quite high in no time. This was my third stay at this hotel and the reason for that is it was the cheapest within its category at the time of booking. I would only return to this hotel if the price is like half of what others are charging in that location. Speaking of which, it is always best to book through other websites recommended by tripadvisor rather than booking directly with the hotel. In my three stays, the price I paid was half of what the hotel was advertising for on their website.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: Suey2010
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at this hotel. The facilities were clean and nicely set out, the staff pleasant and helpful. The breakfast was good and the location couldn't have been better. Right in the heart of Amsterdam, with easy access to all transport and canals. The room was very modern and comfortable, but small (although this didn't bother us at all).

Reviews.Title: “perfect location...”
Reviews.Author: soxy
Reviews.Content: I was on my way to Dar es salaam and had to have a 24 stop over in Amsterdam , a real great shame ! i needed a hotel that was easy to get to and within close walking distance to the hustle and bustle of what the dam has to offer, once you arrive at schipol airport, you can get a direct train to central station, get off the train and then you are basically in your hotel room, for me the room was perfect, yes it was small, and yes the shower is a wet room, but so what, if you are here for a short term stay then it is perfect, the hotel has all the facilities you need on your door stop, i have read comments about the hotel being noisy, all i can say is if your looking for a quiet holiday and then don't stay in the centre of Amsterdam, , if like me you like to enjoy a coffee or two you will sleep fine ! i must admit there was very strange smells coming from the coffee shop that I was enjoying my latte, every body looked very happy indeed...

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but VERY noisy”
Reviews.Author: JasperC
Reviews.Content: I first stayed at this hotel in February and didn't get around to writing a review so when I stayed again yesterday I thought I should report back! Location 2 minutes walk from Central Train Station and 2 minutes walkfrom all the usual tourist traps, it's location is perfect. Staff All very helpful, friendly and happy to help with questions about the location of tourist attractions etc.. Rooms Both times I stayed I upgraded to a double room. The first time I stayed my room was an ok sized room, not massive but not at all small. My room yesterday was also a double but this one was much,much smaller. Both ok for a lone traveller on an overnight stay although the later was really not great. Both rooms were clean and functional. On the downside, both rooms were at the front of the hotel which is REALLY noisy and I mean REALLY noisy. The trams go past over 120 seconds, yes 120 seconds. I was led in bed timing it at 1am. Also the other traffic is noise is very bad. It seems that the drivers in Amsterdam love hitting their car horns at any opportunity. Unless you are a very heavy sleeper or get blind drunk and collapse on the bed, you WILL NOT sleep! I finally fell asleep at 3am to be woken by the trams at around 6am. On the upside the hotel do offer free wifi throughout the hotel. Overall, if you can get a room at the back of the hotel and are staying just a couple of nights then it is fine. Biggest plus is the location.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: tellamscomet
Reviews.Content: The breakfast was lovely served by friendly staff, our room was a lovely size, clean, our friends was a bit smaller but still very nice. We would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly nice place - would stay again”
Reviews.Author: CathyMtl
Reviews.Content: My hubby and I just returned from a 2 nights stay at the Bellevue Hotel and were both perfectly satisfied with our stay and would certainly stay again. The rate was relatively inexpensive (C$139/night) given that it was so close to the train station (just across the street) and right in the middle of all the action. Reception was nice and clean and your room key is needed to operate the lift, which makes one feel pretty safe. The room, as others mentioned, was indeed small and basic but very clean. We knew from reading reviews on TripAdvisor what to expect so were not disappointed. Our room was 510 (recommended) on the top floor. We were not bothered by noise as the windows kept most of the sound out and the view was quite nice (top of buildings lit up at night). On the 5th floor there's also nice spot where you can go outside and smoke or just get some fresh air. Bring flipflops for the bathroom if you have a "wet room" bathroom like we did. TV had some decent English channels (BBC) and A/C worked perfectly. Free WIFI was a plus. Great trip, nice hotel. Would recommend for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Poor quality hotel with little room for respite or quiet”
Reviews.Author: GulliverTales
Reviews.Content: Staying at this hotel gave me a new perspective on the meaning of the word 'basic'. Before I start let me just say that if you want to stay in a hotel where you only come in at midnight and sleep till 6am and are taking prescription - or otherwise - drugs that act as a sedative then you should be fine. This hotel has very tiny rooms - this maybe the trend in Amsterdam as land space is at a premium and is very restricted but this hotel is very tiny and allows for little room. The room we stayed in was an upgrade - this can only lead to me to the fact that our orginal room must have been a stable! Cleanliness was an issue: there was marks on the bed sheets, large marks on the thread-bare carpets, lip-stick marks round the bath and there was a dead insect on the bathroom floor, which was perhaps due to the fact that there was no drainage in the bathroom at all. No shampoo or conditioner was provided - only a small bar of soap and poor quality pinkish hand cleaning stuff was provided (which the hotel expected customer's to use as shampoo I guess as it was located over the bath). Towels were rock hard and tiny. We had a twin doube room and requested two separate beds: the hotel gave us a room with two very small beds pushed together. The pillows they provided were tiny and I had to ask for another pillow - which they provided without fuss. Sleep is a major issue in this hotel, as in kiss goodbye to it!! Despite the double glazing, you can clearly hear the traffic on the main road going all night long. To add to this noise, the trams operate from 6am to midnight with metal scraping on metal and 'ding, ding' signaling their intent to move forward. Internal to the room: well, there is a constant industrial hum from the fan/air conditioner which cannot be turned off. As aforementioned, you would have to be drunk or stoned to sleep in this hotel without issue due to the horrendous noise. Oh, the walls are paper thin and we heard a paricularly nasty domestic argument between our neighbours (it turned violent and we had to alert the hotel staff who handled it firmly - thankfully for the couple involved). The hotel has little facilities - no restaurant, no bar, no mini-bar etc. Breakfast is served in a cafe located next door to the hotel which serves yogurt, nuts, pastry and one glass of orange juice - very healthy and there is a little amount of scrambled egg and burnt bacon rashes to help yourself too. This hotel is not disabled friendly as there are stairs in the rooms and a large stair to access the bathroom. The hotel does offer free Wi-Fi but this is a joke as the connection only lasts for 30 seconds at a time! The staff are very polite and friendly and it is located near to the central station which is great for transport to sight-seeing locations. For 112 euros a night (starting from) and a further 12 euros for a small, limited breakfast this hotel is way overpriced for the small box rooms it offers. It is more like a hostel, but if you want a hostel and just somewhere to sleep, then plenty of those can be found nearby for a more suitably reflective price. In conclusion, don't stay here if you are are planning to do sight-seeing and require a good nights sleep.

Reviews.Title: “3-Star Hotel, 4-Star Price...”
Reviews.Author: TybeGecco
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a very good location if you arriving in Amsterdam by train as it's only a few minutes walk from the train station. It's also in walking distance of everything in the city center, but you will need to get a tram for the museums. We paid â‚¬140 a night for a double room. If this hotel was anywhere other than Amsterdam city center the price would be more like â‚¬50 a night. The rooms are clean but basic with no frills. Not recommended for a romantic break or a place to relax, but good as a place to sleep and leave your things as you explore the city. The receptionist was very confused and rude to some of the other guests, but fine for us, but we did only have a brief conversation. Her reason for another guests room not being ready when they were told it would be ready was "It's Friday". Another guest asked a question and was told "Hang on, I can't do everything!" The breakfast was nice but simple. Each person is given a tray with a danish pastry, bread meat & cheese, orange juice and yogart. You can help yourself to tea, coffee, bacon & eggs. Anything more and it's extra. The room was quite and there wasn't much noise from the hall (although there was a gap at the bottom of the door that let in light from the hall) but I don't know if that was because we requested a quiet room or just the hotel in general.

Reviews.Title: “Everything we wanted and more, brilliant hotel! Will stay again!”
Reviews.Author: Mumfa
Reviews.Content: Took my fiance for his birthday and booked 2 rooms for 3 nights so we could take friends, read a heap of reviews before going and wasn't sure what to expect. We were absolutely delighted, the room was clean, the shower was ace, the staff were friendly, helpful and efficient. When we got there our safe was not working, phoned reception and staff were there in 5 minutes and got the problem solved. Right in the centre of Amsterdam but still felt really safe, 5 minutes from central station.I did not book breakfast and glad I did not as when we went to the cafe we thought there selection was a bit limited, but then again we are bacon roll in the morning people, so I guess it depends what you want! I would highly recommend this hotel for a party weekend in The Dam, we will be going back! Sam Edinburgh

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, excellent location & a lovely breakfast”
Reviews.Author: hadd
Reviews.Content: Myself and my partner stayed at the Belle Vue Hotel for Valentines weekend. The hotel is situated right in the heart of the centre, with everything within walking distance. The rooms are quite small but not uncomfortable. To be honest if your only staying in the City for a few days you dont really need anymore from a room than what the Belle Vue provide. The rooms were spotless and the bed comfortable, though id say it probably want a true double bed, more a 3/4. The breakfast is lovely. You are provided with a tray consisting of bread, meat, cheese, a pastry and a yougurt and granola snack, along with unlimted tea coffe, eggs and bacon. All of which are organic and very nice.
