We did not find any faults with the hotel and all the staff were friendly. I would recommend this hotel to anyone and would definately return again.

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel with great location”
Reviews.Author: MrIanM
Reviews.Content: Staff were friendly, helpful and polite, the only downside was the fire alarm going off at 9am monday morning, but that wasn't their fault. The room was modern and spacious although there could be more room between the beds but the beds were comfy and I loved the shower. My friend and I were in a twin room. Its 5mins from the station and 5mins from town, so its ideal. Didn't like breakfast much, I think they tried too hard with it being all fancy but it was still edible.

Reviews.Title: “Poor”
Reviews.Author: luis_cp7
Reviews.Content: The rooms are too small. The bathroom is too poor without any shelves. Breakfast poor.

Reviews.Title: “Great value centrally located hotel”
Reviews.Author: NicMTL
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights on business in early February 2010. Had booked a single room via Expedia at the last minute at a very god price (+/- 100$/night) and the receptionist upgraded me to a double without even asking. The Bellevue is a small hotel located across from the train station (extremely convenient) with free wifi (signal strenght is poor however) and recently renovated rooms. Rooms are small but fairly normal for european standards. Since the hotel is downtown, I agree with the other reviewers that it can get noisy outside at night, so try to opt for a courtyard room. Nice staff, and the other clients were respectful and quiet. A very good option for a simple 3 star hotel in a neighborhood where seedy hotels seem to be the norm. Would definitely come back for the location and the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, ideal for short break”
Reviews.Author: Vanmann25
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights and was very impressed.Room more than adequate for short break. We had no "flooding" problem with shower as we had shower over a bath.Room 507. Daughter stayed in Room 509 which had no bath, but had no problem as shower is really just like a small wet room. Hotel much better than I expected and will deinitely return on future trips to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding location, staff and service”
Reviews.Author: lucinda81
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel for 4 nights in mid November and couldn't believe how conveniently located it was from the train station! The hotel is a couple of minutes walk from the Red Light District, Anne Frank House and Jordann area. About a 25 minute walk to the museum district. The room was very spacious, we had plenty of room in the bathroom so stored our suitcase in there. There were a few minor marks on the carpet in the room and the shower curtain was a little grubby. Other than that it was great! The staff were particularly friendly and helpful. We had breakfast each morning in the cafe which consisted of a try with the following - egg, slice of meat, slice of cheese, roll, seeded slice of bread, cinnamon bun, yoghurt, fruit juice and tea and coffee. Sitting in the cafe and watching the hustle and bustle of the city was one of the many highlights of this trip. The breakfast is served till 11am so we didn't have to rush which is great if you've had a late night in the RLD! Checkout was 12 noon and they had a huge luggage room. Not only would I recommend this hotel to friends I won't look at staying anywhere else in the city when we return.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: MaxiEngland
Reviews.Content: Just across the road from central station so perfect location. Tram stops right outside hotel. Large luggage room to store luggage in if arriving too early to check in and to use on day of departure. Room small but clean. Has TV in room which picks up BBC 1. Room was very quiet. Not much storage space but not required for a couple of nights break. Bathroom has shower which drains all over the floor. Also lack of hooks or shelves in bathroom - had to take the chair in from the bedroom to rest things on. Hairdrier available but not that effective. Breakfast is not a buffet but food put out on a tray. Consisted of organic homemade food ie yoghurt, fruit and museli, fruit breads with slice of cheese and tomato, homemade lemon curd and cranberry jam and home made juice plus tea or coffee. Very tasty and different. We bought the 48 hour I Amsterdam pass which was 48 euros. It was good value as it covers most museums, the trams and a canal boat ride. Anne Frank's house is not included in the I Amsterdam pass but well worth the visit. We went soon after it opened on the Sunday morning and there was no queue. Other times of the day there would be a long queue. There is a "free" walk which lasts three hours which you can pick up outside the tourist information centre at central station. You tip the guide with what you think it is worth at the end of the walk. We had a very entertaining guide and it was well worth going on. With the hotel being opposite central station we could never get lost and went all over the place jumping on and off the trams. Very pleased with the location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: itravelaround
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Bellevue on November 25th & 26th. It's right across the street from Centraal Station. I was greeted by a very polite man who upgraded me to a double room. The room was spotless with a flat screen TV. My only gripe is the shower. There is nowhere to catch water from the shower so the floor was a little wet. The free breakfast was very healthy and a perfect way to start the day. I feel the location can't be beat. Within 15 minutes, you can be at the Anne Frank house, Dam Square or the RLD.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel for a short break”
Reviews.Author: Ed21 Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is conveniently situated in a side street opposite the main railway station. The staff all spoke good English. Our room was fairly basic but clean and adequate for a city break. It had limited clothes storage space. The double gazing successfully muted the sound of the traffic outside. There are no tea and coffee making facilities in the room. There are no public rooms except a small reception area and a luggage storage room. Breakfast is served in a cafÃ© next to reception. It is attractively served on a tray and comprises fruit juice, yoghurt with fruit and nuts, various fancy breads with cheese and meat plus coffee or tea. All quite filling and healthy. I would happily recommend this hotel to anyone spending a few days in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location, delicious breakfast, best 3 stars hotel in A'dam”
Reviews.Author: lelibel
Reviews.Content: Such a nice stay! My boyfriend and I just spent 4 nights there and we could not find a better place. The Hotel is just in front of the Central Station, 5 minutes walking from the Jordaan, less than 10 minutes walking from the Dam or from the Red Light. Outside the hotel there are pubs, restaurants, cafes, coffeeshops and stores. The Bellevue is modern and rooms are big enough (not so easy to find in Amsterdam). Very good value for money: I loved Carla's breakfast, fresh and homemade and I would suggest to book your room with breakfast included. Bathroom and shower could be a little bit cleaner but it was fine anyway. I would recomend it to anyone who is wishing to discover A'dam from a very cozy and nice place. We used to live and work in Amsterdam and I am sure this is one of the best 3stars hotel in the whole city.

Reviews.Title: “Good base for sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: GOMCP
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in November 2009 for a weekend. Basically it is an ideal hotel for sightseeing â€“ it is close to Central Station, which is just 15-20 minutes train journey from the airport. From the Station just cross the road (looking out for cyclists! â€“ a permanent problem in Amsterdam) and the hotel is at the top of the street. A five minute walk at the most. We arrived too early for the room, but checked in with no problems and the hotel provides a room to store luggage. The room (314) was small and looked out onto an internal atrium â€“ so it was quiet. As we were visiting Amsterdam for the sites the size of the room did not matter â€“ it was just a base, but if you want space to relax then find another hotel. There was sufficient storage space and a safe, which is always a plus. The lighting in the room was good also. The bathroom was (again) small but very clean. Actually, to call it a bathroom is a misnomer, there is no bath â€“ only a shower, and there is no shower tray â€“ so the floor gets wet. Breakfast was not included in our deal â€“ the hotel has a cafÃ©, which provides bread/cakes/yoghurt etc. As mentioned the hotel is ideal to see the town â€“ most of Amsterdam is within easy walking distance and the trams are efficient and clean for (relatively) long trips. We would certainly recommend this hotel as a base, but not as a place to relax in.

Reviews.Title: “nice place”
Reviews.Author: hubbali666
Reviews.Content: the bellevue is in a good spot,nice room,good service i was there 14 to 19 oct,you can walk to most all the hot spots or take the trams.i was on the 1st floor room 105.

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel in central location”
Reviews.Author: IrishTravelFiend
Reviews.Content: `We stayed in the Bellevue hotel for two nights at the end of December last year. The hotel is centrally based, located directly opposite the main train station. The rooms themselves were very small but clean and comfortable. The staff at the hotel are friendly and there is a very cute cafe attached to the hotel. If we ever return to Amsterdam we would stay at this hotel for its convient location.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location comfortable beds”
Reviews.Author: Mature traveller48
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights. As we realised it was close to main road junction requested rooms at the back on a high floor, which we were given. Rooms had baths and showers, ours had showers, some difficulty might caused by wet floors in bathrooms with no shower tray. Nowhere to put toilet bag in bathroom except on floor. There is a fixed hairdryer in the bathroom. Beds very comfortable, loads of lighting, uncluttered rooms. Not big rooms, but perfectly adequate for a short stay, very modern. The hotel reception staff we spoke to were very helpful. Location was ideal for railway station, return fare from airport to station around 8 euros, best way to travel. There is also a luggage room. Only negative point is breakfast. We were given a tray with breakfast on it, no choice! Fruit juice was different each day, with a bread roll, slice of meat, cheese, two pieces of fruit style bread and yoghurt with nuts and apple in, not very good if you have allergies to wheat and dairy. Saying this there are restaurants/shops nearby that you could purchase breakfast from.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Comfortable & Great location”
Reviews.Author: Moobyrdie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from an 11 day trip to 4 cities in Europe. Amsterdam, ended up being our favorite city - mostly due to where we stayed. The Bellevue Hotel was a pleasant surprise, with bright modern rooms, super comfortable beds and friendly staff. The area around the hotel is great, not too close to the wild party scenes of the red-light distrist, but safe and walkable to all destinations should you choose to. It is also close to the train station, making travel a cinch. I can't wait to go back to Amsterdam, and we can't wait to stay in the Bellevue Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Would not return to Belleview Hotel”
Reviews.Author: shielshome
Reviews.Content: Great location with friendly staff (with one exception). Room was very cramped and a poor shape, bathroom had only one tiny glass shelf, which was well above head height. There was nowhere to set out personal items. Breakfast was a dictatorship. When asked if we enjoyed breakfast, I replied that I had, but that I would have preferred some choice. This criticism was obviously not appreciated, with the response that "choice is an old fashioned idea". I was not amused and would not return to the Belleview.

Reviews.Title: “Okay for a night if you're not claustrophobic”
Reviews.Author: AlvinNarod
Reviews.Content: I had planned on spending longer in Amsterdam on this trip but, when researching , I found Amsterdam hotel rooms to be relatively overpriced and lower in standard to other European cities I visited, such as Bern, Berlin and Innsbruck. So I only booked a night in Amsterdam, to catch a morning flight to London. No big worries here since I've visited Amsterdam a few times before (all at t he Leidse Square Hotel which Iâ€™d recommend above the Bellevue, even though itâ€™s about a 10-15 min tram ride away from Centraal Station). Since I was only in Amsterdam for a night, I thought I'd try something convenient to the railway station, hence the Bellevue. At check in, they couldn't find my booking (booked through Expedi.ca) so they told me not to worry and that, because of that, I'd get a superior room. Then they found my booking (booked under my middle name instead of my last name, for some unknown reason in spite of my Expedia booking showing my last name) and then told me, sorry, I'd not get the upgrade now, just the ordinary room for me! Nevertheless the staff, ranging from the reception to the breakfast room, were all exceedingly pleasant. Security seemed good since you needed your room card to operate the obviously-new elevatore. As expected from the reviews on TripAdvisor.com, my room was VERY small! There was nowhere to put my luggage, except on top of the bed. No frills either but reasonably clean although the carpet had a few marks and some of the paint was peeling in the shower area of the bathroom. There was NO VIEW from the window, except for another window about 1.5 metres away, which actually was a hallway window so people in the hallway could see inside my room unless I pulled down the blind and then the room became dark. Although there was no noise from the street, there was a bit of noise from the hallway and from other rooms, with doors clashing etc., not too bothersome but certainly indicative of the poorly insulated construction. Two good things about this hotel were that Wi-Fi access throughout the hotel, including the room, was free and breakfast was included in the room rate. Breakfast was the usual European breakfast fare; they were a bit late in getting started in the morning but eventually, everything arrived and the buffet table was ready. I'd consider staying at this hotel again, but only for a single night to make an easy connection at the railway station for Schiphol. If I am to be in Amsterdam for more than one night, I'd prefer a hotel with larger rooms even though it meant a tram ride from the station. The one thing this hotel has going for it is its proximity to Centraal Station. It's literally across the street, only 5 min walk. So I would recommend this hotel to a friend, but only for a stay of a single night.

Reviews.Title: “Central jump off point for sightseeing in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: RollingStone61
Reviews.Content: Small, modern hotel close to main train station and shopping district. Only minus points: no free parking (paid 50 Euros for 24 hrs. in a public park garage!) and street noise... street car tracks directly in front of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, small rooms”
Reviews.Author: WorldTraveler1975
Reviews.Content: Excellent location right across the street from Centraal station. Rooms are small, but has all the basics and the bed was comfortable. The bathroom shower doesn't have a ledge so the water can run all through the bathroom floor if you're not careful. Good water pressure and hot. Didn't spend much time in the room so didn't mind the small room. It was a good value and I'd stay here again if I were travelling by myself.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, rude staff, small room, smaller hotel”
Reviews.Author: edwie
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on reviews I read here. The location is EXCELLENT... across the street from Centraal Station. The hotel was comfortable but I had problems with it. The hotel staff was rude (not to me, thouh)... It is indian managed and they seemed to fight a lot against each other. The lobby is very small, it fits around 10 people. Check-in was slow. Check-out was even slower. The room was very small and the air conditioning never worked. The bathroom shower has no division, all the water goes straight to the floor. Single beds are less than twin. Corridors are horribly narrow. This hotel is perfect for one night (I stayed for one night due to a difference of time among intercontinental flights). That's about it. 3 days here you'll go crazy. Good security, but if you want to go out at night or get in you need to ring the bell and the concierge is not always there. BTW this hotel is horribly, horribly overpriced, even for Amsterdam standards. For less than that, you can stay at a big, posh hotel in the Amstel area.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: shandi
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 nights here. Staff very helpful. Breakfast ok--staff friendly. Best feature was the hotel is 'toss of the stone' to train station and visitor information center. I used an I Amsterdam pass to museums and for public transportation. I highly recommend it. Allows you to enter shorter lines. Takes worry out of transportation. Many of the tram lines originate from the train station so transportation was super convenient. Room wasn't spectacular but it was clean and comfortable. I didn't go to Amsterdam to sit in my room. Sign up for walking tour of Red Light District. Our guide (Zoom tours) was a historian and very informative. Avoid Lindbergh bus tour. First stop is diamond factory. That was half hour could have spent seeing the city.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, Clean, Friendly & Reasonable”
Reviews.Author: 2-4-the-road-ahead
Reviews.Content: Hi, We only stayed one night but all the staff were helpful & friendly. A great place and close to many interesting sights! Across the road from the train station. Hope you enjoy Amsterdam as we did.

Reviews.Title: “Good clean hotel...for Amsterdam standards....”
Reviews.Author: caseyk1984
Reviews.Content: Just come back from a 3day break to Amsterdam and stayed 2 nights at the Bellevue Hotel. What can I say, the location is great, especially as the 4 of us (All Girls) dont travel light! Central Station is just a quick walk across the road from the Hotel, and all main areas of the city are in walking distance. We had booked a quad room, but a week or so before we were due to arrive, we recieved an email saying room was 'Unavaiable due to issues with the shower room'. When we arrived we were allocated two twin rooms next door to each other, and also given free breakfast so that was fine. Due to flight times we did arrive at the hotel early, around 11am, and was allowed to leave our bags in the luggage room while our rooms where being cleaned. We were told the rooms would be ready at 2pm, so we had some lunch and had a look around the city and returned to the reception desk just before 2. The staff on the desk where helpfull and gave us a drink while we were waiting...But 50 mins later we were still sat in reception waiting for our rooms to be ready! The rooms are very clean, modern, bright and beds are very comfy,we had a room away from the main road and was really quiet. Breakfast was okay, wouldnt of paid for it especially. On the morning of check out we had a call from reception, reminding us that we need to check out before 12pm.....thought that was rather rude considering we had to wait almost an hour before we could get into our rooms!! Having been to Amsterdam before and stayed in the Renaissance Hotel around the corner, the service was second to none...you get what you pay for but if you want a clean, safe cheap hotel in Amsterdam book the Bellevue.

Reviews.Title: “Small but good value”
Reviews.Author: ButterflyFish10
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel for it's proximity to the station which is great if (unlike us) you emerge from the right exit! (It's just a 5 minute walk from the far right exit). Stayed for 1 night in a room overlooking the street. With earplugs in and the air-conditioning on we weren't kept awake by the noise below. The room was small but functional, although I thought it was a little tired. Also I found the mattress to be a bit uncomfortable. However on the positive side, the staff were very friendly and the breakfast good. Location is excellent. Didn't use the hotel's shuttle to the airport but that costs approx 14 euros p.p compared to 4 for the train.

Reviews.Title: “Note for light sleepers”
Reviews.Author: konekel
Reviews.Content: I agree with the other positive reviews of this hotel, but wanted to note especially that you can get a good room here if you are light sleeper like me. This was the third of three hotels we stayed at in the Netherlands (Amsterdam, Rotterdam, back to Amsterdam) and in the first two the street noise made it really hard for me to sleep. I emailed ahead to the Bellevue and asked if they could give us a quiet room, and they said they could. The window in our small-but-perfectly-fine room opened onto a decorated air shaft - no view, but it was heavenly to me! So if noise is an issue for you, ask for one of the air shaft rooms and you'll be happy.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, clean and friendly”
Reviews.Author: Becs_9
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a really good location being close to Dam square as well as Central Station. It was clean and modern and the staff were very friendly. Rooms were small and bathroom was kind of just a cubicle, but certainly fine if you are there to see Amsterdam rather than stay in your hotel. The worst thing was probably the very small shower with shower curtain - difficult to wash your hair and the shower curtain keeps sticking to you! Otherwise, it was was good, clean and we felt very safe there. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Worth what it costs”
Reviews.Author: ExistenzZ
Reviews.Content: Small room but adequate, quiet, clean, air-conditioning running. Breakfast good, wi-fi Internet. Excellent location! 150mt far from Central Station and close to everything

Reviews.Title: “Central location, with clean modern rooms.”
Reviews.Author: JayDeeLondon
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 2 nights on a long weekend and had a great stay. Check-in was fast and efficient. The room wasn't enormous (it was only a single room) and as with most hotel rooms in Amsterdam this seems to be the norm, but it has all the amenities a single traveller could ask for. The bathroom was clean and the towels were changed daily. The decor is modern with the flat screen TV built into the wall. All the single rooms are located on the inside of the building, so there's not much of a view out of the window, but the bonus to that was it was fairly quiet. Plus the rooms have double glazing and air-conditioning. Free Wifi is also provided. The location of the Hotel is convenient. It's is opposite Centraal Station (literally a 5 mins walk), and walking distance to Dam Square, the Red light District, China Town and other tourist attractions. The staff were very helpful and if like me you need to check out with hours to spare before your flight, then you can leave your luggage in a locked room. All in all, I would recommend staying at this hotel and will stay there again, the next time I visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay--clean and neat”
Reviews.Author: nasoo
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Bellevue Hotel for 4 nights in May. Firstly, the hotel is a small walk from the train station but with luggage its not a very easy task. So if you considering walking from central station to hotel, do so with minimal luggage. Reception staff are very friendly and efficient. Check in was quick and painless. Room was very clean and neat but extremely small. But i guess if you not going to spend much time in your room, its fine. Bed was comfy but pillows were not. The pillows were these high, square pillows which were uncomfortable to sleep on. Only disappointment was that they could not provide a kettle to boil water for the baby. Bathroom is also small, no space around basin to put toothbrushes and stuff. But otherwise was comfortable. The hotel was very central, so walking to dam square and central station was very easy. Also trams were very quick and easy to use. Breakfast was plentiful but only worth it if included. Overall our stay was good, I would definately stay there again. P.s. Have to say that thanks to other tripadvisor members, we ate at maoz vegetarian restaurant and we were not disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “One of my best stays in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Balou1999
Reviews.Content: I chose the Bellevue for it's close proximity to Centraal Station, it is right across the street! The hotel is very modern but comfortable. They have free wireless, which is a big plus. I originally booked a single but was upgraded to a double for free! The staff were very nice & helpful. I would skip the buffet, unless it's included in the rate. Food was decent and plentiful. I would definitely recommend this hotel for anyone that wants a quality hotel, that's not too expensive, and close to the train station.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - Friendly - Compact Rooms”
Reviews.Author: SANNS
Reviews.Content: My daughter & I stayed at the Bellevue in late October 2008. This hotel is perfectly situated - close to everything, the train station, is almost across the road. You are close to restaurants, main shopping district & easy walk to most attractions - even the ever popular 'Red Light District'. The staff are so friendly & helpful, the rooms have been recently renovated, the only problem is the rooms are what you would call'compact'. We asked for twin beds & the beds were that close that they might as well been a queen, not much room to put cases, bathroom small but well appointed, shower above a bathtub, but that was no problem - very clean. I always say the size of the room doesn't count because you are only there to sleep, but unfortunately my daughter came down with a heavy cold & we ended up spending a lot more time in the room than we normally would have, so I did feel a little cramped. Street noise was at a minium, & we only had one night with noise coming from the room above us, it always amazes me the inconsideration some people have for fellow travellers. Overall for the price it was excellent value for money, & if you don't mind cramped quarters, then the location of this hotel far outways the size of the rooms. I would consider staying at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth considering..... comes highly recommended indeed.”
Reviews.Author: System38
Reviews.Content: Great location, very friendly staff and good clean rooms all went a long way in making my stay at the hotel Bellevue very enjoyable indeed, although admittedly not much time was spent in the hotel. Yes it is expensive for a 3 star property, however, I must add that from my experience it does rate at the very upper end of 3 star, so don't get hung up on ratings as you will not be disappointed. I can only reiterate previous postings about location and convenience. The double room was on the small side but more than adequete for single occupancy, anyway when in Amsterdam who wants to spend a weekend in their room hotel room? It was clean, bright and served me well for 'power naps'! If in need of peace and quiet ask for a such a room when booking and I am sure the hotel will oblige if they can. Although not affording a great city view, room 410 was indeed as far away from street noise as you can get. As with previous stays in Dam breakfast was taken elsewhere so cannot comment on that, but a busy restaurant says to me that the kitchen must be doing something right. If looking at a weekend stay get your reservation in quick as I observed at least half a dozen travellers being turned away in a fifteen minute spell on a Saturday morning.... that must say something in itself? Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Best Amsterdam Stay Ever!”
Reviews.Author: AngryExpat
Reviews.Content: I am so mystified by some of the negative reviews that I felt compelled to jump in the fray... I have visited Amsterdam about 25 times over the past few years, and I've tried everything from renting a flat to staying in a luxury hotel. The Bellevue is the best I've found for value, location, amenities, service, security and just fun. I mean, free wifi? Wow! Fine, the breakfast is not included in the price. But who really wants to eat a Dutch-style breakfast for 12,50 when there's 20 places to eat just in a 5-block radius? (I recommend Barney's for their English Breakfast and Haarlem CafÃ© for lunch and people-watching.) This is an ideal location for a first visit, straddling the border the Centrum and Jordan neighborhoods. Everything you could want is within walking distance. And if you have the good fortune to stay in room 505, as I did, you will have a place just outside your door to smoke and watch the view of Central Station. Look, Amsterdam is full of shucksters who prey on inexperienced first-time visitors. I have stayed in so many fleabag joints in an effort to save money. Now that I've found this place, I won't stay anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean, modernised and great value for money”
Reviews.Author: Dai_&_Julie_Jones
Reviews.Content: Other than the Ibis (built on legs above platforms 1 & 2 of Centraal station) this is as near to the station as one can be. Just walk out of the furthest right exit from the station, cross the bridge in front and to the right and the hotel is just across the road. Back towards the railway station boats leave on canal trips and trams from Dam Square, Liedseplein and Rijksmuseum & Van Gogh Museum stop in front of the hotel. Rooms facing the street could be a bit noisy but if you ask far enough in advance for a high floor quiet room they should be able to accommodate you. Room 508 has views across the roof tops but is a bit small. It was very quiet as there are no neighbouring rooms on either side. It was spotlessly clean, decorated in white and pale colours and was more than adequate for a few day's stay. The flat screen TV set into the wall received BBC1, 2 and News. The hotel served a full cooked buffet breakfast and at lunch offered good value snacks. Quite a few non resident travellers breakfasted in the restaurant. Part of the Bellevue Hotel, less than 20 metres along the pavement from the hotel entrance, is Amsterdam's oldest cafÃ©, CafÃ© Karpershoek where one could sit and savour the local atmosphere. To be thoroughly recommended is the free walking tour operated by Sandemans.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: norwaycouple
Reviews.Content: Plus: Ideal location by the central station and shopping area. Good american breakfast. Clean and decent rooms. comfortable beds. Minus: can not think of any major...

Reviews.Title: “A very pleasant stay at a great value for money hotel.”
Reviews.Author: eileenlove
Reviews.Content: Just back from a break in amsterdam. this hotel top notch. Staff friendly rooms spotless, bed linen and towels snow white. Breakfast good too. Easy walking distance to all local attractions. This was our first visit to Amsterdam. will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely recommend for a short break”
Reviews.Author: daviesg21
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Bellevue is a short stroll from the Centraal Station in Amsterdam. Its location is excellent, situated on a tram line, next to canals and information centres where you can book any tours you wish. The hotel is a 10 minute walk from Dam Square. The city itself is very easy and pleasant to walk around. Although do take care of the cyclists - in a collision it'll hurt you more than it'll hurt them!! Back to the hotel - the rooms are small, but perfectly equipped for a short city break. Good sized bed, flat screen TV, phone, large safe, wardrobe, table, chair. Bathrooms are economic in space with slide doors, but not lacking anything. Novelty in each room is the 'landscape' walls - we had green grass scape covering one entire wall! Staff very helpful, breakfast not great though, but central location means there are plenty of places to grab something in a morning. We requested a room at the back on suggestion from another Trip Advisor review, and was very quiet and pleasant. Would certainly recommend to anyone for a short break, the Bellevue was exactly what we wanted and we were very pleased with it.

Reviews.Title: “brill,clean.friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: koolphone
Reviews.Content: really close to the train station,10 mins from dam square close 2 all shopping amenties i really enjoyed this hotel 14 of us went 4 a birthday from fri to tues on arrival we were checked in really quickly considering how many of us were there, my room was quiet small but lovely and clean,bathroom spotless cleaned everyday other people from our party had bigger rooms which were great,i had a view looking out onto the street could hear the trams and traffic but no problems with this at all,breakfast was lovely simple foods but something for everyone times for breakfast were brill mon-fri 7am-11am and sat sun was 7.30-12.00 for those people who dont like an early start which was brill for all us,staff very pleasant and very helpful we done a few day trips ann franks,madame tussands and the dungeons all brill definitely recommend these,roads very busy so be very careful of the traffic dont let this put u off it was my 1st time in amsterdam and definitely not my last and i would definitely recommend this hotel 2 anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: vscalone
Reviews.Content: First, I usually travel alone and meet up with people I know when I am abroad, so as far as a room that is luxurious with a lot of space isn't a top priority for me. I mean after all, I'm visiting these places to see sites and soak up the atmosphere, not sit in my room. With that said, the location of this hotel is FANTASTIC!! You find yourself right in the hub of transportation center. Anywhere you want to go you can get there just by walking a short block to Central Station. My room, 124, was a single. It was the perfect amount of space, clean, efficient and plenty of decent television station selection. The only negatives are the following: the mattress could be firmer, a mini bar in the room would have been a nice asset and a place to put ones toiletries in the actual shower area was absent. Other than that, there's no reason not to choose this hotel. A friendly staff and good buffet morning breakfast make Bellevue Hotel a great choice in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid...or they may charge you more.”
Reviews.Author: NapsRJ
Reviews.Content: Last May, unfortunately I have booked this hotel. The location is convenient if you carry bags and arrive in the train station. That is it. The surroundings are unpleasent, the streets are dirty and almost ruined my impression about the city. The hotel could not have caused a worse first impression. As I arrived he receptionist said they had my booking but they did not know if they had a room and that they did not know if they would honor the fee. I was suggested to check in and a manager would tell me availability of the following nights and at what price ??? Can you believe it? Luckly I booked on Hotel.de and immediatelly called the website, 5 minutes after my call I was contacted by the website saying it was all set, the recepcionist called and said they would honor. This is really a scam to rip you off. The next morning I went to have breakfast (that was really not great) and they tried to charge me, despite the fact it was included in the valued I had paid for. I had to call hotel.de again and they fixed it for me. Although I had not paid anything extra, every morining they tried to charge me breakfast. Thanks to hotel.de and their attendants I was not ripped off by the hotel. the room could not be smaller, my wife and I could barely stand up in the room at the same time. It is clean and the furniture is new. I have decided for this hotel based on the excellent reviews here, but I did not know there was the chance to get pressured and intimidated by the staff with the goal of taking my money. If i knew there was 1% chance of this happning I would choose another option. Sincerely, does not worth the terrible experience.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a weekend stay”
Reviews.Author: LondonDomino
Reviews.Content: We stayed in one of the newer rooms in February 2009 and it was perfect - no noise from the road, air con, gorgeous bathroom and comfortable beds. Staff were efficient, friendly and very helpful. Just minutes from the station it was so easy to drop our bags and start exploring. Don't be fooled by maps, you are not at all on the outskirts here - it's, at most, a 10 minute walk to Dam Square. Would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “So central and convenient for the whole city ...”
Reviews.Author: Cinq5alive
Reviews.Content: Really quite impressed with this hotel. Excellent location, clean, friendly staff - and great value - what more could you want? I was on the fifth floor overlooking the main street - could hear the trams rolling by during the late evening but didn't detract from an overall good experience. Room a little cold at first but soon sorted this out with aircon unit. Basic bathroom but functional and clean. Flat screen TV with some very interesting channels late at night!! Not sure you'll beat this hotel for value. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean rooms!”
Reviews.Author: Helluh
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a night at the beginning of December 2007. The hotel is well-situated, a few minutes walk from Centraal station. The room was clean, the staff was friendly and the breakfast was good, great value for money! We would definitely stay here again. This hotel is perfect for a short stay in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Compact rooms, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Stuff10
Reviews.Content: We stopped at this hotel for 4 nights at the beginning of March 2008. The hotel is in an excellent location for central Amsterdam, just across from Centraal Station. We wanted a hotel with modern rooms at a reasonable price and this is exactly what we got. The faÃ§ade of the hotel is typical of Amsterdam, once inside though it is like any modern hotel, like I said, just what we wanted. Our room was quite small, but I was prepared for this having read previous reviews. It was nice actually having a double bed, not very common on the continent in mid range hotels! The shower room is definitely a â€˜wet roomâ€™ with water going everywhere! It is definitely compact but ideal for a short trip away! In the room is a small wardrobe and a few shelves and also a free safe. We had no view out of our window and just kept the blind shut, we werenâ€™t in the room long enough to look outside! The flat screen tv on the wall had plenty of channels on it, if you want to watch tv! The walls are quite thin and we could hear people in the corridors but werenâ€™t woken up in the middle of the night and could hear cleaners in the morning but theyâ€™re only doing their job! We were at the back of the hotel so didnâ€™t hear any street noise. There is a luggage room in the hotel which we used on our last day due to a late flight. We didnâ€™t eat breakfast at the hotel or use the restaurant/bar so canâ€™t comment on this! There is however an excellent little sandwich shop next to the hotel, we just got a baguette from there for breakfast! Much cheaper! This hotel is very central and within walking distance of everywhere and across the road from the boat trips. We would certainly recommend this hotel and use it again if we go to Amsterdam. With Amsterdam in general we found it to be a nice place and felt reasonably safe everywhere we walked. It is a very busy city (you need to watch out from trams, buses, bikes etc all the time! They come out of nowhere!) and is quite expensive for food and drinks but nevertheless is definitely a city to be experienced!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: lostinDC
Reviews.Content: Stayed a week in the Bellevue Hotel during mid-December. Arrived early--around 9:00 from Schiphol airport and at check-in the staff were kind enough to upgrade my room and offer me the room right away. Having read the advice on this website, I requested a room in the back, which was very quiet. I did hear other guests opening and closing doors in the hallway, but no outside noise. The room was comfortable and clean. Housekeeping did a good job. Breakfast which was included (they charge 10 euros otherwise) was "American-style," with eggs, bacon, bread, cereal and so forth. I found the location--across the street from Centraal Station--to be very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel”
Reviews.Author: m.giroux
Reviews.Content: I stayed 24 and 25 december 2008 and found the hotel well-situated, clean, friendly and a very good value at 65â‚¬ /night for a single. The hotel was not too full, so I think I got a "double" room, and I would agree it would be a little tight for two people with a lot of baggage. Agree with the comment that there is some noise in the hallway in the morning, but it did not start until after 9am, so really not a problem. I was very satisfied with the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and clean”
Reviews.Author: aoikath
Reviews.Content: I loved the location of this hotel, very easy to find. Get out of the train station, head to your right, walk pass the bike rental place and cross the streeet, and you'll be able to find the Sign of Bellvue Hotel. I took a day trip to Utrecht and Den Haag, and then I also took the train to Groningen. So, being close to the train station was just what I needed. When visiting Amsterdam, this location is great too, as you can always find the tram at the central station. You can also walk to almost everywhere. One morning, I took the tram down to visit Rijksmuseum and Van Gogh museum. After I was done for the day, I actually walked back to the hotel. It wasn't a short walk of course, but it was a pleasant walk while during some shopping on my way, and just to explore the city. My room is facing the street on the 5th floor, I have a lovely view. I was so excited to open up the curtain every morning. I was staying in this hotel during third week of December. I could see the sunrise every day (around 8am) However, since it's located so close to the station, you can't avoid the noise. the cars and trams makes it a bit noisy at night, it dies down around midnight, and in the morning starting around 6:30am (I guess), you'll started to hear them again. But for me, I can sleep through everything, so it didn't bother me. But if you are a light sleeper, you might take this into consideration. Maybe ask them for a room that is not facing the street would help?One of the window can't be completely closed. When it's closed, there's still a teeny tiny gap that some cold air, and noise, come through. Not sure if that's just my room. But again, that wasn't a big problem for me. My room was very clean, but not everything is in great condition. my comforter had a tear in the inside (I was going to ask for a different one, but I was too lazy to deal with that).The bed was not the most comfortable mattress, the heaters only goes up to 26 degree (but the room is still a little cold for me personally). I had a double room for myself, so i have enough space, and I think it would fit a couple comfortably. there is no coffee facilities by the way. The Bathroom was clean, but there were a bit dark stains at the corners of the wall around the bathtub. Something is chipping off from the faucet.But I have to say the condition wasn't unacceptable.The shower curtain wasn't dirty, but i do wish that they would replace it. Shower is always hot enough, hair dryer works really well.Only shower gel is provided. During my 6 nights stay, the towel sets only get replaced twice. But since I was staying there alone, I just use the other clean one when they have not replaced it. When I checked in, the staff was very nice and friendly. When I checked out, they were alright. But when I asked if they could break a $50 bill for me the guy sitting next to the girl I was asking interupted and just say "No, we can't do that, we don't have enough small bills, go to the train station." Fine, but at least he could say it in a nicer way. Afterall, for around 75euro per night at such a great location. I still think it's a good hotel choice in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: AdventureLass
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a 5 minute walk from Central Station and conveniently located to dozens of restaurants, shops, souvenir shops, and sites. It's a 15 minute walk from Dam Square. The staff was friendly and very helpful. The room was small but very clean and the noise level in the hallway was at a minimum. The continental breakfast included breads, juice, coffee & tea, fruit, deli style meats, bacon, scrambled eggs, baked beans, and Poffertjes (mini Dutch pancakes). I would definately stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Simple, clean hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Tarff
Reviews.Content: The Bellevue Hotel is a small and simple hotel located 2 minutes walk from Amsterdam Centraal train station and the Damrak, possibly the city's busiest street. We booked a double room and were given room 314 on the 3rd floor. It was a very compact wee room but very clean and the furnishings looked quite new. The bathroom/shower room was small but functional and included one of those 'open' showers theyre so fond of on the continent - no actual shower fitting, just a curtain in the corner of the bathroom. But like I said it filled it's purpose very well and the water was always hot The room also included a small working safe and a wall-mounted flatscreen tv which showed around 20 channels, of which around 6 or 7 were in English including major news channels. We didn'y have breakfast at the hotel as it was 10Euro and there are several places on Damrak offering breakfast and drinks for around 6 Euro, but the dining room was always busy so they must lay on a decent spread. The hotels location could not be better. Right at the heart of Amsterdam it is 2 minutes walk from the main train station (which itself is only 20 minutes from Schipol Airport) and 5 minutes from Dam Square where performers and artists were still hard at it even in cold November. The hotel was again only 5 minutes from the red light district and coffee shops, but this whole area is kind of hidden away and if you don't want to be bothered by it you can avoid it easily. All-in-all for the price and location the hotel cannot be beat, and I was pleasantly surprised at the standard of the rooms. OK they are small and the halls look like a hostel but I'd definitely reccomend the Bellevue to most.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and value for money”
Reviews.Author: NamXpert
Reviews.Content: The hotel is really only a few minutes away from Central Station. I only arrived there at 11PM, but it was no hassle finding the hotel from Central Station. I was booked into a single room, which was quite small but that was no problem. It seems though that the single rooms are located at the back of the hotel and you have no view at all. It's no problem at all though as most of the time you spend exploring the city and then you don't care about the view. The hotel and room itself was very clean and the staff is just fantastic.The Hotel also offers free WiFi, which I didn't expect for the price that I paid. If you compare this to other small budget hotels in the area, this hotel is a gem. It's no wonder that I needed to book this hotel quite a while in advance as this is value for money. The location can't be any better and the whole of Amsterdam can be visited on foot from here. It's really just a hop away from everything Amsterdam has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: Melissa D
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights at the Bellevue Hotel in September/October - 28-01, 2008. The hotel room is is very clean and tiny, but it haven't bothered us at all. The room has a full-lenght mirror, wich I think is very useful, and the bed is very confy. The staff is very friendly and helpful, the restaurant surprised us, it has really nice food. The room we stayed in, wasn't noisy, so we could relax and sleep well after walking all day long through Amsterdam, which is a lovely city. The hotel has a great location as well, it's central and few minutes walk from the train station. Bellevue hotel is a great value for money. I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for tourists”
Reviews.Author: Morningsider
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights whilst holidaying in Amsterdam. The property is pretty close to the train station - Amsterdam Centraal (5 minute walk). Whilst the room was tiny, it was quite well presented. The lighting in the room was swank. The hotel is located on a street parallel to the Damrak and served as a perfect base to explore this wonderful city.

Reviews.Title: “Small but small”
Reviews.Author: Rjoc
Reviews.Content: If I were an estate agent I would describe this hotel as a compact, charming hotel with an excellent location. But I'm not an estate agent and thank God I'm only 5 foot nothing! The Bellevue is all about location. Central Station is across the road so access to trains, trams, buses and taxis is quite literally on your doorstep. You are only a five minute walk to Dam Square and the Red Light district. Check in was very straight forward. No big welcome but efficient nonetheless. My twin room looked onto Central Station and was basic to say the least. It was tiny. The beds were pushed together, they wouldn't have fit into the room otherwise. There is a small closet and a small desk with one chair in the corner. If you are sitting at the desk you cannot open the door to your room. There is however a safe in the room. The tv is mounted flat onto the wall and there was about 6 inches between the wall and the end of the bed. The bathroom actually had a really nice tub but the wall was angled in such a way that a taller person would have difficulty taking a shower. Quite unbelievably, the was nowhere to store as much as a toothbrush in the bathroom and I had to leave my toiletries in my toilet bag on the side of the bath. Despite everything, I qutie enjoyed the quirkiness of the Bellevue and to be honest I've stayed in worse hotels. I would forego breakfast as the dinning room, in keeping with the hotel, is quite small and the was always a queue to get in. Plenty of bars and cafes around to sort you out. It's definately not a hotel for those who like there comfort and it's not somewhere I would bring my wife for a romantic getaway. But it is somewher to rest your head and does offer an excellent location to go and explore a great city.

Reviews.Title: “Pros & Cons”
Reviews.Author: templowe
Reviews.Content: Just back after spending 4 nights at the Bellevue - booked (as ususal) on the back of Tripadvisor reviews. PROs: Great location - 3 minutes from Central Station. Clean - room was spotless. Very pleasant staff at reception. Comfortable bed. Generally speaking, what more could you ask for? BUT..... CONs: NO coffeee/tea facilities. NO mini-bar/fridge. NO ironing facilities. NO ice machines on premises. ALSO: one inch gap along bottom of room door meant both noise from other guests and light from hall came into room - ended up wedging coats into the gap in an attempt to keep out both. Rooms at front can be alittle noisy as hotel is situated at a busy junction. The room was a little cramped and definitely strangely laid out but it is Amsterdam after all. Overall I'd have to say that I have stayed in worse but at around Â£110 per night for a standard double I would have expected a little more - even real glasses in the bathroom would have been nice rather than the cheap disposable ones which went unchanged by room service for the entire length of our stay. SL N. Ireland

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Wonderful City”
Reviews.Author: Raccy
Reviews.Content: I was dreading the small room problem that I read about on this web site. It turned out to not be much of an issue. We were at the end of a 2 week trip that included 10 days on a cruise in the Baltic Sea. This means a lot of luggage to lug around. We had 3 45-50 Lb bags. They all fit in the room, the 2 chairs have to face each other, with one bag resting on the 2 seats. We had a room facing the street (highly recommended). The bathroom had a good size window sill to leave your bathrooom accessories on. The flat screen TV and the beds were very acceptable. We did not have breakfast included, so went to the corner restaurant every morning (turn right as you leave the hotel). The prices were reasonable and the quality of the food and service was 1st rate. We tried the hotel restaurant when we initially checked in. It was very expensive, and the waitress left a lot to be desired. She did not ask if we were staying at the hotel. This caused me to use a credit card for the full price. When I signed the receipt I found out we were entitled to a 10% discount and could have added it to the bill at check-out. She would not reverse the charge and could not understand why this was a problem. I complained to the front desk, but I don't think management was that concerned. Of course I would not consider eating at their restaurant for the remainder of the 4 day stay. The rest of the staff were good, with the front desk being really outstanding. The train from the airport to the Central Station is about 20 minutes and cost 8 Euros for 2 people. When you come out of the station, go right, past all the bicycles and walk across the street to the hotel. I did not find out about the Amsterdam discount book for museums, restaurants and trams until the last day of the trip. I believe it is called, "I love Amsterdam". It looks like you can save a considerable amount of money by getting it. The front desk must know where to buy them. Amsterdam is a terrific city with wonderful sites, great night life and very friendly people. Not speaking Dutch is not a problem, as they teach English in the schools from the fourth grade through High School. Enjoy the City!!!

Reviews.Title: “Alright hotel”
Reviews.Author: mdnm8183
Reviews.Content: This was alright hotel considering the price. From a location point of view it was good and we found we were never far away from any of the locations we had to go to in the city. The room we were in was clean but small. It faced onto an internal light shaft so we had no view, meaning you basically kept the blind down. We also found that the beds dipped in at the middle which was a little uncomfortable but the room itself was quite, which was a plus. For the price it was adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: JDBLondon
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in a bit of a dump last time we went to Amsterdam, I was hoping that this place would be a little better and was pleasantly surprised. The rooms are small, which is normal for Amsterdam but fine for a weekend stay. The place is clean and friendly and the breakfast was good. Its right by the station which we found very handy as we stored our bags there on the last day. It also meant that we were walking distance to everything which made getting about so easy. Its on a main road so its not quiet but it wasnt enough noise to disturb us too much. We got a good price on the room which made it really good value for the money and I would re book if we came back providing the room rate was as good.

Reviews.Title: “Bellevue is believably the best budget bargain”
Reviews.Author: flightcrew1971
Reviews.Content: As an airline employee, I have had the pleasure of visiting Amsterdam dozens of times with the opportunity to experience new hotel properties on each trip. My most recent stay in July, 2008 brought me to the Bellevue after reading the many positive reviews at Tripadvisor. My only disappointment was that I did not stay here previously! In brief detail, here are the top reasons why you might want to stay here too: 1) Location: Walk out of Centraal Station, cross the street and turn right and you're home at your hotel. Early morning flights from Schipol are no problem anymore and you won't tire from lugging your luggage across town to the train. 2) Ambiance: The post-modern minimalist decor is fantastic. Ambient light comes from everywhere in the room and the white color scheme makes the rooms feel much larger than they actually are. As one reviewer noted, the showers are wonderful with great water pressure and hot water that never runs out. 3) Free WiFi: Excellent speeds and strong signal; enough said. 4) Security: No room key - no lift access. 5) Comfort: Soft, comfy beds and AIRCON make for a good night's sleep. 6) Service: Staff were exceptionally friendly and helpful. I had to have some travel documents from the UK sent far in advance of my arrival and they were waiting for me upon check-in with no hassle. 7) Price point: Amsterdam is expensive, period. In my opinion, the room rates are very reasonable comparable with other hotels that do not offer the above six reasons to stay here. Negatives: 1) It's a non-smoking property. If you like to have your coffeeshop smokes in your room you'll have to go outside to take a puff. 2) Location: If you do not need easy train access and/or don't have a lot of luggage to haul around, then there are far better places to stay outside the tourist trap of the Damrak area. Even better, get out of Amsterdam and stay in Haarlem or Zandvoort and take the train in to town for your shopping and nightlife. Hope that helps with your travel plans; have a great time in Europe's top city!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, tiny rooms”
Reviews.Author: worldtrvlr8
Reviews.Content: Location is great if you want to be close to the train station and the action in that general area, which we did. Our room faced the street and it was surprisingly quiet with the windows closed (the air conditioning worked very well). If you're hoping to be in a more peaceful area (near Vondelpark, the museums, the quieter canals), choose another hotel. For us, the location was just right. The rooms are tiny and the furniture is awkwardly arranged. Practicality is sacrificed for high style. Is it too much to ask for the bathroom to have one surface big enough to place a toothbrush? For any task that requires you to use more than one item at a time (shaving, putting on makeup) you need to be a juggler -- there is absolutely nowhere to put anything, not even on the side of the sink. You'll need to keep your toiletries somewhere near the bed and constantly carry everything you need in and out of the bathroom. Foolish design choices! We had a superior twin and for two people it was very crowded, even allowing for generally small hotel rooms in Europe. Room was clean, but the carpet is geting dirty. The plastic cups in my room had been used (and washed, I believe) and were cracked. Mattresses are thin. Breakfast is good (it was included in our room rate). I would stay here again if I found a great deal online, despite the oddities of the rooms, mainly because the location is so good. Nice staff in the lobby and in the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “love this hotel...location...location”
Reviews.Author: mahleen
Reviews.Content: just got back from AMS and this hotel has the best location. it's across central station and all the sightseeing places. the staff are very helpful. room is clean and quiet, bit smaller but functional. we didn't use the free breakfast since we woke up after 10:30. i'll definitely come back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Modern room, close to train station”
Reviews.Author: jenum24
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for three nights from 7/1-7/4 as part of our honeymoon. We arrived by train and took a taxi to the hotel, not realizing it is literally right across the street from the train station, about a 3 minute walk. We had a room on the 1st floor with a view of other rooms. The hotel has about 6 or 7 floors, all with long, narrow hallways and long and narrow rooms. The bed and pillows were comfortable, the room has AC and the staff was friendly and helpful. The bathroom was a bit strange since the shower had no threshold separating it from the toilet or sink area, which means that the water goes all over the floor. Even with the shower curtain pulled around you, the water seems to still seep out and wet half the bathroom floor. The breakfast consisted of scrambled eggs, hard boiled eggs, sausage, bacon, mini pancakes, toast, croissants, yogurt, cereal, deli meats and cheeses and fruit. There is free Wi-Fi internet access in the room. The hotel is within walking distance to some main attractions such as the red-light district and Anne Frank House, shopping and restaurants, but far away from Vondel Park and some other attractions. Another small issue to note is that the light switches are at the head of the bed, so if youâ€™re sitting up watching TV, you can easily hit the light switches on and off. I would also recommend asking for a room away from the elevator. Our room wasnâ€™t near it, but you could easily hear the TV in those rooms while youâ€™re waiting for the elevator and Iâ€™m sure they could hear people talking and the doors opening and closing all night. Our room had a connecting door to the neighboring room and we could hear the TV. Overall it was a decent stay, but weâ€™d probably stay at a more centralized hotel if we find ourselves back in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Okay, but expensive for what it was”
Reviews.Author: BathGuy
Reviews.Content: The Bellevue is well positioned near to the main train station, however at nearly Â£100 per night without breakfast, it was not good value at all. The first night, we were put in a smoking room at the bottom of an internal well and it was dark, noisy and small. They did move us the next day to a lighter, non-smoking room, but it was small still. The staff were very polite and the room was clean, but I feel that it was a lot of money for such a small, and mediocre room.

Reviews.Title: “Missed the coffee maker”
Reviews.Author: Sewonforever
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a perfect location, I don't know Amsterdam very well but being so close to the central train station always allowed me to find my way back to the hotel - the rooms are clean and neat, but they are quite small. I enjoyed the access to the outside (Building is three sided with a rooftop walk way on the fourth side to get around to the eleveator) - did miss a coffee maker, none provided. The staff was absolutely delightful and never tired of questions and gave perfect guidance and assistance on every topic. Was only in AMS for one night, and would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Buyer Beware!”
Reviews.Author: Topman147
Reviews.Content: My wife and I travel quite alot and always use trip advisor as our guide to finding a great hotel as other visitors views are a fantastic tool to prepare a good trip and everytime this has been the case. This particular hotel rate's highly amongst fellow 'trip advisors' reviews, so we booked this hotel and confirmed all the details through our agent. On arrival at the hotel we were advised our booking was cancelled, however upon calling our agent 'Ebookers' we were advised the booking was NOT cancelled. Therefore the hotel offered us the sister hotel 'Avenue Hotel' which is supposed to be of 'equal standard', believe me it isn't ( full review posted on the Avenue Hotel) . We believe this hotel the 'Belle Vue' realise it's popularity and double book rooms so to fill up it's sub-standard sister hotel. Buyer beware, you may not be buying a room this hotel when you book.

Reviews.Title: “Fair”
Reviews.Author: WalesMikey
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Bellevue in October 2007 for 3 nights. we were a party of six staying in three rooms. Hotel lobby is clean, modern and welcoming and reception staff were very friendly and helpful. The rooms were modern (though ours was a little cramped) and are very clean and well maintained. The bathroom, however, was so modern and minimalistic that there was absolutely nowhere to keep your toiletries! We resorted to carrying our toiletries in and out of the bathroom every time we wanted to shower or freshen up. Breakfast at the hotel was fine but trying to get in to the breakfast room was a real problem. It was far too small for the number of guests staying at the hotel and we only ate there one morning. The other two mornings, we resorted to going elsewhere for breakfast after waiting too long for a table at the Bellevue. Hotel location is excellent. Convenient for all of Amsterdams major attractions and only a 4-5 minute walk from Cenraal Station. We would stay there again, but would not pay for breakfast as this is a waste of money when you have to go outside the hotel due to congestion in the breakfast room.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Andelins
Reviews.Content: This is a nice, little hotel, just across the street from Amsterdam CS (Central station) where you arrive for instance from Schiphol airport. Behind it's medieval facade, Bellevue is a quite modernly designed hotel, though, with it's "Dutch design" taken a little too far. When you step into the room, you feel like being already in the bathroom, everything in white and glass. When you get into the bathroom you feel like being in the lavatory of the plane you flew in on; everything is modernistic, practical, simplistic. When this hotel is worn down one day, it is going feel real basic. But the place and price was right.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, friendly place”
Reviews.Author: k_kTipp
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Bellevue for 3 nights and found the experience very pleasant. We had originally booked another hotel just a few doors away but the room was disgraceful and we just could not stay there. In the Bellevue the room was comfortable and clean. The breakfast was very good with plenty of everything to choose from. The guys at the desk were very friendly and accomodating. The hotel is very centrally located , just mins across from Central Station and within walking distance from Dam Square . Get the train from Schipol Airport , its on ly about â‚¬4.60!! Great value and only takes about 20mins. I would recommend this hotel for short stays.....

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: chris74hay
Reviews.Content: Ideal location for exploring Amsterdam. Right opposite Centraal station, very near to tram/bus terminus, canal boat cruise start point, and bicycle hire depot MacBike. There is a good choice of restaurants and cafes within walking distance. The hotel staff were friendly and helpful, the place was spotlessly clean, and the snack and drink prices reasonable. The rooms were small, but just about adequate. Very comfortable beds, free safe deposit box in each room, plenty of hot water. Our room overlooked the main street, but most traffic noise stopped by double glazed window, and it gave an interesting street view. However, lots of rooms at the hotel have a window onto an inner void, so check what you are getting.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't ask for much better”
Reviews.Author: igar75
Reviews.Content: Whilst looking for a centrally-located hotel from which to base a long-weekend break with children, we came across the Bellevue Hotel. In terms of location, it cannot be faulted - situated only yards from Central Station (and the hub of the city's transport network). Fortunately, the double-glazing was sufficiently strong to filter out traffic noise, giving the room a peaceful feel. With the curtains closed, the room could have been situated anywhere. The staff were perfectly friendly, and the rooms clean and modern (if slightly small - but then again, its a challenge to find a larger room in Amsterdam, particularly at this price). Breakfast was pretty standard, and we didn't sample the lunchtime or dinnertime menus - preferring instead to walk westwards towards the myriad of restaurants in the canal area of the city. We would struggle to find fault with this Â£90/night hotel in the centre of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, wonderfull trip!!”
Reviews.Author: travelcat22
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Bellevue back in October and thought it was lovely. Small and compact rooms that are decorated in a modern style and a plasma TV. Comfy beds and clean bathroom and bedroom. Brekfast was nice, plenty of choice and tasty too. We found this hotel to be in an idel location for exploring the city in which we walked everywhere and managed to see a lot in 3 days. Amsterdam was very cold in October, and Ive been in the summer too and its not that warm then either so a coat is advisable. When you arrivel at Schipol get the train which takes you direct to centraal station, you can buy your train tickets at kiosks at the airport, its only a few euros. When you arrive at the station go right and the road the hotel is on is basically straight infront and the hotel is on the left as you're walking from the station. Check in/out were fine, and they let us store our luggage for free in a room once we'd checked out as we had a flight later in the day. There's plenty of places to eat near the hotel, we liked the soup bar about 2 buildings down from the hotel, it was reasonably priced and was delicious too. I would definitley stay at this hotel again because of the great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Us2Newry
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a short stay in Amsterdam! Stayed in the Hotel Bellevue for two nights and can not fault the place. Good clean, comfortable, afordable hotel in a great location. Situated across from Central Station it was always easy to find, even after sampling the wonderful nightlife Amsterdam has to offer. Staff were great too, very friendly and efficient. Will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “The Bellevue”
Reviews.Author: krazykel
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I have just returned from a 4 night stay at Bellevue hotel and we had a very pleasant time. We arrived during a snow shower which gave our visit a little bit of magic but unfortunately it turned into showers of rain the next day. The hotel was very clean and well ran, the room was small but very comfortable we had a wet room for a bathroom which was different the shower was really powerful! The staff were friendly. The location of the hotel is fab only 5 mins on foot from central station and only 10 mins away from the red light district etc. Everything was in walking distance including good places to eat and many good coffee shops (home grown fantasy was just down the road!). This was our 2nd stay in Amsterdam previously stayed at Avenue Hotel which belongs to the same chain as Bellevue would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “amazing shower!!”
Reviews.Author: sallyann82
Reviews.Content: Bellevue hotel was just perfect for our stay although we did end up with non smoking rooms despite requesting otherwise. it is very centrally located 5 mins from Dam Square, Central Station, Canal Tours etc and about 10 mins walk to red light district. Plenty of bars and cafes near by. Rooms were very nice for a budget hotel. nicely decorated with a safe but no tea/coffee facilities. Had the most amazing shower ever!! This was a very secure hotel and you need to be buzzed in then have a key to get up in the lift so felt very safe. Didnt have breakfast as were never up in time but plenty of pubs near by do all day full breakfasts.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: kerry2210
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a three night stay at the Bellevue. We arrived at 10am and were given room 503, although check in is at 2pm which was great. The hotel staff were friendly and very helpfull. As stated in most reviews the rooms are small but modern,bright and very clean. We had a great view from our room and could see central station. Hotel could not be in a better location for sight seeing. Bellevue is also very safe as staff member has to let you in and you need key card to get into lift. We didnt eat in hotel but there are lots of cafes near by. Overall good value at â‚¬290 for two for 3 nights without breakfast.If i were to return to Amsterdam again i would stay at the bellevue.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: starcluster01
Reviews.Content: The Bellevue Hotel is a modern, clean, minimal, hotel located just in front the Amsterdam Central Station. It is perfect for business and leisure time. The room are extremely clean, the design is minimal and superb, you feel pampled. The rooms are not big, you have enough space but not too much. It is a 3 stars hotel but in fact I have been in several 4 stars that are really far away from the comfort of the Bellevue Hotel. The staff is very helpful, the breakfast is really good. The Hotel is worthy of each single cents you pay for it. A wonderful hotel in the heart of Amsterdam with a very reasonable price. In one word: excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Overall satisfactory experience”
Reviews.Author: indisch
Reviews.Content: The hotel is easy to find from the Centraal station. On checkin, we were assigned an internal facing room - I believe it was the 'worst' of the double rooms we got because of a late checkin (stay away from room 411). The a/c didn't work well, the blinds on the window (which overlooked other windows) didn't work, and the room was quite small. Fortunately, the reception desk were willing to move us to a room with a view (502) the next day when one became available. This room was significantly larger and had a nice view of the Centraal station. Didn't try the breakfast - it seemed overpriced but food is expensive everywhere in Amsterdam unless you can live off sandwiches. The bathroom was small but functional enough - no complaints there. I will probably try one of the Jordaan hotels if I ever visit next; but for the location and the price, this is a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “good clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: deak75
Reviews.Content: the bellevue is a good value hotel in a good location, less than a 5 minute walk from central station and 1 minute until you're on damrak. yes the rooms are small but they've got everything you need in them and how much time do you spend in your room when you're in amsterdam anyway? one thing i did notice about the room though was that the walls are paper thin. think we were in room 108 on the ground floor and you could literally hear the t.v. in the room opposite and people using the staircase next to the room. take earplugs if you're a light sleeper! the breakfast was fine but i wouldn't have been happy to have paid the prices some people say they did because fine describes it well. assortments of cereals and the usual continental stuff and pre cooked bacon, sausage etc. but if we weren't b&b i'd have been disappointed. good clean hotel for 3 star and the staff are friendly and very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Spot”
Reviews.Author: Cottboy
Reviews.Content: Booked for 1 night after reading reviews on this website and we came away very impressed with the hotel. Is located just across from the Centraal train station, and turned out to be very easy to find (as you leave the station, look ahead and slightly to the right - you'll see the hotel's sign quite clearly). It's also just a short walk across to Dam Square and the redlight and coffeeshop districts, which is convenient and also nice not to be amongst it too much. Rooms were modern, although there was no real view to speak of - we had internal views of other guests' windows. Bathrooms are small, with a lack of space to put your toiletries etc, and there was no divide between the shower recess and the bathroom floor - which meant a wet bathroom floor (which really, isn't much of a problem unless it's your own bathroom, is it?). The LCD TVs were great, although you wouldn't want to spend all day in your hotel room as their was only BBC World and CNN on the box in English. Staff were friendly and great at English, and the people of Amsterdam in general are all very pleasant and outgoing. We paid 128 Euro for the night, which was a fairly reasonable deal for what we got. I'd definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “A very expensive hotel”
Reviews.Author: CVelloso
Reviews.Content: Was snowing and dark when we arrived at Amsterdam Central Station. Bellevue Hotel was our first choice, because it seemed to be warm and cleaned. Cleaned it really was, and offered a very beautifull view, as much as a modern decoration, but... the rate day was 140 E, and breakfast was an absurd apart: plus 24 E per person. The central heating was so noisy then I only could sleep if I turned it off, what meant feel cold all night long. Fortunately I brought my personal hair dryer. If I would count with the ones offered by the hotel, I certanly would became ill. I believe we could have found a better and cheaper place to stay, if we have walked a little bit more...

Reviews.Title: “Heaven”
Reviews.Author: irishtoni
Reviews.Content: My partner and I have just arrived back from amsterdam feeling rejuvenated, and the Hotel Bellvue is partly to blame. we arrived in Schippol, not sure which way to get the train, but dutch people are so friendly and helpful. got the train on platform 3 and in less than 13mins we were at central station! asked at a nearby kiosk where the bellvue hotel was and it was litterally over the bridge, 5min walk. we were greeted by the receptionist and given our double smoking room(our choice). a bit surprised initially at the room size, but when you sleep in the bed(which is very little), we slept the best and comfortable bed we have ever slept in. the total white of the room all makes sense as it is totally chill out, which is what amsterdam is all about. the hotel is central to everything, great coffee shops, and bars, our favourite was Wonder Bar (try the pipe, so good!!!)which was just around the corner and Gringos restaurant is a must. amsterdam was a complete cultural shock as there was not a mobile phone to be seen or heard, people actually talked to each and enjoyed the company. i rented a bike for 2 hours for 6euros and what a way to see the place. I could not fault this hotels location and that the art of sleeping is perfected. Heaven!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Extremly good value!”
Reviews.Author: miceagol
Reviews.Content: Pros: - Extremely good price for what you get - Room is large enough - Bathroom behind sliding door doesn't matter. Most importantly, it is a clean bathroom - Large shower - Comfy double bed. Not king size nor queen size, but who cares when the bed is normal and good to sleep in. - White rooms are pleasant - Close to the central station - Free movie channels - Free WLAN - Feel secure. Key to open the elevator, and entrance to hotel is locked unless guests need to get in - Quiet rooms (we were on top floor) - Free large safe - Care for the environment. You decide if they should wash your towels every night Cons: - Need to walk a bit to get to the nice shops and restaurants - They give you the key to the luggage room, instead of walking there with you - No refrigerator in room

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
