Reviews.Author: DublinNovia
Reviews.Content: I booked this on reading reviews on this site and for the main,we were not disappointed.Its in a fantastic location as others have said.The reception staff were helpul and friendly.The room though was TINY.And I had paid extra for an upgrade.We were in single beds pushed together.I hated the fact that there was nowhere to put cosmetics in the bathroom and also there were no little hotel toiletries. The place was spotless,though the sheets were not changed for the 4 day duration of our stay. If you are just staying for a weekend,dont have a huge amount of luggage and not planning to spend too much time in your room,this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “located with excellent room!”
Reviews.Author: RambliJohn
Reviews.Content: We booked a premium room, at very little extra cost, and certainly liked it, in terms of decor, size and facilities. It was quiet enough, being double glazed, despite being on frontage. Air conditioning was useful, avoiding that "too hot" feeling of some hotel rooms. Good breakfast (bacon, eggs. sausages etc, plus usual cheese, meats , cereals options) Hotel staff friendly, English-speaking - allowed us use of luggage room for last hours. Definitely stay there again - recommended! (PS try 'oldest bar in Amsterdam' in same block - perfect brown cafe style)

Reviews.Title: “Bellevue: grows on you”
Reviews.Author: rondub
Reviews.Content: The Bellevue hotel is very centrally located just accross from central train station, which means easy access to anywhere in the city via tram, which all terminate at the station. On the downside, it is located close to Damark, which to me is pretty cheap and nasty, with tacky restraunts, souviner shops and hotels. The hotel itself is spotlessly clean, warm and comfortable, with no noise in the rooms, despite being on a busy street. The staff are also very friendly. However the rooms are small. It is definetly worth paying the extra few euro for a superior room. The decor is unusual and whilst I appreciate modern design, architecture wasnt too sure about the white minimilist design at the start .. but it grows on you. All in all I would reccomend this place

Reviews.Title: “fairly good”
Reviews.Author: happypunter
Reviews.Content: stayed for 4 nights ,hotel very clean .reception staff very frienly breakfast not to good for the money recommend you go to corner cafe on corner about 25 yards away good full english for about 9 eurs.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - great location”
Reviews.Author: Davey1800
Reviews.Content: Me and a friend booked rooms in this hotel for two nights in November, and found it to be a fantastic place to stay. It is located five minutes away from Centraal Station and is minutes away from all the main attractions, even when walking. The hotel is immaculately presented, both inside and out, and is very well run. The reception workers were very polite and helpful (something all the Dutch seemed to be). The layout of the rooms is very simple (as you can see from the previous photo's). There is air conditioning (most welcome if you go in summer), and a spacious and well presented toilet / shower area. There are chairs and an LCD TV, which had a decent variety of channels, both in English and Dutch. There is ample clothes storage, a room safe and a phone. There were no tea / coffee making facilities in the room, which I felt actually removed some of the tackiness associated with some hotel rooms. Our booking included breakfast, which consisted of cereals, meats / cheeses for sandwhiches and juices / tea / coffee etc. It was very nice and gave a good start to the day. The restaraunt area was very well presented and run efficiently by the staff. Overall, this hotel is fantastic, and I will stay here again when I return in a few months.

Reviews.Title: “Best location and great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: qt2000x
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on all the positive reviews we read. We are glad we did. The hotel is conveniently located right across from Central Station and within walking distance to all the main attractions. The room was modern and comfortable, the bathroom was a nice size (for Europe) and the flat screen TV was nice, too. The best part was the breakfast, it is one of the best ones we ever had in Europe, wide selection of cereals, cheeses, breads, hard boiled eggs, scrambled eggs, sausages, bacon, fruit...and much more). If you don't want to walk to the museums, you can take the tram # 2 or # 5 right outside Central Station. Overall, I think this is the best location in Amsterdam and good value. We will definitely recommend it and if we go back to Amsterdam, we will stay in the Bellevue Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location!”
Reviews.Author: nmstein
Reviews.Content: This hotel's location is very convenient for most of the tourist attractions, and is also within walking distance of the train station. The rooms are small, but we were told to expect this in Amsterdam. Room and bathroom were both very clean. We had no shower curtain which meant that the bathroom got soaked every time we tried to shower. Do not spend ten euro on the breakfast. Definately not worth it!!

Reviews.Title: “White room”
Reviews.Author: caz126
Reviews.Content: My first impression of this hotel was very sterile, white and feels like I am staying in the basement of a science lab. There were air vents above the door and majority of the time the room just felt "stuffy". I am not claustrophobic, but the small room combined with white walls and lights made me feel uneasy. It didn't have a cosy feel to what I was use to either. However, the rooms were clean and the location was perfect. I just don't think it is suited to me personally and will not come back here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: maranasam
Reviews.Content: Two night stay in mid September. Great location! Very clean and fresh. It is located on a busy street near the Central Station but even rooms on the street were quiet. Complimentary breakfast was excellent.. The twin room we had was very small with a larger bathroom. They had a room available for us at 9am when we needed to check-in!!! We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Neilb62
Reviews.Content: We stayed over a long-weekend recently. The room (on the 4th floor) was nice with a view over the street at the front of the hotel. Small but with a comfy bed, nice bathroom and (for us) adequate storage. Breakfast on the first morning (a Friday) was chaos! We got down @ 09.40 and joined a queue only to be told there was little food left despite service finishing at 10 and there were no tables left. Despite this we were crossed off the list as having had breakfast (we were B+B), when a table finally came available we went to get coffee and returned to find someone else had taken the table! We gave up and got breakfast at the excellent corner cafe a few meters away. Later I complained to the manageress who said she would look into the matter. The next day we were given a voucher for free coffee and cakes for our inconvenience, and amazingly were refunded the cost of breakfast on checking out a few days later, certainly a first for us! So, just make sure you are down before 09.30 if you want breakfast, which incidentally is excellent. So, in short, a clean friendly hotel, a little traffic and tram noise if you are in the front but ideally situated to explore Amsterdam. We had dinner in the Bistro one evening and that was excellent. Overall very good, we shall use it again on our next visit without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location - Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: anna_mariediva
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from two nights at the Bellevue in Amsterdam. The location of the hotel was fantastic, right opposite Centraal Station - so not far to walk once you get off the train. On arrival we were greeted by really cheery helpful reception staff who offered to store our luggage until check in time at 2pm. The lobby area was clean and contempory. When we got back to hotel (about 1pm) The reception said we have been upgraded to superior rooms and checked in. The room was small but perfectly formed. The bathroom was clean and the shower was lovely. There is a flat screen TV on the wall with lots of channels, white modern furniture, Hairdryer in the bathroom, Wardrobe with plenty of hangers, artwork on the wall, a bottle of water and really comfy beds - we had twin beds but they were right next to each other so not a problem. Security is great, you can only acccess the lift by swiping your keycard - a fab idea! I didnt really notice any noise from other guests or the trams - so dont worry, you will get a perfect nights sleep. Breakfast was good also - a mixture of continental items and a couple of hot items too - scrambled and boiled egg, bacon, beans and mini sausages. Best of all it was all you can eat! Above all, I had a wicked time in Amsterdam and the hotel made it a better experience - completely hassle free. The Heineken Experience was fab - it closes over the winter period though. As we weet on the last day before closing - we got absolutley wasted on 54 halves of free heineken!!! Be prepared to wait hours for Anne Frank's house - the queues are massive. We didnt wait as it was really cold waiting outside - so be prepared! Definatley recommmend the Canal Hop on Hop off bus. Really easy to use - just get your ticket for 18 Euro - from outside the Station in the Tui office (same company as Thomson Holidays) and hop on and off all the stops all day. You get to see a lot using this. Any questions about the hotel or Amsterdam - please ask ! Its a fab city , you must go!!

Reviews.Title: “most convenient hotel in amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: lily1
Reviews.Content: conveniently placed for the station and all attractions in amsterdam with many restaurants nearbye clean comfortable and secure good breakfast helpful staff would stay there again without hestitation

Reviews.Title: “Our first disappointment in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: 2-Midlife-travellers
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from one of our frequent trips to Amsterdam. Because of an early morning flight for our return we decided to book a hotel very close to Central Station. For this, the Bellevue is ideally placed being just 2 minutes walk away. Having read reviews that said the rooms were small we booked one of their larger rooms at extra cost. I pity those in the smaller rooms because there was literally no room "to swing a cat". The rooms are designed in a modern, minimalist fashion which is relatively pleasing as regards decor but proved to be a complete triumph of form over function. We had a double room, which consisted of twin beds pushed together, indeed there was no other place for them as they were 'shoe-horned' in between fitted bedside shelves, which were themselves right up to the walls. In the past when we have had twin bedded rooms in Amsterdam the beds have been double and on one occasion queen sized. These were not even singles, but 2'6" bunk sized beds. There were no tea or coffee making facilities in the room but a complimentary bottle of water was provided on the first day! Not what I'd call 3 star! The wardrobe consisted of a single cupboard, wall mounted directly above one of the bedside shelves. The space inside was so minimal as to prove impossible to hang even a shirt or jacket without it bunching on the bottom of the cupboard. The bathroom was accessed by a sliding door, immediately beyond which was a step down, painted the same off white as the rest of the bathroom and which proved to be a real hazard for trips to the loo after a night out. There was imaginative use of lighting in the room, which gave a pleasing effect and was operated by touch pad type switches, 3 of which were located directly above the bed, at just about the hight of the pillows. This meant that any slight adjustment of position in bed would inadvertently switch the lights on or off! Though we went in for breakfast we never actually ate there as the buffet style offerings seemed very poor value for the â‚¬10 per person they charged. As I said before, the hotel was very conveniently situated and it was quiet, clean and well presented but despite its visual qualities we found it totally impractical and very poor value for money. We shall not be back.

Reviews.Title: “Well situated contemporary hotel”
Reviews.Author: sigosling
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a 'superior twin' room with a friend for 3 nights. The room was small but very clean, and decorated in a contemporary style. It was worth paying the little extra for a 'superior room' because this looked out on to the street below, giving lots of natural light. Some of the other rooms seemed to look into the small centre courtyard of the hotel, which was dark. We did not dine at the hotel, but there are numerous cafes/restaurants very close by. Amsterdam's oldest pub is also located next-door to the hotel. Our room did get nosiy at night due to cars and trams though, so if you want peace and quiet and early nights, you are probably better looking elsewhere. However, if you plan upon going out at night, and if you want a great location, within a 10-minute walk to the main bars/restaurants, shopping areas, Dam Square, canals and the main train station, this hotel is an excellent choice. We would certainly stay here again because of this. The front desk staff were also very friendly and helpful, making you feel most welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kris99
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 3 night stay at the Bellevue. The hotel was very pleasent, the breakfast, was very satisfyting. Plenty on offer. cereals, yoghurt, cheeses, cold meats, various breads, plus at hot buffet. We also ate in the Restaurent at night and the food was excellent. The rooms was no smaller then any city hotel, we found it very quiet (mind we were facing a little courtyard in the middle - nos 105/106) and the bed was the most comfortable I have slept on, and I suffer with a bad back. Everything was within walking distance, but we made use of the Canel Bus where you can hop and of when you want. We found Amsterdam to be a delightful place with plenty of shops, bars and restaurents. The Red Light area was an eye opener, visit the Erotic Museum down there, its a laugh and only cost 5 euros. If I was to go back I would definately go back to The Bellevue Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: DublinTrish
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel after reading good reviews on TA. Was not dissapointed. The location was brilliant. Easy to find after a night out because its so near central station. Loads of shops etc right beside it. Found the staff very helpful. The room was small but for an amsterdam hotel was reasonably sized. good wardrobe space. no feebies in the bathroom though!! Didnt eat here at all so cant comment on the food. Most restuarants around do a full Irish and even veggie breakfasts which is great! The bed was two singles pushed together but it was the most comfortable bed i ever slept in. Bit of noise from the trams but you get used to it and you get this everywhere! word of advice. Dont go to Fifteen Retaurant (yes Jamie oliver lent his name to this place up near skinny bridge) it was the biggest let down(id booked 2 months in advance)the food was disgusting! The italian across from the hotel is really good and very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: luvstravelLondon
Reviews.Content: Hotel very well located. Less than 5 mins walk from Central Stn. Very convenient for all the city sights, Red Light District/ Dam Sq and Ann Frank's Hse. The City is very walkable & hotel perferct spot. The reception staff very helpful and we were able to check in on time. The room was small but functional. Ladies if you like straight hair, bring your GHD as the hairdryer is one of those useless ones attached to the wall. The hotel brochure said the rooms were sound proof, which sadly was untrue. We could hear every movement on the corridors, which was due to the fact we were near to the lifts (room 208). Even though the rooms were double glazed, we woke up to the sounds of the trams outside. One final negative was the large pillows which didn't aid a good night's sleep! However all in all, a good hotel experience and excellant location.

Reviews.Title: “Just 2 min. to airport train”
Reviews.Author: freekicker
Reviews.Content: If you need to stay close to Amsterdam Central Station for traffic reasons, this is a very good solution. Situated in the same square as the railway station, it is closer to town and looks attractive with its historic facade. The interior however is very modern, you will have a room fully kept in white color, by that way looking larger than it really is. But you get 2 people and their luggage easily in, enjoy a large flatscreen TV and a tidy designer style bathroom. We found the staff helpful and fluent in English. Warm breakfast buffet (not too large, but healthy) is included. The restaurant looked expensive to us, the outdoor cafe was very nice. Can you expect a beautiful view (bellevue) ? Well you see the station and know that you can reach your train in just 2 min. ....

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms but good hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: Dobby
Reviews.Content: I travel to Amsterdam every year at this time to attend IBC and I've yet to find the perfect hotel that I can rebook every year. The Bellevue ticks a lot of boxes though. Its location is perfect being virtually opposite Central Station and within walking distance of all of Amsterdam's major tourist spots. The staff are very friendly and helpful, the smallish restaurant is open all day with a decent quality breakfast. As noted by other reviewers, the rooms are small but they are reasonably well designed, clean with modern decor and they are air conditioned. The bathroom could have been done better - there is nowhere to put your toiletries - but the shower is very good. The flat screen TV is a decent quality JVC model and offers a good range of European and British channels. If you have children or are easily offended by such things, be aware that some of the European channels broadcast porn at night and there is no warning or means of blocking it. Wireless internet access is free throughout the hotel and operates at a respectable 4Mb. My quest for the perfect Amsterdam hotel will continue in 2008 but if I have to stay at the Bellevue again I won't complain.

Reviews.Title: “Super hotel in a super location”
Reviews.Author: reddiguy
Reviews.Content: On leaving the central station you can see the hotel if you look over to the right. In fact, if you take the bridge over the canal on the far right of the station building, as you leave, you almost arrive at the hotelâ€™s doorstep once you have crossed the roads. Itâ€™s a very easy 5-10 minute walk, even with luggage. The hotel has a small reception area and a small cafÃ©/restaurant called Brasserij on the ground floor. The reception staff were all pleasant, spoke excellent English, and were most helpful with booking various trips and excursions (even if they didnâ€™t seem to know much about the restaurants in the immediate vicinity). We reserved a non-smoking â€˜superiorâ€™ room, which turned out to be room 205, on the front of the hotel with a nice view out to the street, watching the trams go by, or over to the station if you turned your head left. The room was nicely spacious, with very modern dÃ©cor. It seems that the hotel was only opened in 2005, so everything still seems new and clean. The air conditioning in our room was very welcome, since it was very warm. There were no coffee facilities or refrigerator, which would have been a very welcome addition, although there was a complimentary bottle of mineral water, with two tumblers, on arrival. The bed was two singles pushed together, with an individual duvet and pillow on each side. The comfort of beds are always an individual taste, but we found ours to be quite comfortable, if a little soft for our personal preference. Nevertheless, we had three good nights sleep because we were so tired with all the walking we had done each day! The room dÃ©cor was modern, mainly white, with a sandy â€˜muralâ€™ on the wall opposite the bed. The ceiling had whitewashed wooden beams to add to the effect. The flatscreen TV had multiple channels in a variety of languages, including BBC1, BBC2, BBC World and Eurosport amongst others in English. There was not a great deal of storage space, although enough for the two of us for our three day stay. The room had one unit with a glass door in which to hang clothes, and two open shelves (one of which was rather too high to be useful). There was also shelf space either side of the bed, and a modern white table and two chairs. Lights were controlled by various switches, and was nicely â€˜ambientâ€™ with light coming from underneath shelves and from behind the mural wall as well as above the bed head. The room had a small safe in which to keep valuables, and two electricity sockets. It was double glazed, and so we had no complaints about any noise. The bathroom was spotlessly clean, and starkly modern in design. There was a full bath tub, with shower and curtain, a toilet and a sink in front of a full length mirror. There was only a very small shelf in the bathroom, so not much space to put your toiletries. There was a hairdryer and shaving socket. The bathroom was stocked with the usual range of towelling, and had a shower gel/shampoo dispenser in the bath, and one small bar of soap (renewed daily) at the sink. The toilet was a little too close to the wall and bath edge for my complete comfort, although most other people would have no complaint. It also had full and half-flush options for water conservation. Breakfast was not included in our room rate, so we were free to eat where we liked. However, the hotelâ€™s own cafÃ©/restaurant (Brasserij) offered a daily buffet breakfast for 10 Euros each. We highly recommend this choice. The breakfast buffet was superb and included a range of cereals with milk and yoghurt, orange juice, tea, coffee, croissants, various breads/rolls, multiple preserves, plates of cold meats and cheese, and (especially pleasing to us Brits) hot sausages, bacon, scrambled egg, boiled eggs and beans. The staff were all friendly and welcoming. The weather was so nice that we ate at one of the four tables outside on the street for three of our four meals there, and enjoyed watching the world go by. We highly recommend this breakfast buffet, which is available whether youâ€™re staying at the hotel or not. We also ate one of our evening meals here. They do a nice three-course dinner for 23.50 Euros, although we found a 10% discount voucher in our room, which we used. On our final day we packed and checked out by 10am. Guests can leave their suitcases in a separate, locked, luggage room for as long as they like (free of charge). Looking at the hotel layout â€˜mapâ€™ that was on our room door, we could see that the hotel has a wide range of room sizes. There would only be five or six rooms on each floor that looked out the front of the hotel. Many of the others would only have a window onto a very small central square in the middle of the hotel, the only â€˜viewâ€™ from which would be into other peopleâ€™s rooms. Certain other rooms would be smaller than ours, and some only seemed to have a shower rather than full bath. Our rate was 110 Euros per night for the â€˜superiorâ€™ room. Interestingly, this was 20 Euros per night cheaper than we could find on numerous web sites. I therefore recommend that you contact the hotel directly, either by telephone or email, to discuss rates and room options. Standard rooms would be cheaper still, although we were very pleased with our rate for our three nights in August. All-in-all we would highly recommend the Bellevue Hotel, and think it well deserves its high position in these TripAdvisor rankings. We would most definitely stay here again if ever we returned to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Steer clear...”
Reviews.Author: jomomojo
Reviews.Content: I still cannot believe what people see in this place. The single rooms are tiny, with a napkin hanging from the window that supposedly serves as a curtain -- people were looking in our room all the time. There are serious security issues with this hotel, as someone tried to break into our room with us inside. A call to reception did nothing but insinuate that we must have been mistaken about the incident. The location is decent, but for this price, it would be best to find an alternate location for a few bucks more.

Reviews.Title: “Spot On!”
Reviews.Author: Chrispy71
Reviews.Content: Great Location, not far from the main attractions of this vibrant city, but not too close as to be too noisy. Only a 3 minute walk from the Central station. Staff were very courtious and friendly, especially the reception staff when it came to making reservations on excursions. Hotel was spotlessly clean and breakfasts of a good standard. Rooms comfortable if a little on the small size. LCD TV a bonus as was the aircon. Highly recommended!!!

Reviews.Title: “Slightly disappointed”
Reviews.Author: UncleMonty
Reviews.Content: I booked the Bellevue after reading the reviews on TA and not having been to Amsterdam before was looking for a safe bet for my girlfriend and I. We paid 430 euros for three nights in a double room. I have to say that I can't believe it has so many five star ratings. The rule of thumb I use for rating is; 'Could I expect more for the money I paid?' The answer here is certainly a yes, hence only a three star rating. Pro's: Good location. 2 minutes from Central station, without much noise at all. Only ten minutes walk from most places of interest. Excellent staff. Helpful in every way. Free wireless interenet. Clean and well kept. LCD TV with excellent selection of English channels. Great shower. Cons: Very basic, small rooms. Akin to a UK Travellodge in terms of facilities, (although not price). No room service and rooms no bigger than a cruise ship cabin. Minimal storage in room. No shelves in the bathroom - what's that all about!? Dodgy air con. It was muggy when we went and some nights were very uncomfortable. No bath! A little too much noise from elsewhere in the hotel. No tea/coffee making facilities, mini bar or drinks facilities at all. Not even a vending machine in the lobby! All in all I don't think I'd stay here again but it certainly wasn't a bad hotel. If this is really the 11th best hotel in Amsterdam I'd have to question the standard of other hotels in Amsterdam. Or then again maybe I just expect too much?!?!

Reviews.Title: “Bellevue Hotel - Pefect for a short break”
Reviews.Author: traceface
Reviews.Content: Just spent 3 nights at the brilliantly located Bellevue. Having read other TripAdvisor reviews we booked a superior room which was well worth the small extra. Our room (larger than expected) was on 3rd floor at the front with bath & power shower (& shower curtain). Trams a little noisy but with windows shut and air-con on it wasn't a problem. Took our own travel kettle! Breakfast (hot & cold) was also much better than expected (no toast but good choice of fresh bread/croissant). Staff very obliging & could leave luggage safely on arrival & all day after checking out. Would recommend a very cheap but excellent value Italian restaurant - La Bettola - in the same road to the right of the Bellevue.

Reviews.Title: “A pub for a hotel bar - perfect”
Reviews.Author: JulesVT
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a weekend break with some friends. Room spotlessly clean, comfortable beds and great shower. Breakfast outside on terrace was good. Hotel bar is actually an old pub/bar which is a refreshing change from stale hotel bars. Location okay if you want quick access to station, otherwise on quite a busy junction, but no noise in room, just from bar.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Where to go nextt
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Bellevue in late June for four night city break. The location is excellent a 5 minute walk from Central Station. The reception staff were without exception very helpful and efficient. The room we selected was a superior twin and was set on the 4th floor with views over towards the Central Station area. Comments made about tram noises throughout the night were minor and the beds were very comfortable. the room had been modernised in the last few years and it was average size . The bathroom was small but everything was very clean. The chambermaids were very considerate as we were very late rising on a couple of occassions. You can get to the Monument in the city centre in 15 minutes or so by foot . we did not use the bar or breakfast room but they looked fine. All in all I would stay here again. I paid around 500 euro for a 4 night stay ( upgraded room ) and it felt good value for money .

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LiverpoolCbella
Reviews.Content: I went to the Bellevue Hotel in April and its was a fantastic hotel. Completely spotless and the staff where so friendly. The room was so modern and comfortable with a flat plasma screen telly and gorgeous beds and bathroom. The buffet in the morning was fabulous as was the food in the evening. The hotel is a 2 minute walk from train station and a few minutes walk from all the sights. I would book this hotel again without a doubt, I can't stress enough how amazing our stay was there!

Reviews.Title: “excellent! in every way!”
Reviews.Author: TravellondonUKLondon
Reviews.Content: Fantastic place! Cannot be beaten for a short break. We stayed there for 2 days and absolutely loved it. Across the road from the CS, down the road from the Dam Square, clean, comfortable, perfect to pop down for a quick nap if the coffeeshops have taken their toll.Films, BBC, news on the telly, quiet(we had room at the back), secure. Didn't try breakfast but had an awsome lunch in the caff next door. Brilliant and highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location/Value”
Reviews.Author: Jeffo2007
Reviews.Content: Stayed here based on previous reviews and found them accurate. You can literally see the hotel when you exit Central Station, which saved us 2 cab fares. It's convenient to the canal tours as well. Hotel is clean and staff is very friendly. Rooms are small -- about the size of a cruise ship cabin -- but clean and newly redecorated in a funky futuristic motif (white plastic egg chairs). Beds are very comfortable and we didn't have a problem with the noise, even though we faced the front. We'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Top spot!”
Reviews.Author: reubdude
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is ideal for a short break in Amsterdam. Not too far to drag your bags from the station, its literally 2 minutes away. Its position makes getting around really easy. Easy walking distance to all the attractions. The staff are really helpful and friendly, especially the restaurant staff. The rooms are very clean, especially the bathroom, its the first trip I didn't use my antibacterial wipes! No tea & coffee making facilities. This isn't a major problem as there are many coffee shops around! I'd recommend this hotel to anyone & i'm a fuss pot! I'll be back asap!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Just_youandme
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 night at the hotel last weekend. Hotel is lovely and only 5 minutes walk from the Central station. Staff are very helpful. Rooms are very clean and modern. Breakfast is good, a combination of hot and cold breakfast (i.e. cornflakes, bacons, pancakes, omelettes,etc). Good price. One of the best hotel we stayed in Europe. We loved it and definitely will be stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “nice interiors, great location, friendly staff, value for money”
Reviews.Author: dartagnanaguilar
Reviews.Content: i found out about this hotel on this site. i chose to stay here based on the overall good reviews of the people who have stayed there. and i must say the reviews have been accurate. i loved my stay at bellevue. the location is fantastic. a walk away from the train station. its right at the heart of the old city and there are many nice places to eat. the staff are friendly, helpful and speak english. the breakfast was good to get you started for the day. my room, though small was clean and cozy. my toilet is also very clean. its just that the partition of the shower still causes water to spill over but thats not a big problem because they clean the room everyday. and change towels everyday too. the hot water and pressure was consistent. i would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Anthony's, Bristol, UK”
Reviews.Author: TiffinBristol
Reviews.Content: Hotel in superb location for sight-seeing. Although the room was small it was sufficient for our 3 night stay and was nicely decorated, clean and fresh. The beds were particularly comfortable. Hotel staff friendly and helpful. Would recommend the three course meal in the Brasserie - excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Cute and close to everything”
Reviews.Author: Babycainsmith
Reviews.Content: You can't beat the location of this hotel... Practically across the street from Central Station and close to all the sights. The rooms were spotless and had great linens and showers. There is a cute restaurant downstairs for breakfast or a snack and the front desk is very helpful. If it had a mini-bar in the room it would be just about perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Great for sightseeing.”
Reviews.Author: Florence79
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a 3 night stay with 2 girlfriends. The hotel is superbly placed for seeing Amsterdam with all transport links, trains, canal buses, trams etc. on the doorstep, situated just opposite Central Station. Hotel is spotlessly clean, very modern. Staff very friendly & helpful. Room card access only to elevator so very safe. Rooms are small but well equipped with comfortable beds. On site Brasserie offers lovely food at very reasonable prices. We requested rooms at the back of the hotel after looking at other reviews regarding tram noise and were not disappointed...no problem sleeping! Large baggage room available after checkout. Only downside, no tea making facilities... so take kettle & supplies! Would not hesitate to recommend or return.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel to stay”
Reviews.Author: lynsey1
Reviews.Content: stayed at the Bellevue for 3 nights and i have to say i loved everything about it,staff were so helpfull,rooms clean and they were beautiful, ok the rooms were small but who goes to amsterdam to sit in there room.it was in a great location just across the road fron the train station ,loads of shops and places to eat close by and about a 15min walk to the red light. i would recomend this hotel and i will be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and service at the Bellevue”
Reviews.Author: oskipants
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Bellevue in March 07, Mon - Thurs. On arrival in Amsterdam we were greeted by snow and so pleased to see that the hotel was literally a 5 minute walk from Central Train Station. We arrived at 10am and so were too early to check in however the staff were very helpful and suggested we leave our luggage in the luggage room and register our details to making checking in easier later on. The rooms were very modern with a flat screen tv and cable (useful as it snowed and hailed most of the time we were there so it was nice to be able to go back to the room to warm up and be able to watch a film!!). We had a wet room, with a very powerful shower which was great. The room was clean and the maid service was excellent. We were at the back of the hotel so had no problems with road noise. The only complaint my partner had was that there were no tea or coffee making facilites in the room, but considering the number of cafes surrounding the hotel it wasnt too much of a probem. I agree with some of the other reviews that the room was quite small - but it was not an issue for us and i certainly don't think it should deter anyone from picking this hotel. We didnt have breakfast in the hotel, as we preferred to pick something up when we were out and about, but we did have a meal in the restaurant at night. It was very small and intimate, with a limited menu, however the food was lovely, and not too unreasonably priced, especially as there was a 20% discount voucher with the room. The staff were very attentive and helpful too (and the dessert was very very nice!). I would definitely recommend this hotel, and would stay there again if I return to Amsterdam. For the money the location couldn't have been better, approx a 5-10 min walk to dam square, red light district etc. Also the lift and therefore access to the rooms can only be called using your room key, an excellent feature, as there are some strange people in Amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “good hotel all round”
Reviews.Author: psigley
Reviews.Content: My wife and i stayed in this hotel for 2 nights in February and were very pleased. We arrived early so the room was not available straight away but after an hour or so of wandering around town it was ready which was still earlier than normal. Our room on the top floor was very clean. It was quite small compared to some hotels but this wasnt really a problem as we didnt plan to spend much time in the room, perhaps someone on a longer stay may prefer a larger room. Breakfast was the usual continental buffet, there wasnt a massive range but enough. the breakfast room does fill up quite quick so get there early. We felt this created an 'eat up and leave' atmosphere. I also got the feeling the staff wanted you in and out quickly. We just used it to get a quick fill up before going out each morning. The hotel is a great location, especially if you arrive by train, the hotel is right nearby. In terms of getting around town the hotel is great for this as well, its a very central spot for everything. you may want a map though to find the sights you want to get to. Overall id reccomend this hotel to anyone who wants to stay for a few nights either for tourism or business (free WiFi in room). The overall value for money was good we thought. If you plan on being in your room a lot or like to have a longer breakfast you may want to look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Little gem”
Reviews.Author: tech70
Reviews.Content: Recently returned after a 3 day break, where we celebrated my partners 30th and what a time we had! The food in the connecting bistro was first class and reasonably priced too.The hotel is ideally situated for transport links,central station is a 5 minute walk and Dam square a further 10,it's stylish but simple and worthy of it's 3 star status.Exellent value for money and wouldn't hesitate to book AGAIN.

Reviews.Title: “An absolute gem”
Reviews.Author: sexyneverleft
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel during a conference stay. The hotel is newly renovated, the room was impeccable, complete with flat screen tv and crisp linen (only snag was a bathtub without a shower curtain!). The staff extremely courteous: they managed to help me out after i mistakenly booked a room for the wrong night. Great location near the train station. I recommend this hotel. I'm trying to book hotels for an upcoming trip to europe and it's going to prove hard to recreate the price and confort of the bellevue.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent weeked break”
Reviews.Author: Etchasketch_Boy
Reviews.Content: Had an excellent 2 night stay here at the end of february. Superb location for a short stay, friendly and helpful staff. Room was very clean and adequate size for a short stay. I personally would have know problem with the room size for a longer stayer (depends how light you pack). Had a lovely evening meal in Restaurant and the bar next door was very friendly. Best recomendation is that I'd happily stay at the Bellevue again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Amsterdam hotel”
Reviews.Author: Absolutdave
Reviews.Content: Me and my two friends just stayed here for two nights (cost 260 euro, approx 30 quid each) we had the basement room which was a quad room, although this was a little noisy at times due to being right next to the laundry area, as 3 lads we didnt really care about the odd trolley scaping past the room, it was perfectly clean with an adaquate amount of towels, the beds comfortable ,and an lcd tv with one music channel, if your completly mashed and need a siesta it was a good place to chill for a couple of hours before heading back out to the coffee shops and bars. The best thing about the hotel particually if your on a lads holiday is location, ive been to amsterdam 3 times before and always end up walking around in circles for ages trying to find "the base" however as this is literally just across from centraal station and its on one of the "main roads" going down into the dam square etc, its almost impossible not to find it, my mate eat a space cake which turned him white, green, and the white again!!! and we still managed to get him back to spew his guts up without any major problems. if you can get to centraal station (which is signposted or advertised on trams) youll find the hotel. The staff seemed friendly enough as do all dutch people as long as you dont act like a typical english lager lout. they politely informed us smoking was aloud but no cannabis in the rooms. And check in and out was easy enough, they had a luggage room to leave bags etc if you have a later flight. Overall id definatly reccomend the hotel for value, location and cleanliness, theres nothing worse that booking a hotel online to get there and find that is like something out of a tarantino film, this one is accurate to the reviews, and will probably return with my girlfiend to stay here next time. Happy amsterdamming !!!!! Dave.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent accomodation!”
Reviews.Author: nlcperk
Reviews.Content: We had such a great time at the Bellevue. The staff was extremely friendly and very helpful with travel and booking arrangements for various shows. It was great for location, especially for a late night prowl. We will always stay there now!

Reviews.Title: “A very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: dimplesg
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Bellevue hotel for a 3 nights starting on valentines day. The hotel was situated very near to the central station. On entering the hotel we were greeted by very welcoming reception staff. We were offered a room on the ground floor but we were not happy with the view and the reception staff were only too happy to allocate us a room on the fourth floor. The room and bathroom were very modern and pretty small but very clean. From the window you could see the trams, restaurants etc. It wasn't noisy due to the double glazing. Breakfast was buffet style. If you arrived towards the end of the breakfast period there was hardly any choice, definitely no fried foods, just a little cereal but enough to keep you until lunch time Turn up early(ish) for breakfast and you would get the full english and continental breakfast. I only ate cereal and croissants. All in all my husband and myself would stay at this hotel again. The staff were excellent but all in all, customer service in Amsterdam is excellent, in shops and restaurants, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great location.”
Reviews.Author: sugarplumfairy27
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my boyfriend for 2 nights and i had an amazing time. The location of this hotel could not have been better, 2 minutes from the shops, restaurants and the red light district. Our room was very clean and modern and the wet room is a great idea. The staff were friendly and helpful and the food was really nice. Excellent value for a 3 star, i would give it 4. I cant wait to go back, lovely hotel worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel”
Reviews.Author: anon60
Reviews.Content: myself and my boyfriend stayed at the hotel for 4 nights in feb 2007, although the room was small, it was clean, had air conditioning, was cleaned daily and the beds were comfortable. the room was above a main street, which was noisy... but what do you expect for a hotel that is centrally located..... if you are a traveller who need lot of space, this is not the hotel for you. i would recommend this hotel for people who would like to stay in a clean and friendly hotel, which is centrally located. i will definately be staying at the Bellevue again

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: euanpl
Reviews.Content: Great value hotel in ideal location for a weekend in Amsterdam. 20 mins from Schiphol and 5 mins from the Central Train Station. Modern and clean. Very friendly and nothing was a problem. Used Verne.com to book it. Good price and pay on checkout. Breakfast seemed expensive relative to the cafes and stuff in the nearby Jordan district.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Staff, Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Markodonnell10
Reviews.Content: Loved it! We arrived early - 9am and a room was available on the 5th floor so the staff let us check in early. Location is amazing, right over the road from central station, so a great base to explore from (canal tours start over the road too). We booked on ---.com so our breakfast was included which was more than adequate - hot and cold buffet style breakfast. Was worried about the size of the room after reading some of these reviews, and also the noise. But both of those turned out to be false for us - the double glazing blocked out EVERYTHING! TV had English films and sport, room had climate control - only thing was there were no tea/coffee facitiies in the room. Would definitely go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: wimbli
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in Nov last year for a couple of nights. The location of it was great - right across the road from the train station so only a 5 min walk. Only a 5-10 min walk to the central area. We asked for a room at the back and so it was very quiet. The room was very small, but it was very modern (everything was white) and clean. The only gripe I have would be that there are no shelves in the bathroom and so we had to put our toothbrushes, etc on the table outside the bathroom. Breakfast wasn't included in the price (the only time during our stay in Europe) and so we ate out each time. All in all, a nice little hotel in a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Central, Clean! Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: EireGlitter!
Reviews.Content: Stayed in hotel for 3 nights with boyfriend. Arrived at 9 am in the morning and hotel was straight across from central station which was brilliant. We arrived expecting not to be able to check in but our room was ready so we checked in early. The rooms were simple and clean. All white with one coloured wall with plasma tv built in. Beds were comfortable and rooms were air conditioned. We had a bathtub in our bathroom, the only thing was the floor would get extremely wet when using shower etc but cleaning service was great and new towels etc were delivered. We did not eat in the restuarant. only one complaint: we were stayin on the 1st floor at the front of the hotel which was extremely noisy early mornings with the trams etc but that cant be helped. The staff at the front desk were really helpful and friendly. Overall i would give this hotel a big thumbs up because of location, staff, clean bright rooms. Would defo recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect base for Amsterdam city”
Reviews.Author: BrissyGirl-in-London
Reviews.Content: Just a stroll from the Central station & easily visable by good signage. My single reservation was upgraded to a twin which, based on the room size, l'm so glad that there wasn't two of us. When l lst entered the room, l immediately thought l was in a hospital. Everything was pristine white & clinically clean. Room #506 had a view of Central station & surrounding area, was very clean, comfortable, had a great bathroom & apart from other rowdy guests in the hallway at 3am, was peacefully quiet. As a single lady traveller, l found the area to be not only close to everything but also felt completely safe at all times. My stay at the Bellevue more than lived up to my expectations & if travelling to Amsterdam in the future, would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: spenmar
Reviews.Content: Location was excellent. Only 5min walk from central station. As you come out of the station look to the right and you can see it. The main street and shopping area are also only 5 min .. The rooms are small but adequate. The ensuite is like a wet room but we had no problems. Power shower was excellent. Our rooms were at the front of the hotel, noisy at first. But you soon got use to the noise of the trams. The plasma tv was a bonus. The staff we found were very helpful and polite. There is a locked luggage room which we used Helpfull if you arrive early or depart after 12.00am We had breakfast at the hotel. It was continental with bacon sausage etc. But no toast? There is a local bar next door to the hotel. Not far to roll into bed! Would stay again on our next visit to Amsterdam (was cheaper to book through Expedia than direct to the hotel)

Reviews.Title: “Group outing at the Bellevue”
Reviews.Author: machar
Reviews.Content: I was in charge of finding accommodation for 13 of us for our yearly Christmas weekend away. Amsterdam was the destination but find accommodation proved to be a bit trickier. I found the reviews of the Bellevue and contacted the hotel directly for price quotes for a variety of double and single rooms as well as some variation with dates amongst our party. They got back to me very promptly with a good and accurate quote for each member of our group so full marks for this. The hotel is extremely easy to find being across from the Central Station and we were greeted warmly by the receptionist. As we met some of our other party at the reception it was rather chaotic with all the greetings etc flying about but the receptionist coped admirably. Our room was on the 5th floor directly opposite the lift which worried me slightly but we didn't get disturbed by any noise for the 3 nights we were there. The room was a decent size - not huge but we weren't planning on spending much time in it. It was bright and had a lovely double bed, flat screen TV and plenty of shelving. The wardrobe was very small and is obviously made for people who are coming on short breaks (isn't this most visitors to Amsterdam?) and not bringing much with them so it was fine for us! Put your suitcases on top of the wardrobe as it will give you more space in your room! (See photos). The bathroom was okay with a bath and overhead shower but no bath curtain which definitely seems to be a quirk of many European hotels that I've stayed in. The shower was powerful and was something that many of our party commented on over the weekend. More shelves in the bathroom would have been nice though. As we were high up we could only vaguely hear the trams through the double glazing. The lowest accomodation our party had was on the 3rd floor and they had no complaints about the noise either. Some rooms did vary within our group as the single rooms appeared to be quite small and some double rooms only had a shower with no bath. We didn't have breakfast so I can't comment on the food. The staff were very friendly and professional even when my friend sleptwalked out of his hotel room at 3am and he had to go down to reception for a spare key! There is also a great bar on the corner of the hotel which is apparently one of (if not the) oldest bars in Amsterdam. This proved a great meeting point for the group in the evenings before we headed off out for dinner and the landlord soon got to know us all. I would recommend this hotel to anyone as would my 12 friends!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid the Basement”
Reviews.Author: Pressgirl
Reviews.Content: The Bellevue is a fantastic venue as long as you avoid being placed in a basement room. If you find yourself being directed down the stairs in the foyer to rooms in the basement ask to be re-located. The basement rooms are at the end of a long corridor with carpeted floors and walls in what initially seems to be a nice secluded part of the hotel. However, we discovered our room (103) was opposite a staff changing room which is used every few minutes from 4am onwards. The door to the changing room bangs, then there are several internal fire doors along the corridor which bang very loudly in succession. Even with ear plugs you will not get much sleep after about 5am as the banging doors caused our hotel room door to rattle and bang. Staff also chatted loudly along the corridor at about 5am on the first night of our stay. Despite a polite request for staff to be a little quieter, the noise continued, partly due to the design of the doors which means they have to be pulled shut. The hotel itself is extremely close to the station which is very convenient, the staff were very helpful and friendly and the breakfast was extremely good. The hotel appears to have been refurbished recently and the room was extremely clean with a large bathroom fitted with superb facilities and finished with modern, high standard, chrome fittings. The bedroom was extremely clean and well presented with a flat screen television and very nice touches such as floor lighting and a single wall with a "frieze" across it. The hotel itself was fantastic, the basement room and the continual noise was a disappointment. However, I would stay there again but would request a room on an upper floor.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Stephenh365
Reviews.Content: Me and my lovely fiancee stayed at this hotel for 4 nights from the 4th december 2006 for her birthday treat paying our second visit to Amsterdam. The location is absolutely brilliant with most attractions/shops and central station within a couple of minutes walk. Also there was a tram stop outside which gave access to the further afield sites (this was very handy considering our awful weather!). The buffet styyle breakfast was fine with plenty of hot or cold choice. The room (504) was very compact with a small robe for clothes which meant you literally did live out of a suitcase! There was an over the bath shower though no showercurtain which generally resulted in the floor getting very wet. Overall though the rooms were very clean (maid service daily) and the LCD tv's a nice touch. The double bed we had was also very comfortable. We were on the fifth floor opposite the lift and this could be quite noisy at times, we also faced onto the main street but we both quite liked the sounds of the trams as they went past early on. The staff were extremely friendly and they gave us our room at 11.00am for check-in with check out not until 12 noon. To conclude, i'm sure we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel & Great Location”
Reviews.Author: nexsus6_uk
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights at the bellevue hotel in amsterdam. Basically the location was brilliant, not only for an easy arrival from the station, but as a great base for discovering the city. Our room was small yet ample for our requirements, it was very comfortable, very clean and the staff friendly. We would not hesitate to stay here again and I'm sure we will, as the city has so much to offer that we did'nt get close to fitting it all in a 3 day trip !!!!

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Redhurlingcat
Reviews.Content: Myself and my friend stayed in the Bellevue Hotel for two nights in Oct. The Hotel is just across the bridge from Central Sation which is brill as you dont have to walk at all far with your bags. The reception staff were friendly and the lunch we had was very nice. The Room was fine for two people and the beds were very comfy. The room and the bathroom were SPOTLESS. The shower was great...very powerful. I found the hotel very quiet (maybe because we were so tired when we finally got to bed each night!) The location is superb for sightseeing as it is a few mins walk from dam square and the red light district. Over all I would def recommend this hotel and I would def stay there the next time i visit Amsterdam...Great City!

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay at the Bellevue Hotel”
Reviews.Author: gotonodj
Reviews.Content: We only had an overnight layover, so I wanted a hotel that was easy to get to and not too expensive. After reading the reviews here, I decided to book with the Bellevue. Trying to go through Expedia, Orbitz, etc., I found there were no rooms available. So I booked through Bookings.com But the hotel's brochure states that you can make reservations online at www.bellevuehotel.nl We paid â‚¬102.50 for our room, which I thought was reasonable. It only took a few minutes to get from Centraal Station to the hotel, which was wonderful. I faxed the hotel before we left for our vacation and stated that we would arrive late in the afternoon--I am glad that I did as the hotel was fully booked when we arrived. The front desk staff was very friendly and helpful. We stayed in Room #305, which overlooked the street. The room was chily when we arrived, but we turned the heat up before heading out. The room was not small by European standards--it was quite large compared to the hotels we had been staying in the last two weeks. It had an IKEA feel to it, but we had no problem with the decor. And my husband really liked the flat screen tv and the English-speaking channels. The room was very clean. The beds were comfortable--and the pillows were wonderful compared to those we had in our hotels in Italy. We were unsure that the light bedding would be warm enough, but we were comfy and cozy once under the covers. Our room was located just across the hall from the lift, but I was not disturbed at all by noises from the street or from other hotel customers. My husband did hear people coming and going in the night, but was not kept up. A pair of earplugs would have done the trick, if we had needed them. The bathroom was spotless. It was not too small and contained a tub/shower--with a shower curtain. There was a glass shelf, but it wasn't located above the sink. But this didn't bother us since we were only staying one night. The hair dryer seemed to worked well, but I always pack my own to use. We ate at the hotel restaurant and my husband loved his dinner. I only had bread and a bowl of tomato soup, which was wonderful. The panna cotta was terrific. And the staff were warm and friendly. I am so glad we had a quiet dinner there before heading out into the noisy city. I would certainly stay here again. And would have no problem recommending this hotel to friends. We will stay there again, the next time we stop in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Superb Restaurant”
Reviews.Author: Mockingibrd
Reviews.Content: This great hotel is 30 seconds away from the Amsterdam train terminal, the tram stops and the canal cruise tours. The location is just superb. The hotel's restaurant beside the lobby was an added bonus with terrific choices of salads, main courses, desserts and wine. The room was very clean and spacious. The hotel staff were friendly and courteous. If ever I visit Amsterdam again, I will definitely stay in this hotel and would recommend it to friends. On top of it all, the price was not bad.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting and Convenient hotel”
Reviews.Author: RealGiantPanda
Reviews.Content: I would definitely stay here again. Stayed 2 nights with my wife. Hotel very convenient and allowed us to make efficient use of our time. Location is right across from the Central train station. Location unbeatable. Didn't have to drag our suitcases all over the place. Tram lines ran right in front of the hotel, so we could get to the museums quickly and efficiently. There were many restaurants and interesting shops within walking distance, and many canal boat tours started just nearby. Last time I stayed in the museum area and it was a big hassle getting to the airport on time, since we had to go back to the hotel to get our bags, then back to the train station ... Here we had no such problems. Breakfast was included. They had a simple buffet - nothing spectacular, but it's not bad. The room itself is very nice. Simple but functional furnishings. I liked the built-in flat-panel TV. Had many stations in various languages. It had enough space to hold all our luggage. We asked for a quiet room and they gave us one facing an internal courtyard, so we had no view, but it was quiet. Have to be careful at night to close the blinds or people can see us. No problem since we spent most of the time outside. One unbeatable feature is FREE wireless internet access in the room. My wife loved that. The bathroom was strange. It was fairly big and nice. However they had little shelf space to put our toiletries - just a tiny glass shelf very high. I ended up accidentally knocking down my shaving razor blades. One thing I didn't like either was the fact that the shower was level with the floor, so it felt wierd, but the bathroom was very clean, so these are minor gripes. One thing to note is that, although it was a smoking room, there was absolutely no odor.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel !”
Reviews.Author: LukeSkywalker
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel. Our room was small but nicely funished and absolutely clean. The design is really, as others already poined out before, IKEA-style. Location is excellent, right across the street from the central station ( 2 min walk), and within walking distance to all Amsterdam attractions. It is also very close to the Jordan Quarter, my favorite part of Amsterdam with a nice market. Breakfast was also nice, nothing too special, but with a good variety of foods and of good quality. At the time we got there it was just very busy, and some people had to wait for a couple of minutes to get a table.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ricdodd
Reviews.Content: After having stayed at the Bellevue for a stag-do earlier in the year, I thought I would try returning, this time with the wife! As previously mentioned in earlier reports, the hotel has a great location. Just over the square from the Centraal Station, and approx. 5-10 min walk from Dam Square, Red Light District and the Niewmarkt. The rooms are a little on the small side, but very nice. It seems all rooms are twins, with both beds pushed together (a little cosy when on the stag!) You get a plasma screen, with 3 or 4 english speaking channels (BBC 1,2, World & Ceebeebies at least). Bathrooms are small, but well equipped, contrary to earlier reports, shower gel was in little dispenser in the bathroom. Our room was on the first floor, at the front of the hotel, and could be a little noisy from the trams etc., but this was not too bad. Never eaten at the hotel, but the food certainly smelt and looked nice enough! Check out time is midday, and the front desk will phone about 30 mins before, then knock on the door at 11:55 which I did think was slightly over the top Having stayed at the Hotel Citadel, approx. 100 yds down the road for about the same price (awful hotel, makes my garden shed look like a palace) and the Golden Tulip, approx 50 yds down the road for about 3 times the price I would whole heartedly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Reception staff”
Reviews.Author: Cyclist62
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Bellevue for three nights as we were going to watch the Amsterdam Six Day (indoor cycling track racing). The location is fantastic particularly if you wanted to see a lot of the city as you are literally across the road from the central station, the tram stopsand the canal tours . We stayed in a double room on the fifth floor at the front of the building, which was relatively quiet considering you are in a very busy location. The decor is essentially white and quite minimalistic with a feature wall of blue water (looks like you are in the sea!). We had a bath with a shower, however no curtain so it was essentially a wet room. The cleaners did an excellent housekeeping job and no matter how wet the floor was, it was always immaculate when you returned after a days sightseeing. The staff on the front desk were also extremely helpful. The tourist office didnt know about the bike racing or the location, but our receptionist looked it up on the internet and advised us on alternative transport methods, eg what number tram or bus and and where to catch them from. Reception staff also gave good recommendations about where to go and where to eat. Try the Cafe Kobalt which was less than 10 minutes walk from the hotel. Breakfast was buffet service with a decent choice of continental or cooked. We didnt eat in the hotel in the evening but we did try a desert and coffee one afternoon which was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: Yov
Reviews.Content: This is a well located hotel, clean and welcoming and I would recommend to all. It was more expensive than other similar hotels I've visited but I think you do pay a bit more in Amsterdam. Breakfast was good, a bit more on offer than the average continental breakfast and on one day the staff were more than happy to provide breakfast in bed (on the request of my partner for a birthday treat for myself). We experienced no problems with noise even though our room was on the front. My only complaint were the twin beds, the room was designed to have a double bed so it seemed crazy not to have one!

Reviews.Title: “Good Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: edinburghedge
Reviews.Content: Make no mistake, the Bellevue Hotel is a 'no frills' budget hotel but there are plenty of good things to recommend. At the top of the list is it's location and proximity to Central Station. Roundtrip from the airport was Â£4/(6 euros). That beats the heck out of the Â£30/(45 euros) I've paid in the past to take a cab. And the trip is shorter by train. D'oh! This was a 'last minute' trip and I booked into the Bellevue on Expedia. I paid Â£90/(135euros) per night with breakfast included. I bet if you book in advance you can get a better deal than I did. I was in room #110 which is an interior room. I was traveling alone and expected a 'single room', it was adequate for me but two people would be hard pressed, literally, to move about comfortably. (Prepare to be creative if you have a lot of luggage.) The only window looks out onto an air shaft. If 'the view' is important to you... then room #110 is not for you. The only way I can describe the room, it's decor, and funishings is 'minimalist'. Apart from one wall covered in 'watery' blue wall paper everything is very, very white: three of the walls, the bedding, the plastic table, the two plastic chairs, and the whole of the bathroom. In such a small space the white 'works'; making the room seem larger and brighter. (I have to wonder how it will age, this is a relatively new hotel.) The carpet was seagrass and already looking a little worse for wear. The closet is tiny but it contains a safe. The room is equpped with a flat screen television with good reception. (Parents might want to monitor what their children are watching in the later hours... the two movie channels are free... and offer an extraordinary range of entertainment.) The bathroom is large in relation to the size of the sleeping area. A simple solution for the shower would be a sturdy curtain that reaches to the floor.... but that doesn't exist... so you can expect to soak the entire floor when you shower. The towels were better than expected... and there were plenty of them. I understand that some rooms have a bathtub... that's the way to go. The hotel breakfast is served from 7am till 10am although I skipped it both mornings in favor of Barney's. I highly recommend the omelette, the hot chocolate, and the 'Amnesia Haze' at Barney's. I realize some people don't appreciate all that Barney's has to offer... and some people don't eat eggs. If you're looking for clean, comfortable, inexpensive accomodations... then count on the Bellevue.

Reviews.Title: “Does the job”
Reviews.Author: mrsd76
Reviews.Content: Excellent base location for touring/nightlife. Functional & clean, very small rooms, but if you're in Amsterdam why would you want to stay in your room? Thin walls though, and a little noisy with othe guests at night in the corridors, but very clean and modern looking.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely no complaints.........”
Reviews.Author: Virgo149
Reviews.Content: Have recently returned from a 2 night 'civilised' hen weekend staying at the Bellevue with 7 other ladies. I can only say what an excellent hotel for the money. The staff could not do enough for us - we arrived about 11.30 am but we were all allowed to check in early. Anything we needed during the weekend was done with pleasure by the staff and they even gave the bride a small gift to welcome her to the hotel. It is very central - a short stroll across the river from the station. The rooms were absolutely spotless. I agree with other reviewers, the wetrooms are an excellent idea. Yes the rooms compared to some other hotels are 'compact' but you are in Amsterdam - unless poorly, you should bearly see your hotel room. Oh, and the beds are VERY comfortable. Breakfast was excellent - although the staff struggled with the hot water machine at times! Plenty to go around - continental or cooked whichever you prefer. All in all I can highly recommend this hotel - and will definately stay here again when I bring my husband back for a weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Good Value, Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: WStaso
Reviews.Content: My brother and I stayed at the Hotel Bellevue two nights on our arrival in Amsterdam. It is within walking distance of the Central Train Station and close to the trams, an internet cafe, and a wonderful pedestrian shopping walkway. The road outside the hotel is noisy, but we got a room on the backside and it was quiet. As with other European hotel rooms, the room was small. The twin beds (pushed together) were comfortable, the safe was useful, and the bathroom had the needed accessories. The front staff were all English speaking (as is true all over Amsterdam) and very helpful. They seemed always cheerful. We were able to purchase 24 hr tram passes through them (something every traveller should have). The morning breakfast, in the hotel's restaurant, was not extraordinary, but it did have a wide range of items. For the price, this hotel is of considerably higher quality than those near it on this street (we checked). We tried to get into the Bellevue the following week without advanced reservations and it was booked.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, friendly but noisy.”
Reviews.Author: phil7
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a four day stay after reading advisor reviews and Bellevue was highest ranking of the cheaper priced hotels. Well located for arrival at Central station as it is about 200m across road on right as you exit from station. Ideal for trams, boats and walking into centre is a ten minute stroll through shop filled streets. Arrived about 22.00 and receptionist friendly and helpful, hotel kitchen had just closed so he recommended small steak house nearby and supplied vouchers for two free drinks there. As stated in other reviews rooms are on small side, limited storage but modern and very very clean. We had a room at front and between trams (started about 06.00) and cleaning staff it was quite noisy but with some earplugs and with a few Amstels on board from previous night no real problem. Breakfast buffet was good and plenty of it if you're early enough, they tend to run quantities down after 9.30 (open till 10.00). If you want a fresh hot breakfast make 09.00 latest. All in all a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely loved it!”
Reviews.Author: DoyleyBird
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Bellevue in March with 3 friends and we were all impressed with the hotel. It is located directly opposite the station so is really handy for that. The hotel itself is extremely modern and comfortable. The rooms are decorated in minimalist style and are all white and very clean. There is an ultra modern shower room and a TV in each room. The breakfast at the hotel was great,cooked breakfast and continental on offer too. The hotel is within walking distance of all the major tourist attractions. We were made up with the accomodation and would recommend it to others. Some reviews moan about the modern style and decor but I think that is what makes the hotel different,who wants patterned curtains and carpet??!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, comfy beds”
Reviews.Author: moriniman
Reviews.Content: Stopped for two nights as a city break. Booked easily over email after finding web site - not easy on google, but add EMB to search helps. Lovely room on first floor, very quiet despite being near lift and majorish road works outside - double double glazing works a treat!! Rooms are just as others describe with flat screen TV (inc BBC 1 and 2) and stylish bathrooms - chose one with a bath so no wet floors. Excellent shower over bath and very clean rooms. Reception very good and breakfast fine though service here could be more friendly and croissants can disappear if you are late. Still 10Euro. Great location by the station for any transport links and everything in Amsterdam is just about walkable anyway - enjoy the city but watch which fumes you breathe in!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location but tiny room”
Reviews.Author: 10JP
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Bellvue for 5 nights in May the hotel has a great location which is within walking distance of all the attractions the minus points are that our room was the size of a postage stamp without a single drawer and very limited clothes space, the only view from the window was other rooms and the non stop whirring noise is from the extraction vent in the bathroom/wetroom which never turns off this was remedied by filling the vent with a towel but the bathroom/wetroom itself was great. The plus points are that the breakfasts were adequate and the hotel is very clean everywhere and the safe within the room was free we also had a meal on the last night of our stay and it was one of the best we had in Amsterdam also the bar next door which is owned by the hotel and is reputedly the oldest in Amsterdam was great fun and full of local characters.

Reviews.Title: “Great Price, Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: spencal
Reviews.Content: My two children, ages 11 and 15, my husband and I stayed at the Bellevue from July 22-25. Our rate did not include breakfast, so we never ate at the hotel. Due to another reviewer who was moved to the Bellevue's sister hotel despite his reservations, I called ahead to let them know that we would be arriving late. Upon our late arrival, they had our rooms for us. We had requested 2 adjoining, non-smoking rooms. Although they did not have adjoining rooms for us, they were next door to one another. Both rooms were non-smoking. The rooms were meticulouly cleaned! They were nicely furnished and were really quite "fun" rooms. We had never experienced a wet bath, and although I wasn't overly impressed, it did beat having a mildewy shower curtain sticking to your back! My husband and son's room was quite large compared to my daughter and my room, as it appeared that as you went down the hall the rooms became more narrow! The rooms were quite nice and the T.V. was very cool. We liked the wall paper on the one wall. Safety was a priority of the hotel as you had to be "buzzed" into the main door and your room key was required to access the elevator. The rooms were relatively quiet, despite having a trolley stop right outside our windows. Noise never interferred with my sleep, and I am a light sleeper! The beds were very comfortable. My only complaints would be that there was no clock in the room and that getting the toilet to flush away all debris could be difficult. The location was perfect! A short walk from Central Station and to the main square. We also walked to the Anne Frank House. I highly recommend the Bellevue, but understand that this is not a luxury hotel. It is a clean, basic room, close to all the attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: Sammybee
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend this hotel, good location, 2 min walk from train station, rooms small but clean and modern with flat screnn tv. Good choice at breakfast although sometimes a bit busy, ok if you are an early riser (not me!) Some noise from trams outside but what do you expect if you book a hotel in the centre of town? I slept fine, did not bother me. I would def stay here again if I return to Amsterdam. Shop around for a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location”
Reviews.Author: loujon
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a week long visit to Amsterdam and Holland. The Bellevue was an excellent base for our excursions around Holland, as it is located just across the street from the central train station. It is also only a short walk away from the canal district which is beautiful and peaceful as well as being close to many bars and restaurants. Overall the hotel recently refurbished was of a good quality. The room though small (as is usual for amsterdam) had a window(even though a middle room) an excellent wet room with power shower and flat screen television with excellent air con. The american breakfast buffet was very good and set us up for the day ahead. The staff were also very helpful and friendly. I would probably stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: griff500
Reviews.Content: I have just had a 4 day stopover in Amsterdam on my way back to Australia and stayed here at the Bellevue from Wednesday to Saturday.I caught the train from the airport & easily found the hotel from Central station.I could see it from the information building.Its an easy 5 minute walk with bags in tow.On arrival at the reception counter I was greeted with a friendly smile & given the swipe card to my room.I was on the 3rd floor with no view really except a wall but I didn't mind.The room is very modern with twin beds pushed together (for single use)a small table & chairs & plasma screen tv & also a safe.The bathroom was a decent size with a shower but no curtain which meant that the floor would be completely wet.The room also had air con which was fantastic because it was very hot for the duration of my stay.The only thing missing was a bar fridge to keep cool drinks in and tea & coffee facilities.The Hotel is in a great location and although expensive I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The Bellevue was perfect for us”
Reviews.Author: lacost69
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I have just returned from a fantastic 2 night stay at the Bellevue Hotel. We stayed Thurs 27 July-Sat 29 July 2006. This was our first visit to Amsterdam and it took us quite a long time to choose our hotel. Tripadvisor made up our mind though and we decided on the Bellevue. We wanted somewhere central, reasonably priced and a nice hotel. The Bellevue delivered in every department. We arrived in Amsterdam at around 11am on the Thursday morning. We exited Centraal Station and found the hotel extremely easy to find. Simply exit the station and turn right and the Bellevue is on the first street on your left.
