You can literally see it from Centraal station! The hotel looks very smart from the outside. It is situated on a busy street with plenty of tourists, cars, trams and of course, bikes! The door to let you into the hotel was controlled by reception staff so not just anyone could walk in, good safety. We were greeted by the lady at the desk and were quickly checked in. We were surprised to find that our room was ready for us and that we had been given a free upgrade to a superior room. Room 205. We were told breakfast times (7am-10am and 7:30am-10:30am at weekends). We headed off to our room on the second floor. We used our door card to gain access to the lift (again, good safety). What a lovely room. Quite spacious, lovely design. Mostly white with a feature wall. Flat screen tv with plenty of channels. Large windows with nets and block out curtains with a nice view onto the road and up to Centraal station and of St Nicolaaskerk. Two single beds together with comfortable mattresses and pillows. Ikea style table and chairs. Telephone. Very nice under lighting that set a nice mood to the room. Bedside cupboard for hanging clothes complete with hangers. Free safe. Three plug sockets. Bathroom was very nice also. Large mirror, trendy sink. Complimentary toiletries. Bath and shower but no shower screen but didn't really have a problem with a wet floor, just tilted the shower to the right and put a towel on the floor to stand on. WC and fresh towels. Hairdryer. Overall, the room was spotless, very well equipped and extremely well designed. The room also had good air conditioning which we had on all the time due to the baking heat! The room was also quiet considering the road below and a tram stop. This was due to a double glazed window and another single glazed window. Breakfast at the hotel was taken in the small dining area on the ground floor (or could be taken in your room for a few euros extra). Again, very nice breakfast room. Breakfast was: Juices, hot drinks, cereals, Croissants, uncut bread, meats, cheeses, fruit, and a hot breakfast of: sausage, beans, bacon, boiled or scrambled eggs and of course to finish with, pancakes! We really enjoyed breakfasts and never had to wait for a table at around 8:30-9am although guests arriving later sometimes had to wait in the nearby lounge area. The hotel has a Brasserij which always seemed to be very busy and appeared to do nice meals. Next door to that on the street corner is the oldest brown cafÃ© in Amsterdam, this is a very nice place to stop for a drink and a people watch! We loved our stay at the Bellevue. Everything was as we would want, very central but quiet rooms, reasonably priced, good breakfasts, safe and secure, very well decorated/furnished and good staff on hand. It was perfect. We extremely recommend it and on our return to Amsterdam we will be returning to the Bellevue.

Reviews.Title: “Good, not great”
Reviews.Author: Hanna
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Amsterdam for 2 nights in mid July at the Bellevue Hotel. The room was small, no bathtub, only shower. It was clean but spare, not even a clock in the room. Tv had only BBC for news (biased). Breakfast is not included. We got there early in the morning and as the room was not ready, stored the luggage and wandered around pretty tired until after 2 pm. The best part is that it's across the street from the train station so it's an easy transport from and to the airport. Also, the location was good and we walked everywhere, not needing to use transportation. Look out for the bicycles, as their paths are right next to the (smaller) sidewalks-we almost got run over several times, no kidding!

Reviews.Title: “A bit small, but not bad”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great location, just across the street from Centraal Station. Rooms are brand new and very clean. Rooms are a bit small though, but location and decor make-up for it. Free Wifi and close to everything you want to see in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Value”
Reviews.Author: whiteoakmark
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 2 nights here (6/19 & 6/20/06) and found the hotel to be clean, roomy (by European standards) and very centrally located. Literally 5 minutes walk from Centraal Station. The bath tub was very large. The plasma TV was great. The bed(s) were very comfortable. $165 per night, in a great, safe location in a major Eurpoean city was very acceptable to us. The front desk staff was very helpful and always smiling. The breakfast buffet was good. You can walk to all of the principal sites, but catching the Tram at Centraal Station is very convenient. There is a GREAT Italian restaurant several blocks away. The name escapes me, but the front desk recommended it. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: SheffieldSuki
Reviews.Content: Just spent a long weekend in Amsterdam, staying at the Bellevue Hotel, and couldn't have picked a better located hotel. From getting on the train at Schipol Airport (20 mins. max), and walking towards Damrak - the road directly in front of you - you can actually see the hotel to your right, approx. 200 metres walk. The staff were incredibly friendly and helpful, the room fairly small but very clean and well equiped with air conditioning and lovely en-suite bathroom. Breakfast was good, buffet style so eat as much as you like! All in all a very nice hotel which I'd thoroughly recommend to anyone and at 50 Euros a night, really good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel-Great Price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with a group of friends. We were just over for the weekend.. The place was Ideally situated: Close to grand central station, the famous redlight district, pubs and clubs were just a short walk away (6-7mins), but the hotel was still far enough away to be quiet at night. The rooms were spotless (it looked like the hotel ahd just been renovated) all the appliances were new (loved the flatscreen TV, lots of movie channels). Beds were pushed together but you could seperate them; they were clean and had nice comfortable pillows (thats important to me)... A cleaning lady replaced the towls everyday and gave a general clean up.. A safe was in the room at no extra charge... and I really liked the idea of needing the room key to access the lift to enter the hotel floors (more secure). Breakfast wasn't included but we didn't mind much, we got up late most mornings anyway. The last morning we had an early flight and a few of us ate there and it was really nice; kind of like a small buffet and there was a large choice. Staff were so friendly and helpful, we had a small accident the last night in amsterdam (one of us dislocated his knee) and they were very understanding and really brightened up our spirits. Really looked after us!!! I would definately go back there, alot of couples were staying there and I would take my girlfriend with me the next time I go back. All in all agreat weekend and a great hotel. Highly Recommended!! S, Ireland

Reviews.Title: “Small but clean and good location”
Reviews.Author: hemikiwi
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Bellevue for 2 nights. Unfortunately they only had a single room available but as i was travelling solo it was fine. The room on first sight seemed very small but I got used to it and it was fine overall. When I say small , I mean small by anyones standards , not by american standards. It is definately a room for 1 person. However, it was still comfortable and very clean and looked out onto a central courtyard. As there were no rooms through the wall, I found it to be very quiet , which was great. I was on the 4th floor. I paid about 93 euro per night which is quite steep considering the size of the room but as most other decent hotels were completely full due to a conference, I was happy to pay as mentioned before, it was very clean and comfortable. I would definately return but next time have a larger room. All in all, a good tourist class hotel, clean with cheery staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, but noisy”
Reviews.Author: Starless73
Reviews.Content: Overall a decent stay but it would have been far better if not for the poor location of our room. Room 105 is located adjacent to an access door used by everyone staying on the ground floor. Every time someone walked through the door it would slam shut behind them, making a loud noise that was enough to wake the residents of room 105 (us). We also were probably the only room close enough to the hotel restaurant to be disturbed from noise coming from there. The hotel was full so we were unable to change rooms. Ultimately we got familiar enough with the noise that we were could sleep through it. Rooms are small but clean and comfortable. Flat screen TV is a nice touch with a couple of good film channels. Shower has a bad design, with no curtain and no real separation between the shower area and the toilet/sink area. Due to the angle of the floor the drain doesn't catch everything, meaning the floor is soaked after you're done. Water pressure and temperature were good, though. The hotel enjoys a great location, a very short walk from the Centraal Station. Room had no view whatsoever but at this price none was expected. Hotel staff was friendly and helpful. Would consider staying here again but only if a quieter rooom were available.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My mother and I actually stayed in this hotel by accident as we were booked into the Prins Hendriks round the corner - however our room was not available due to administration problems. We were moved to the Bellevue Hotel by the manager at his expense which was good of him as this hotel is actually classed as a 3 star plus. We were very pleased with our room with a front view ADVANTAGES include: - Windows were double glazed so blocked out a lot of the town noise - The beds were very comfortable and clean - The room had an 'ikea' feel very modern, white, clean - with great lighting - Facilities include - widescreen tv, hairdryer, safe (no charge), bath & shower, 2 chairs, air conditioning - Maids cleaned the room everyday - and changed towels & linen - Breakfast was good (we didn't pay extra as we moved hotels!) - We had a 3 course meal in the hotel which was very good value at 19.75 Euros. - Staff were very friendly and helpful - Good location - right near Central Station, Canal Bus rides, Dam Square and of course the famous Red Light District! DISADVANTAGES: - Nothing major really - although when booking this hotel make sure you ask for a large room at the front with a view. Our room was a reasonable size however we did notice when walking through the corriders that the hotel had a lot smaller rooms with windows facing the corriders - therefore they had to keep their curtains closed and had a lack of natural light! - We were very lucky with our room! Also the shower does not have a curtain - but we did have more baths. WHERE TO GO: - Heineken Expereince - was great value for money - 10 Euros - includes 3 drinks & gift. - Anne Frank House - quite emotional expreince - would go again! Would defiantley stop at this Hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fantastic!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights and we loved it! The hotel is beautifully decorated in a modern style which combines contemporary designer style with a listed Dutch building. The atmosphere is clean, calm and makes the room a really nice place to be. Fantastic bathroom facilities and the quality of the fittings is extremely good- the place feels very clean. Breakfast was great and as much as you can eat of Dutch, Continental or English fayre- we certainly eat our money's worth! All in all it was a perfect hotel stay and we will definitely be staying at the Bellevue next time we go to Amsterdam- it was the nicest place we have stayed at in the city( and we go a few times a year so we've tried a few hotels in our time!) HIGHLY RECOMMENDED....:)

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel! I stayed for 2 nights (April 20th and 21st) and could NOT have been happier. Yes it is small, but this is Europe, people. Americans want everything bigger and better. The bed was soft, the hotel was quiet, the staff was great, the location was good - literally a 2 minute walk from Centraal Station, The restaurant is quite nice. I spent very little time in my room anyway - I was walking around enjoying this lovely city. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: Andvale
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Bellevue from the 22nd up to the 25th of April 2006 and found the hotel to be great. True the lift can become crowded in peak hours and you need to be extra careful when taking a shower if you don't want the whole bathroom to become a pool, but these are minor drawbacks for this hotel. Housekeeping does a great job drying up the mess you leave behind, though. The rooms are small but very new and acoustically well isolated. The hotel position close to the central station is perfect for starting sightseeing tours of the city or of the surrounding towns. We found breakfast to be excellent even though space for guests is limited and on one occasion we were asked to wait for a table to be freed, which took not more than 5 minutes. Definitely we recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Bellevue was excellent!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I chose to go to Bellevue as I read had the positive reviews on this website so felt I should pay my dues and add my own review having had a fantastic time. Rooms were small, but clean, modern and the shower was brilliant. The only down-side was the room we were in was facing busy road where there were trams - but there was air-conditioning which solved the problem. Really central location, friendly staff - fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Just fine”
Reviews.Author: ceeljay
Reviews.Content: I don't have too much to add to what's been said, but am writing a review to keep the rating up. Excellent location; friendly service; rooms very small, but the layout is well-designed and having many small rooms is obviously what keeps the price low; I found the rooms to be very well soundproofed, perhaps it depends on your location in the hotel - we were in room 409; the bathrooms are trendy and minimalist but not very practical. We'd be happy to stay here again, but for a couple of nights maximum.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean, very central”
Reviews.Author: TheTravelGlutton
Reviews.Content: The location can't be beat if you're arriving with a lot of luggage into Central Station. It took me less than 45 minutes to the airport from my hotel room. Also fairly close to the Dam and redlight district, however, a bit of a trek to museums and nicer/quieter parts of the city so depends on the focus of your visit. I arrived at noon and was given a room before official check-in time and was grateful after a 12 hour flight from South Africa. I was also given an upgrade to a double-room so can't comment on the smaller rooms. The room was spotless and comfortable. Security was also very good; you can only get on the elevator with a room key. The restaurant was good for lunch (about 15 euro with a glass of wine) but I found breakfast over-priced and not very outstanding for 10 euro. Great value for 88 euro.

Reviews.Title: “It's small, but good access to train station.”
Reviews.Author: designjb
Reviews.Content: We only stayed for one night. We got in late and had to leave early the next day. So we wanted something with quick and easy access to the train station. This hotel was just fine if you want to get to the train station in a hurry. Rooms were rather small, but that's understasble for a European hotel room. The decore was a little funky, but we could appreciate it none the less. The Included breakfast was more than just pastries and cereal. The bathrooms are one big wetbath. Shower and the whole bathroom is going to be soaking wet. I don't understand who thought this design was practical. Remeber not to wear your socks in the bathroom once someone has showered. the room had some strange crackling noises, so we had to wear earplugs to sleep. But we were so exhausted we just crashed. Overal an OK place to stay. But it is small with very little room for luggage and belongings.

Reviews.Title: “Way Too SMALL!”
Reviews.Author: DivineDonald
Reviews.Content: A real postage stamp. The bathrooms suck. The shower has no curtain and sprays all over the toilet, sink and floor. Unacceptable. No room for clothes, suitcases, sitting! No dressers. Also unacceptable. Seriously small and claustrophobic. Unbelievable that people like this place. No view. You have to clean up the water on the floor or you will slip. You have to clean up the water on the toilet or you will sit on wet stuff. We were so disappointed and moved out. Like rats in a cage. Yes, it's new and safe. But unless you only sleep here, and never use the shower, it is best avoided. The bathroom measures two metres by three meters at most, the bedroom about twice that size. They have a wall mounted TV because there is no other place to put a TV. We tried to take a photo of the bathroom, but it was too small to fit in the viewfinder. The photo of the chair shows ALL of the available leisure space, before your suitcase takes it over. Perhaps this is just an American viewpoint, as the Europeans seem to love this place. We moved to the NH Grand Hotel Krasnapolsky and loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We selected the Bellevue Hotel after reading the reviews on Trip Advisor and we agree with the comments. We had the only 4 person room and can report that it was very spacious with 4 individual full sized beds, it was very clean and the bathroom was great. The only adverse comment we have on the room is that it was both close to the lift (which could be noisy late at night) and the Kitchen (which could be noisy in the morning), however, the positves definately outweighed the negatives, and we would happily stay again. The staff were friendly and helpful: and there is a locked room to store your luggage before check in and on your final day. Unlike some of your more recent reviews, we didn't rate the breakfasts as very good value and preferred going out and eating at other local cafes/bakeries. The hotel's position was brilliant for everything in Amsterdam, the Station, Boat Tours and all the main sites were under 5 minutes walk away.

Reviews.Title: “great find”
Reviews.Author: rtar
Reviews.Content: We read the reviews of the Bellevue before selecting it for our trip to Amsterdam. The reviews were accurate. We found the Bellevue to be a good central spot (5 minute walk from the train station). The rooms were clean and newly decorated. The price was good. We would definitely stay at the Bellevue again and recommend it for a good hotel that is not too expensive and in a great location for walking to all the key spots.

Reviews.Title: “A little gem of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: K1w1 traveller
Reviews.Content: We choose this hotel because of previous reviews and were not disappointed. We paid Â£89-00 per night for 2 of us (we stayed Sun 2nd April - Tues 4th April) which included breakfast. The hotel is in a good location, very close to the Central Railway Station which is the hub for the airport train, city trams, regional and international trains and a couple of canal boat operators. Even though the station is close you canâ€™t hear it. Our room was clean. The beds were very comfortable (two singles pushed together, very European) and the pillows were large and plump. Yes the room is clinical but modern and more than adequate for a hotel. We found the room very quiet and the only noises we heard were fellow guests talking as they passed our door and their doors closing. The breakfast was varied and fresh and the coffee/tea plentiful. If I had one complaint it was the receptionist who left us for 5 minutes in mid check-in to answer a telephone enquiry then when she returned to us we got a quick (seemed insincere) sorry. However the other receptionists we came across were very friendly and helpful. We would definitely stay in this hotel again. It was good value for money and well located. We found a gem of a restaurant not far from the hotel and ate there 2 nights out of 3. It is De Keuken van 1870, Spuistraat 4, Tel/Fax: (020) 624 8965. The food is basic Dutch, very large helpings and very cheaply priced. I had a Jazz night special 7.50 euros for 3 courses, mustard soup, lamb chops (4) with broccoli and large chips and pear tart to finish. All very nice home cooking. The bill for my dinner and my husbands 2 courses plus 4 beers was 23.50 euros. The clientele of the restaurant is mixed but it appeared to be mostly locals. The place had a really good buzz about it and the staff seemed to enjoy their jobs, spoke good English and were very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great find”
Reviews.Author: illini98
Reviews.Content: After weeks of searching for a hotel in Amsterdam, we finally decided on the Bellevue based on the reviews here. We were hoping for the charming, cheap, great breakfast, amazing location hotel that people wrote about, and that's exactly what we got. Definitely not luxury, but everything we needed for a great 3 night stay. We did not have any noise problems--our room faced the courtyard on the 5th floor, and we didn't hear a peep from our neighbors. A small room (which we expected) that was kept spotlessly clean and stocked with fresh towels & amenities. The breakfast was nice, but I'd only get it if it's included in the price. Amsterdam is a great walking city, and the Bellevue put us at the heart of everything (including all the tram lines if you don't feel like walking). Definitely quieter here at night (unless you head to the RLD or Damrak), so we spent a few evenings in Leidsplein for the lively atmosphere and ton of pubs to choose from. Amsterdam was beautiful and I'd recommend the Bellevue if you're watching your budget.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect base for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I came to Amsterdam for a two night break and knowing nothing about the city attempted to pick a half decent hotel in a good location. We chose the Belle Vue hotel from the reports on Trip Advisor an were not disappointed, in fact it exceeded our expectations. After stepping out of centraal station we were ready for navigating our way around the streets to find it but only had to cross the road and it there it was. And next to the oldest pub in the netherlands. Firstly we came early, about 8:00 am and even though 2pm is the check in time, they allowed us to check in and leave our baggage in a secure room allowing us to begin our holiday instantly. You'd think this was standard practice but it's not always the case with some hotels. Leaving the hotel we soon realised the great location right in the center, on the street parallel to the Damrak (good starting point) allowing you to access anywhere on foot. Niether my GF or I ever felt unsafe around the hotel. The room was cosy (size) yet still bigger than some I have stayed in and Very clean and modern if a little clinical in decor. The embedded flat screen TV a nice touch. Breakfast again was more than I've had before in European hotels including Cereal, croissants, bacon, sausage, eggs (boiled or scrambled), beans, fruit, juices tea coffee....etc We didn't eat here for dinner but the menu looked great and only 18 Euro's for 3 courses. The staff were all welcoming warm and friendly and I would not think twice about staying here again or reccomending it to someone thinking of visiting Amsterdam. As a base for a short break am pushed to find any down points.

Reviews.Title: “bellevue...what a complete joke”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: i read all these reviews and have to conclude that the bellevue must be a decent hotel. ITS JUST A PITY ABOUT THEIR CUSTOMER SERVICE! when i arrived at the bellevue i was told that i was booked into their sister hotel (sister! more like long lost drunken uncle hotel) the avenue... funny that, i thought i had booked the bellevue! i was given no explanation for this sudden change and just told to go up the street and that the price was cheaper because there was a free breakfast.. if i hadnt been stoned i would have started a fight, but anything for a quiet life.. to make matters worse when we went up the street to this so-called sister hotel we were charged an extra 100 euro for city tax on a 400 euro bill....unbelievable! well excuse me, but 5% of 400 is certainly not 100... the bellevue may win prizes for their decor but they certainly dont win any for their customer service....and their sister hotle the avenue dont win any prizes for anything as their rooms were shoeboxes with prison issue amenities.. do not book this hotel on the basis that you may not actually be booking it!!!! unbelievable!

Reviews.Title: “Not a thing wrong!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have a great fear of the chintzy kinds of guest houses that you find in touristy cities such as Amsterdam, and I have to say that the Bellevue was a refreshing change! On arrival at 10 am we checked straight in. Our room was ready and waiting, although it looked slightly clinical with everything in white, it was very stylish and provided a great base to explore Amsterdam. The bars, cafÃ©, shops, canals are a stones throw away, the views from the front rooms are amazing and breakfast was lovely. If you are looking to go to Amsterdam definitely book the Bellevue it wonâ€™t let you down, I would recommend it to anyone for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel- Plenty of facilities for the money, a comfy bed, and great service throughout our stay. The room was a little on the small side, but was very modern, and everything worked a treat. The location is great- right next to the station, and as Amsterdam is so small, within walking distance of everywhere! Would definately stay at this hotel if I went back to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “A wee jewel of a hotel. What more could you ask for?”
Reviews.Author: pitter
Reviews.Content: The Bellevue hotel felt like we had been blessed. Finally a hotel where everything was just perfect. the rooms were immaculate. Good TV and really comfy bed. Great wet room (took me a while to suss out that it actually was a wet room!!!) Safe in room, a couple of chairs and peace and quiet. The breakfasts were really nice and the cut off point for breakfast wasn't until 10am, which is great (especially when you've been out the night before!!!). The hotel is in a great location, just next to central station, close to all the touristy shops, coffee shops and dam square. Loads of takeaways places and restaurants. You want for nothing. Staff at the hotel were really polite and made you feel really welcome. Are more than happy to help you out in finding places (getting the right transport and train numbers etc) I would highly reccommend this hotel to couples, business people and families.

Reviews.Title: “Look no further than this hotel”
Reviews.Author: blight053
Reviews.Content: Well we read all the previous reviews and was very excited about staying in this newly renovated hotel. Everything was faultless, the service, the cleanliness, the good generous breakfast and the position in the city. For the money you cannot get better value. You feel very secure here, and something which is very useful are the in room safes, so that you can store all your valuables. We walked around Amsterdam many times and when you look at the other hotels available the Bellevue exceeds your expectations. Enjoy the hotel and the Amsterdam experience, we certainly did.

Reviews.Title: “Bellevue not to be Missed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Bellevue Hotel for three nights in February. My expectations were not high and I'm delighted to say I was pleasantly suprised. The hotel really is excellent. The rooms were spotlessly clean with comfortable beds an excellent bathroom (in our case Wet Room)and maid service could not have been better. The hotel brasserie where breafast is served is attractive and breafast itself is very good. The brasserie is also great for lunch or dinner at reasonable prices. All in all I would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Take the stress out of a trip to Amsterdam!”
Reviews.Author: Jigsawman
Reviews.Content: In the main Amsterdam is a short break destination for most travellers. In that case you want to reduce the journey time from home to hotel to as little as possible and that's where the Bellevue scores highly. It is literally no more than 5 minutes walk from the Centraal Station, in a good area with easy access to trams, restaurants, bars and shopping. The hotel itself was officially opened in October 2005 and is very clean and efficiently run. Even the onsite restaurant serves very good food at reasonable prices. All in all the Bellevue is a perfect hotel for visitors who want to visit Amsterdam and have a good standard of hotel at reasonable prices.

Reviews.Title: “Best Choice Possible for Amsterdam!”
Reviews.Author: r3db0x
Reviews.Content: As we stepped out of Centraal Station, worn and bewildered from our travels, we rubbed our eyes and in front of us stoof the welcoming glow of The Bellevue Hotel. Location is everything, and that's only the half of it. The rooms are magnificently clean and have unique design elements at every turn. Flatscreen tv with international channels, floor-to-ceiling abstract photographs on the walls, clean crisp Dutch design. The shower curtain? Let me tell you something about that situation. The showers in Europe are notoriously cramped and tiny. Coffin-like, in most cases. This bathroom is designed so that it can all get wet and will dry relatively quickly on its own. If you can handle bringing in your toiletries bag and brining it out again when you're finished, you won't miss the shower curtain. Instead, you will feel free to stretch out and take a rejuvinating shower with no restrictions or sticky, mildewy curtains to brush up against. Clausterphobics take note: you will love this shower! We didn't wake up in time for breakfast any day we were there, but we were always within twenty steps of a place to eat, drink, smoke, shop, stroll, or stare. The staff was courteous and educated, and when we left our "do not disturb" sign up during our entire stay, they left us a drawstring bag of fresh towels and toiletries hanging from our doorknob in the morning. Delightful service. Do yourself a favor and avoid all the usual stress that comes with finding your hotel upon arrival, or at the end of a long day of walking around town. Stay at The Bellevue Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Worthwhile”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights with a friend last August,centrally located with easy access to the city's main attractions, walking distance to the main attraction(I'm sure we all know what that is).I remember the sheets being sparkling and the room generally immaculately clean. Couldn't help but think the fact that it's relatively new contributed to this, hope the standards are maintained as I'll definitely be going back whenever I visit Amsterdam again, staff were also friendly. The buffet breakfast which is included in the rates was always something to look forward to. This hotel is highly recommended for anyone who doesn't want to pay ritz or waldorf astoria rates for a hotel but still wants a very comfortable stay.My friend and I agreed the hotel was one of the reasons our stay in Amsterdam was thouroughly enjoyable.Definitely worthwhile.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from the 27th January till the 29th January 2006. The rooms are a fair size, some larger then others but the main thing is, is that they are spotlessly clean and comfortable. We stayed in a twin room and the beds are quite comfortable with a tv, closet and bathroom, with a bath and shower. The maids came in everyday to clean too. Breakfast was included with our stay which composed of cold meats, cheeses, cereal, breads and scrambled eggs, bacon, tea, coffee, juice etc. We found the staff very friendly and a glass of Heineken in the hotel bar only cost â‚¬2.50. They also serve meals in the hotel restaurant in the evening. The location is perfect, opposite Central Station and close by to the shopping area and Damrak. All in all we really enjoyed our stay here and for a three star hotel in Amsterdam it was by far the best I've stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Bellevue located across the street from Centraal Station is an exceptional budget hotel. The location is excellent and is a very convenient base to explore the city. My teeny tiny single room had a comfortable bed, flat panel tv, opening window, chair, table, and wardrobe. The spacious bathroom is typical dutch with the drain on the floor. The shower was wonderful with a handheld spray and plenty of hot water. If you need a cheap place to stay with private bath that is CLEAN, quiet, and centrally located, give this place a shot. As long as you don't mind the small room you will be fine. Breakfast is not included and is expensive. I didn't try it because I went to my friends's mother's house for a true Dutch breakfast. I realize most visitors won't have that luxury but not to worry there is plenty to eat right outside.

Reviews.Title: “Bellevue to the Rescue”
Reviews.Author: piglet
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over New Year after checking out of the apartment we had booked and what a contrast. The apartment was filthy and not as described and after two nights I walked into the Bellevue reception on the off chance of room (I had seen good reviews and thought it was worth a try). As New Year was over we were lucky enough to get a room at a very reasonable price and the lady on reception held it for us while we checked out of our apartment. The hotel is only six months old and is modern in style with a very clean "Ikea" look. The room was wonderful - mostly white with a few splashes of colour and plenty of lighting which is rare in Europe. There was a flat screen TV with en-suite bathroom (bath and shower) and two twin beds (pushed together). The bed was really comfy and the sheets crisp and clean. The room was a good size with two chairs and ample storage space. The bathroom also has a decent hairdryer. Room service and laundry are available but we did not use them. The most important thing was it was clean and tidy and was cleaned (and towels changed) every day. We had a front facing room and although we could hear some street noise it did not keep us awake (I love the ding of the trams!). We were offered a back room if we wanted it. Breakfast is not included but is 10 euros each - we did not try this so I cannot comment. My husband did get a free coffee for me one morning though! The staff were very helpful and friendly and very understanding of our situation and I would definitley stay there again. This hotel is rated as a 3* but I would give it at least a 4* for service.

Reviews.Title: “Smart hotel at a smart price”
Reviews.Author: cpttraveller
Reviews.Content: After doing extensive research on hotels in Amsterdam, and reading other reviews on Tripadvisor, we opted for the Bellevue. What an excellent choice. All the other reviews are spot on. Really, if the only thing that one can complain about is the lack of a shower curtain, it says something about the hotel. Pros: - Wonderful, crisp, fresh, clean, uplifting rooms. - Absolutely quit! We could sleep all day without any disturbance! - Plasma tv. - Niice breakfast. - Very easy to get to from Central Station. - Very competitive price. Cons: - Not really much. The wet bathroom was cleaned nicely every day! - Don't be late for breakfast because you will not be helped (we saw some other disillusioned guests turned away after we fortunately made it!) - Wireless internet access is advertised on their brochures but according to the staff it must still be installed. If you like designer hotels and are on a slight budget, definitely choose the Bellevue! It is an excellent hotel!
